record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Mawāqif : manuscript / al-Sayyid al-Sharīf ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jurjānī.
record.note: Title from the head of some leaves in the manuscript and from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Incipit missing. Starts with: "... fī ḥaqīqat dhātihi, muttaṣif bi-ṣifāt al-jalāl, ay, al-ʻaẓamah. Yuqālu jalla fulān, idhā ʻaẓuma qadruhu. Wa-jalāl Allāh ʻaẓamatuhu, mubarraʼ ʻan shawāʼib al-naqṣ, jāmiʻ li-jihāt al-kamāl fī al-dhāt wa-al-ṣifāt wa-al-afʻāl, ghanī fī jamīʻ dhālik ʻammā siwāh, fa-lā yaḥtāju ilá shayʼ min al-ashyāʼ fīmā dhakarnāh, ʻālim bi-jamīʻ al-maʻlūmāt, li-mā sayaʼtī min anna al-muqtaḍá li-ʻilm khuṣūṣīyat dhātihi, wa-al-muṣaḥḥiḥ lil-maʻlūmīyah dhawāt al-mafhūmāt. Wa-lā shakka anna nisbat dhātihi ilá jamīʻihā sawāʼ, fa-wajaba ʻumūm ʻilmihi īyāhā, fa-lā yaʻzubu ʻan ʻilmihi mithqāl dharrah fī al-arḍ wa-lā fī al-samāʼ, ay, lā yabʻudu wa-lā yaghību ʻanhu aqall qalīl ..."
Secundo folio: inna al-ḥifẓ wa-al-qirāʼah wa-al-kitābah.
18.3 x 28 cm; written surface: 12 x 21 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In red leather binding with flap; covers tooled with geometric designs and embossed with central medallion.
In medium naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red, many notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of some leaves: "Sharḥ al-Mawāqif."

At the left margin of the copyist's colophon: "Wa-kataba hādhihi al-tadhkirah al-ajall Mawlānā wa-awlānā, sayyid al-muḥaqqiqīn al-mufassirīn, wa-al-mudarris, kashāf al-mushkilāt, ḥallāl al-muʻḍilāt, rukn al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, jamāl [...] Mawlānā [... ... ...] ballaghahu Allāh ilá al-kamāl al-ʻilmī bi-anwār luṭfihi al-khafī, bi-Muḥammad al-ʻArabī."

On folio 302b: An excerpt (in nineteen lines) from "al-Risālah al-Mirʼātīyah" (Mirror epistle) of al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī. Starts with: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Nāẓir fī al-mirʼāh rubbamā kāna mutawajjihan ilá al-ṣuwar al-manqūshah al-marsūmah fīhā wa-munshaghilan bi-hā bāḥithan ʻan aḥwālihā bi-ḥaythu yaghfulu ʻan al-mirʼāh wa-mā lahā min ṣifātihā wa-ṣiqālihā wa-istiwāʼ waḍʻ ajzāʼihā wa-ghayr dhālika min aḥkāmihā ..."
On folio 302b: A reader's statement about the birth of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá ibn Ḥājjī Ḥasan, on Thursday night, 20 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 874 of the Hijrah (6 October, 1469).

Author's colophon: "Qāla al-muʼallif: Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir al-kalām min Kitāb al-Mawāqif. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh taʻālá an yuthbita qalbanā ʻalá dīnih, wa-lā yazīgha baʻda al-hidāyah, wa-yaʻṣimanā ʻan al-ghiwāyah ... Wa-anā aqūlu: Hādhā mā tayassar lanā, bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih min kashf mushkilātih wa-tawḍīḥ muʻḍilātih ... muʻriḍīn ʻan al-iṭnāb al-mukhill [al-mumill] wa-al-ījāz al-mukhill ... nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi al-ṭālibīn wa-jaʻalahu dhukhran lanā Yawm al-Dīn. Innahu khayr muwaffiq wa-muʻīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author said: Let this be the end of the discourse on Kitāb al-Mawāqif. We beseech the Almighty God to consolidate our heart on His religion, so that it will not go astray after being guided, and to protect us from seduction ... I say: This is what was facilitated to us by the help of God and his abundant benevolence, to solve the problems of [al-Mawāqif] and to explain its difficulties ... having avoided the boring lengthiness and the improper brevity ... May God benefit by it the seekers, and make it a provision for us on Judgment Day. He is the One who prospers and helps us most."

Copyist's colophon: "Jaffa al-qalam wa-faragha ʻan taʻlīq hādhā al-durar al-sharīf wa-al-ghurar al-laṭīf waqt al-ẓuhr, yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, al-thānī ʻashar min Rajab al-aṣamm, al-wāqiʻ fī shuhur Ḥijjat al-thalāthah wa-al-ʻishrīn wa-thamānimaiʼah al-Hijrīyah al-Muṣṭafawīyah. Wa-qad tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah min yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-naḥīf, al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-laṭīf, ʻAlī ibn Isḥāq, ghafara Allāh lahumā, tilmīdh min talāmīdh Badr al-Dīn ibn Mubārak al-mashhūr bi-Imām ʻAlī Bāshā, razaqahu Allāh mā yurīdu wa-mā yashāʼ. Āmīn. Bi-luṭfika wa-karamik. Ḥāmidian wa-muṣallīyan ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn, wa-sallama taslīman dāʼiman abadan kathīran kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Tamm."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The pen dried out and is emptied from copying this [these] honorable jewels and pleasant dainties, at noon-time, Wednesday, 12 Rajab, 823 of the Hijrah of the Chosen Prophet [1 August, 1420]. This honorable copy was completed by the hand of the poor and feeble servant, who is in need of the mercy of his kind Lord, ʻAlī son of Isḥāq, may God forgive both of them, one of the students of Badr al-Dīn ibn Mubārak, known as Imām ʻAlī Bāshā, may God grant him what he wants and wishes. Amen. By Your kindness and Your generosity. Praise be to God. May prayers be on His Prophet Muḥammad, and on all his good and pure family, and grant them abundant, continuous and everlasting peace. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe. Praise be to God alone. It is completed."

record.title: 880-01 al-Durr al-manẓūm : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-maḥmūd bi-kull lisān, al-karīm al-mannān, al-dāʼim al-iḥsān, al-ʻaẓīm al-sulṭān, al-mūʻid li-man aṭāʻahu bi-al-jinān, wa-li-man ʻaṣāhu bi-al-nīrān, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Rasūlihi al-mukhtār, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-abrār wa-al-muṣṭafayn al-akhyār. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb yaʻdhubu lil-masāmiʻ, wa-yazīdu fī ʻaql al-adīb al-bāriʻ, wa-yantaqilu min al-suṭūr ilá al-ṣudūr, wa-yarwī kalāmahu bi-al-durr al-manẓūm, dhakartu fīhi fuṣūlan gharāʼib al-alfāẓ allatī yaḥmulu al-adīb īrādahā, wa-yusirru al-qalb qurbuhā, kamā yuḥzinu al-khāṭir ibʻāduhā, wa-ilá Allāh arghabu fī al-tawfīq ..."
Secundo folio: baʻḍ al-ʻulamāʼ ashqá al-nās.
13.5 x 18.3 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red, some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Durr al-manẓūm, wa-huwa ʻaẓīm al-qadr wa-al-shān, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi."

Colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "It is concluded by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, thoroughly and completely. Praise be to God in all circumstances. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-01 Ṣuḥuf Ghāthādīmū al-Nabī : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ṣaḥīfah al-ūlá. Yā nafs taṣawwarī wa-tamaththalī mā anā mūriduhu ʻalayki min al-maʻānī al-ʻaqlīyah al-mawjūdah wujūdan dāʼiman, fa-mā taṣawwartīhi fa-qad ʻaqaltīhi wa-tayaqqantīhi li-tayaqqunuki anna al-ḥayāh jins yanbūʻ al-insān wa-anna al-mawt min jins yanbūʻ al-jism, ka-tayaqqunuki ayḍan anna al-mustawī ghayr al-muʻwajj, wa-anna al-kullī aʻẓam min al-juzʼ, wa-anna al-māʼ yarwī min al-ʻaṭash, wa-annahu bārid raṭb bi-al-ṭabʻ, wa-anna al-nār taḥruqu wa-tunḍiju wa-annahā ḥārrah yābisah bi-al-ṭabʻ ..."
Secundo folio: al-mumaththalah fī al-ḥāʼiṭ ʻalá wujūd al-muṣawwir.
13 x 17 cm; written surface: 10 x 13 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In yellow cardboard binding with flap.
In beautiful naskh script (scriptures style), fully vocalized; in black ink, on thick white paper; headings in red; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover a title is written in pencil: "The book of Enoch."
On folio 1a: "Ṣuḥuf Ghāthādīmū al-Nabī, ʻalayhi al-salām. Wa-Idrīs tilmīdh la-hu. Wa-hiya arbaʻ ʻashar ṣaḥīfah. Kulluhā mukhāṭabah lil-nafs."
On folio 1a: A partially readable ownership statement: "Dakhala fī mulk al-ʻabd al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr [... ... ... ... ...].

The text ends with: "... Fa-yā nafs, mā aʻẓama ḥasarātiki, idh tanṭuqīn fa-lā tajidīna sāmiʻan, wa-tabuththīna al-shakwá fa-lā tajidīna rāḥiman. Fa-layta shiʻrī, thumma layta shiʻrī, mā gharra li-man aṣbaḥa gharīban ʻan waṭanih bāyinan ʻan aṣlih, baʻīdan ʻan aṣlih wa-nabʻatih, qad awthaqahu hawāhu, wa-ḥāqa bi-hi istithmār zalalih wa-khaṭāh, maḥmūlan ʻalá markab al-gharar wa-al-sahw, maqrūnan bi-madhallat al-taladhdhudh wa-al-lahw."
Colophon (written In a different hand): "Tammat al-ṣuḥuf al-arbaʻata ʻashar. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."
Translation of the colophon: "The fourteen tablets are concluded. Praise be to God."

record.title: 880-02 al-Arbaʻūn Ḥadīthan : manuscript / Abū Zakarīyā Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title of al-Arabaʻūn Ḥadīthan from printed versions.
Title of Bāb al-Ishārāt ilá ḍabṭ alfāẓ al-mushkilāt from incipit (folio 10b).
Title of Urjūzah fīman jamaʻa al-Qurʼān al-ʻAẓīm from folio 15a.
Title of Qawāʻid al-tajwīd lil-Qurʼān al-Majīd from folio 17a.
Title of Muntakhab al-Maḥṣūl fī uṣūl al-fiqh supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-Arabaʻūn Ḥadīthan: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Qayyūm al-samāwāt wa-al-araḍīn, mudabbir al-khalāʼiq ajmaʻīn, bāʻith al-rusul, ṣalawāt Allāh wa-salāmuhu ʻalayhim, ilá al-mukallafīn li-hidāyatihim wa-bayān sharāʼiʻ al-dīn bi-al-dilālāt al-qaṭʻīyah wa-wāḍiḥāt al-barāhīn ..."

Incipit of Bāb al-Ishārāt ilá ḍabṭ alfāẓ al-mushkilāt: "Bāb al-Ishārāt ilá ḍabṭ alfāẓ al-mushkilāt. Hādhā al-bāb wa-in tarjamtuhu bi-al-mushkilāt, faqad unabbihu ʻalá alfāẓ min al-wāḍiḥāt. Fī al-khuṭbah: Naḍara Allāh imraʼan, ruwiya bi-tashdīd al-Ḍād wa-bi-takhfīfihā, wa-al-tashdīd akthar, wa-maʻnāhu ḥassanahu wa-jammalah ..."

Incipit of Urjūzah fīman jamaʻa al-Qurʼān al-ʻAẓīm: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, khātim al-nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-iʻlam, waffaqanī Allāh wa-īyāka wa-sāʼir al-Muslimīn li-mā yuḥibbu wa-yarḍá min al-qawl wa-al-ʻamal fī ʻāfiyah, anna awwal man tatabbaʻa al-Qurʼān wa-jamaʻahu, fī zaman Abī Bakr, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, bi-amrihi Zayd ibn Thābit al-Anṣārī tatabbuʻ al-Qurʼān wa-jamʻihi fī al-ʻusub wa-al-riqāʻ wa-al-likhāf wa-ṣudūr al-rijāl ..."

Incipit of Qawāʻid al-tajwīd lil-Qurʼān al-Majīd: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā mukhtaṣar nāfiʻ fī aḥkām al-tajwīd, al-nūn al-sākinah wa-al-tanwīn wa-al-madd wa-al-qaṣr, jamaʻtuhu tabṣirah lil-mubtadī wa-tadhkirah lil-muntahī. Fa-al-nūn al-sākinah tathbutu lafẓan wa-khaṭṭan wa-waṣlan wa-waqfan, mutawassiṭah wa-mutaṭarrifah ..."

Incipit of Muntakhab al-Maḥṣūl fī uṣūl al-fiqh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá naʻmāʼihi, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad khātim anbiyāʼihi. Qāla imām al-ʻaṣr, awḥad al-zamān, al-dāʻī ilá Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Rāzī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu, wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu: Hādhā mukhtaṣar fī uṣūl al-fiqh intakhabtuhu min kitāb al-Maḥṣūl, wa-rattabtuhu ʻalá muqaddimah wa-fuṣūl. Ammā al-muqaddimah, fa-fī tafsīr uṣūl al-fiqh. Iʻlam anna al-aṣl huwa al-muḥtāj ilayhi, wa-ammā al-fiqh, fa-huwa fī aṣl al-lughah, ʻibārah ʻan fahm gharaḍ al-mutakallim min kalāmihi, wa-fī iṣṭilāḥ al-ʻulamāʼ ʻibārah ʻan al-ʻilm bi-al-aḥkām al-sharʻīyah al-ʻamalīyah al-mustadall ʻalá aʻyānihā ..."
Secundo folio of al-Arabaʻūn Ḥadīthan: fī zumrat al-ʻulamāʼ wa-al-fuqahāʼ.
Secundo folio of Bāb al-Ishārāt ilá ḍabṭ alfāẓ al-mushkilāt: man summiya Amīr al-Muʼminīn.
Secundo folio of Urjūzah fīman jamaʻa al-Qurʼān al-ʻAẓīm: ilayki fa-arsalat ilayhi.
Secundo folio of Qawāʻid al-tajwīd lil-Qurʼān al-Majīd: manaʻa wa-mathalan mā baʻūḍah.
Secundo folio of Muntakhab al-Maḥṣūl fī uṣūl al-fiqh: immā an lā yakūna li-mūjib.
14 x 20.7 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In cardboard binding (front cover missing).

In fair naskh/ruqʻah and good naskh scripts (in different hands), in black ink, on thick white paper; headings and markings in red, some notes and corrections on the margins; some texts fully vocalized; some catchwords; no catchwords in Muntakhab al-Maḥṣūl fī uṣūl al-fiqh.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Arbaʻīn al-Ḥadīth taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah al-Imām wa-al-ṣiddīq al-humām, walī Allāh bi-lā nizāʻ, wa-muḥarrir madhhab al-Shāfiʻī bi-lā difāʻ, Muḥyī al-Dīn, Abū Zakarīyā, Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawāwī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu, wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu, wa-askanahu fasīḥ al-jinān, bi-jāh Sayyid walad ʻadnān. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 17a: "Kitāb Qawāʻid al-tajwīd lil-Qurʼān al-Majīd, wa-hiya ʻaẓīmah nāfiʻah."
On folio 20a: "Kitāb fī al-uṣūl lil-Fakhr al-Rāzī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn."

On folio 20a: Three ownership statements, as follows: "Ṣāra hādhā al-kitāb mulkan lil-muftaqir ilá ʻafw Allāh taʻālá ʻAlī ibn Yūnus ibn [... ... ... ...] bi-mubāyaʻah ṣaḥīḥah, fī Ṣafar, sanat ithnatay ʻashrata wa-sabʻimiʼh, wa-ḥarrara hādhihi al-kalimāt ṣāḥibuhu al-mūmá ilayhi fī tārīkhihi, ḥāmidan wa-muṣallīyan." "Intaqala ilá kātib al-ḥurūf bi-mubāyaʻah ṣaḥīḥah sharʻīyah. Wa-al-ān malakahu taḥrīran fī thāmin Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat thamān wa-ʻishrīn wa-sabʻimiʼah, bi-khaṭṭih." "Sāqatʹhu al-nawbah ilá al-ʻabd al-khāṭī al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Wadūd, ʻAlī ibn Maḥmūd al-Ḥāfiẓ [... ... ... ... ... ...]."

Colophon of al-Arabaʻūn Ḥadīthan: "Qāla [al-muʼallif], raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Fa-hādhā ākhir mā qaṣadʹtuhu min bayān al-Aḥādīth allatī jamaʻat qawāʻid al-Islām, wa-taḍammanat mā lā yuḥṣá min anwāʻ al-ʻulūm fī al-uṣūl wa-al-furūʻ, wa-al-ādāb, wa-sāʼir wujūh al-aḥkām. Tammat al-Arbaʻīn al-Ḥadīth, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon of al-Arbaʻūn Ḥadīthan: "[The author], may God be pleased with him, said: This is the end of what I aimed to demonstrate, concerning the Ḥadīths which sum up the doctrines of Islam, comprising innumerable kinds of sciences (the fundamental and the subsidiary), the decorum, and the rest of the different rules of conduct. The Forty Ḥadiths are concluded. God is the granter of what is true, to Him is the reference and the returning. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

Colophon of Bāb al-Ishārāt ilá ḍabṭ alfāẓ al-mushkilāt: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tammat al-Ishārāt, baʻda al-ṣalāh ʻalá Sayyid al-Sādāt ... Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, thalāthīn tamām shahr Shaʻbān, sanat 160 [laʻallahā 1160?], wa-dhālika bi-khaṭṭ al-faqīr ilá Allāh, al-muqirr bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Sālim ibn Aḥmad ibn Barakāt al-Juwaynī (nasaban) al-Ḥaḍramī baladn wa-al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban ... Subḥāna Rabbika Rabb al-ʻIzzah ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of Bāb al-Ishārāt ilá ḍabṭ alfāẓ al-mushkilāt: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To him is the reference and the returning. al-Ishārāt is completed, following the prayer on the Master of Masters [Prophet Muḥammad] ... Copied on blessed Sunday, the thirtieth, that is, the end of Shaʻbān, the year 160 [probably 1160?], by the handwriting of the poor to God, who confesses his sin and inadequacy, Sālim ibn Aḥmad ibn Barakāt al-Juwaynī (nasaban) al-Ḥaḍramī baladn wa-al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban ... Praise be to God, Almighty, far is He from what they ascribe [to Him]. May peace be upon the messengers. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe."

Colophon of Urjūzah fīman jamaʻa al-Qurʼān al-ʻAẓīm: No colophon. Ends with: "... hākadhā naqalahu al-Imām al-Bayhaqī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Kadhā fī al-Burhān, fa-istafid dhālika wa-iʻlamhu, fa-innahu muhimm. Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam."

Colophon of Qawāʻid al-tajwīd lil-Qurʼān al-Majīd: No colophon. Ends with: "... wa-madd lāzim, naḥwa dābbah, wa-madd ʻāriḍ, wa-huwa mā yaʻruḍu lil-waqf, wa-muttaṣil wa-munfaṣil. Tamm. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Colophon of Muntakhab al-Maḥṣūl fī uṣūl al-fiqh: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-lammā baṭula dhālik thabuta anna al-kull iḥtajjū bi-umūr: al-Awwal, law kānat hādhihi al-ṣīghah lil-ʻumūm la-kāna istiʻmāluhā fī al-ʻahd bi-ṭarīq al-ishtirāk ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣabbān ʻalá Sharḥ al-Ushmūnī ʻalá Alfīyat Ibn Mālik : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
record.note: Title from printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naḥmaduka Allāhumma ʻalá mā wajjahta naḥwanā min sawābigh al-niʻam, wa-nashkuruka ʻalá mā aẓharta la-nā min mubhamāt al-asrār wa-muḍmarāt al-ḥikam, wa-nashhadu an lā ilāha illā anta waḥdaka, lā sharīka lak, al-fāʻil li-kull mubtadaʼ wa-mubtadaʻ, wa-nashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammad ʻabduka wa-rasūluk, al-mufrad al-ʻalam wa-al-imām al-muttabaʻ ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī al-ghufrān Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān, ghafara Allāh dhunūbah wa-satara fī al-dārayn ʻuyūbah: Hādhihi ḥawāshin sharīfah, wa-taqrīrāt jalīlah munīfah, wa-taḥqīqāt fāyiqah, wa-tadqīqāt rāʼiqah, khadamtu bi-hā sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah Nūr al-Dīn Abī al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ushmūnī al-Shāfiʻī ʻalá Alfīyat al-Imām Ibn Mālik kull al-khidmah, wa-ṣaraftu fī taḥrīr mabānīhā wa-tahdhīb maʻānīhā jamīʻ al-himmah ..."
Secundo folio: kamā fī aḥmadu Rabbī Allāh.
16.8 x 23.2 cm; written surface: 12 x 18 cm; 27 lines per page.

Binding: In light brown leather binding with flap (in 66 unnumbered quires); cover and flap tooled with geometric design and embossed with central medallions; the codex is encased in a leather case with flap and light blue ribbon to pull the flap out.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the label of the flap of the case, reads: "Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Ṣabbān ʻalá Sharḥ al-Alfīyah."

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah, khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān, ghafara Allāh la-hu dhunūbah wa-satara ʻuyūbah. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhā: Kāna al-farāgh min raqm hādhihi al-ḥāshiyah ḍaḥwat yawm al-Thalāth, li-arbaʻ ʻashar laylah maḍat min Ṣafar, sanat 1193, thalāth wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, ʻalá yad muʼallifihā al-faqīr ilá ʻafw Mawlāh, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān, ʻāmalahumā Allāh bi-mazīd al-iḥsān. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ghafara Allāh li-kātib hādhihi al-ḥāshiyah, wa-li-wālidayh, wa-li-kull [man] daʻā la-hum bi-al-maghfirah wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author said: This gloss was completed on Tuesday morning, fourteen nights having passed from Ṣafar, the year 1193 [3 March, 1779], by the hand of its author, the poor to the forgiveness of his Lord, Muḥammad son of ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān, may God treat both of them with ample kindness. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and the returning. May God forgive the copyist of this gloss, his parents, all those who beseech God to forgive them and all Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣafatī ʻalá sharḥ Ibn Turkī ʻalá al-ʻAshmāwīyah : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī faqqaha fī al-dīn man ikhtārahau min ʻibādihi, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah, lā sharīka la-hu, shahādatan tūṣilunā ilá ṭarīq rashādih. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammad ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh al-amīn, al-qāʼil: Man yurid Allāh bi-hi khayran yufaqqihhu fī al-dīn ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu asīr al-shahawāt wa-kathīr al-masāwī wa-al-hafawāt ʻabduhu Yūsuf ibn al-Shaykh Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī, aḥsana Allāh ʻilmahu wa-ballaghahu fī al-dārayn amalah: Hādhihi kalimāt qalīlah ʻalá sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah Ibn Turkī ʻalá al-ʻAshmāwīyah ..."
Secundo folio: alā tará anna asmāʼ al-suwar.
16.7 x 24 cm; written surface: 11 x 19.5 cm; 27 lines per page.

Binding: In a red buckram cover, tooled with geometric design (in twenty numbered quires). The cover might have been taken from another manuscript; front cover has a label which reads: "al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ min Sīrat al-Malik Sayf ibn Dhū al-Yazan, wa-huwa khamsat ajzāʼ."
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of Ibn Turkī are preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; some marking in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Fa-hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh al-Ṣafat [al-Ṣafatī] ʻalá al-tamām wa-kamāl [wa-al-kamāl], wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhā: Wa-kāna al-farāgh min jamʻihā yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, sābiʻ ʻashar Jumād al-Awwal, sanat 1291 [1191], iḥdá wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. Wa-kāna dhālika bi-Masjid Sayyidinā al-Ḥusayn, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-ʻannā bi-hi, wa-ʻan Āl Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn. Wa-Allāh asʼal an yanfaʻa bi-hā kamā nafaʻa bi-uṣūlihā an yajʻalahā khāliṣah li-wajhihi al-karīm wa-sababan li-ruʼyatihi fī Jinān al-Naʻīm. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The author said: It [the treatise] was compiled on blessed Monday, 17 Jumād al-Awwal, 1291 [1191 of the Hijrah = 23 June, 1777], at the Mosque of Sayyidunā al-Ḥusayn, may God be pleased with him, and with us through him, and with all the household of the Messenger of God. I beseech God to make it useful as He made useful its origins, and to accept it candidly, for the sake of His noble face, and to render it a cause to see Him in the Gardens of Bliss. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace until Judgement Day."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-Ḥāshiyah al-mubārakah yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, khamsata ʻashar yawman khalat min shahr al-Ḥijjah alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1255, alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sittah [wa-khamsah] wa-khamsīn min al-Hijrah al-Nubūwah [al-Nabawīyah] ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm. Wa-kātibuhā al-faqīr lillāh taʻālá Muḥammad al-Dusūqī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This blessed Gloss was copied on blessed Friday, 15 al-Ḥijjah, 1255 [19 February, 1840] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon him, by the poor to God Almighty, its copyist, Muḥammad al-Dusūqī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims, through His favor and generosity. Amen. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, and grant them peace.

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Kātī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Bardaʻī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu li-man ḥamduhu aḥsan kull al-maqūl, wa-shukruhu ashraf mā yakhtaliju fī al-ʻuqūl, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad al-maqbūl, alladhī lam yatamayyal ilayhi al-juhūl. Wa-baʻd, fa-jamaʻtu hādhihi al-ḥawāshī lil-mubtadiʼīn, bi-istiʻānat al-Qādir, min al-kutub, maʻa ḍamm mā lāḥa li-bālī al-fātir. Wa-mā faʻaltu hādhihi illā iʻtimādan ʻalá ighmāḍ al-abṣār min mawāqiʻ al-anẓār ..."
Secundo folio: bi-al-jinān wa-al-shukr bi-al-aʻḍāʼ.
13.2 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 10.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding; back cover missing.

In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the commentary of al-Kātī preceded by the word "qāla" (he said), and the gloss with the word "aqūlu" (I say); the text on the opening pages (folios 4b-5a) is framed in gold and black; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover: "Sharḥ Badʻī [Bardaʻī] ʻalá al-Ḥusām Kātī."
On folio 3a: "Bardaʻī maʻa Īsāghūjī. Qīmat 120."
On folios 3b-4a: Four magic squares.
On folio 4a: "Hādhihi Kitāb Bardaʻī."
On folio 4a: Ownership statement: "Min kutub al-dāʻī Sulaymān Shaykhī. 1180 [1766/1767]. L 8 [?]."
Text folios 4b-20b.
On folios 21a-22a: Four magic squares.
Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon: "The book is concluded by the help of God the Abundant Giving King."

record.title: 880-02 al-Fawāʼid al-muzʹhirah fī sharḥ al-Durrah al-muntaḍirah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi astaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī yaʻfū ʻan al-sayyiʼāt bi-faḍlihi, wa-yaḥkumu fī jamīʻ al-anām dunyā wa-ukhrá bi-ʻadlihi, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad al-mabʻūth raḥmatan wa-hudan, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna awṣalū al-aḥkām, fa-zāla bihim ʻannā al-radá. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad ṭalab minnī baʻḍ al-afāḍil al-kirām an ashraḥ al-Durrah al-muntaḍirah fī al-maʻfū min al-najāsāt lil-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-ḥabr al-humām Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad al-Shurunbulālī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh al-Raḥmān ... wa-sammaytuhu al-Fawāʼid al-muzʹhirah fī sharḥ al-Durrah al-muntaḍirah ..."
Secundo folio: bi-al-ṣifāt al-qadīmah al-khāliq lil-ʻālam.
10.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Durrah al-muntaḍirah" of al-Shurunbulāli in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi al-Fawāʼid al-muzʹhirah fī sharḥ al-Durrah al-muntaḍirah lil-ʻabd al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī, ḥafiẓahu Allāh. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqafa hādhā al-sharḥ Ustādhunā al-ʻallāmah wa-al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Imām al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá wa-al-dāll ʻalayhi muʼallifuhu Sayyidī Aḥmad ibn al-fahhāmah al-awḥad al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī al-Badrāwī, ʻalá man yantafiʻu bi-hi min ṭalabat al-ʻilm bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar. Taqabbala Allāh minhu dhālik wa-athābahu al-thawāb al-jazīl. Laʻana Allāh man ghayyarah. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: A lavish praise for the book and its author by the handwriting of Muḥammad ibn Sālim al-Ḥifnāwī al-Shāfiʻī (Ḥifnī, Muḥammad ibn Sālim, 1689 or 1690-1767 or 1768), dated beginning of Ṣafar, 1174 (12 September, 1760), stamped with al-Ḥifnāwī's seal.
On folio 46b: Five verses of poetry praising the book and its author, by Ibrāhīm al-Suwayqī al-Shāfiʻī, a student of the author, al-Sujāʻī.

al-Shurunbulālī's treatise starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tafaḍḍalā // fa-sahhala al-amra alladhī qad aʻḍalā ..." And ends with: "Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣuḥbi wa-kulli mūmini // mā dāma sulṭānu mufīḍi al-minani."

Author's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tabyīḍihi yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, li-arbaʻ khalat min Shawwāl alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-thalāth wa-sabʻīn, aḥsana Allāh khitāmahā bi-mannihi wa-karamih, wa-ghafara lanā wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Sanat 1173."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The treatise was composed on blessed Monday, four nights having passed from Shawwāl, the year 1173 [20 May, 1760], may God ends it well, by His grace and generosity. May He forgive us and the Muslims. Amen. The year 1173."

record.title: 880-02 al-Wasīlah ilá kashf al-ʻAqīlah : manuscript / ʻAlam al-Dīn Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sakhāwī.
record.note: Title of al-Wasīlah ilá kashf al-ʻAqīlah from folio 1a.
Title of Tawḍīḥ Nukhbat al-fikar fī muṣṭalaḥ ahl al-athar from colophon (folio 130a).
Title of Lumaʻ al-adillah fī qawāʻid Ahl al-Sunnah from folio 132a.
Title of Qawāʻid wa-al-ḍawābiṭ wa-uṣūl muhimmah wa-maqāṣid maṭlūbāt from folio 141a.
Title of al-Īmān wa-al-Islām hal humā makhlūqān aw ghayr makhlūqayn from incipit (folio 145a).
Title of Sharḥ Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ supplied by cataloger.
Title of Kashf al-awhām ʻan aḥwāl al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām from icipit (folio 155b/156a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-Wasīlah ilá kashf al-ʻAqīlah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-ʻallāmah muftī al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, imām al-qadā wa-baqīyat ahl al-adā, farīd dahrih wa-waḥīd ʻaṣrih, ʻAlam al-Dīn Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sakhāwī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī bad [badaʼa] al-minan wa-aʻādahā, wa-asbagha al-niʻam wa-afādahā, wa-alhama al-nufūs ghīyahā wa-rashādahā, wa-madda al-iḥsān, wa-ʻallama mā lā yaʻlamu al-insān, wa-manaḥahu al-yad wa-al-lisān ..."
Secundo folio for al-Wasīlah ilá kashf al-ʻAqīlah: shāhid al-awwal fa-matá aradʹta.

Incipit of Tawḍīḥ Nukhbat al-fikar fī muṣṭalaḥ ahl al-athar: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lam yazal ʻāliman qadīran, ḥayyan, qayyūman, samīʻan, baṣīran. Wa-ashhadu a[n] lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah, lā sharīka lah, wa-ukabbiruhu takbīrā. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī arsalahu lil-nās kāffatan bashīran wa-nadhīran, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna al-taṣānīf fī iṣṭilāḥ ahl al-Ḥadīth qad kathurat lil-aʼimmah fī al-qadīm wa-al-ḥadīth, fa-min awwal man ṣannaf fī dhālik al-Qāḍī Abū Muḥammad al-Rāmhurmuzī fī kitābihi al-Muḥaddith al-fāḍil ..."
Secundo folio for Tawḍīḥ Nukhbat al-fikar fī muṣṭalaḥ ahl al-athar: bi-sayrihi fa-lā yaḥṣurukum nāẓim.

Incipit of Lumaʻ al-adillah fī qawāʻid Ahl al-Sunnah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ḥalīm, al-fāṭir al-ḥakīm, alladhī wajaba la-hu al-qidam, wa-istaḥāla fī taʻālīhi ʻan waṣmat taḥwīz al-ʻadam, mubīd al-ḍalālah, mūḍiḥ al-ḥaqq bi-wāḍiḥāt al-dalālah. Hādhā, wa-qad istadʻaytuhu, arshadakum Allāh, dhikr lumaʻ min al-adillah fī qawāʻid Ahl al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah, fa-istakhartu Allāh taʻālá fī isʻāfikum bi-munākum, wa-Allāh al-mustaʻān, wa-ʻalayhi al-tikklān ..."
Secundo folio of Lumaʻ al-adillah fī qawāʻid ahl al-Sunnah: illā al-jawhar wa-al-dalīl.

Incipit of Qawāʻid wa-ḍawābiṭ wa-uṣūl muhimmah wa-maqāṣid maṭlūbāt: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá āl Muḥammad, ʻabdiki wa-rasūlik, al-Nabī al-ummī, wa-azwājihi, wa-dhurrīyatihi, kamā ṣallayta ʻalá Ibrāhīm wa-ʻalá āl Ibrāhīm, fī al-ʻālamīn. Innaka ḥamīdun majīd ... Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi Qawāʻid wa-al-ḍawābiṭ wa-uṣūl muhimmah wa-maqāṣid maṭlūbāt, yaḥtāju ilayhā ṭālib al-madhhab, bal, al-ʻilm muṭlaqan, wa-lā yastaghnī ʻan mithlihā min ahl al-fiqh illā al-muqtaṣirūn ʻalá al-rusūm, wa-al-maqṣūd bi-hā bayān al-qawāʻid al-jāmiʻah wa-al-ḍawābiṭ al-muṭṭaridāt wa-jamīʻ al-masāʼil al-mutashābihāt, wa-al-tamassuk bi-furūʻ mustakhrajah min aṣl wa-mabnīyah ʻalayh ..."
Secudo folio of Qawāʻid wa-al-ḍawābiṭ wa-uṣūl muhimmah wa-maqāṣid maṭlūbāt: lāzim fī ḥaqq al-rāhin.

Incipit of al-Īmān wa-al-Islām hal humā makhlūqān aw ghayr makhlūqayn: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh Abū Isʹḥāq al-Tūnisī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Saʼalanī baʻḍ ikhwānī al-rāghibīn fī ṭalab al-ʻilm ʻan al-Īmān wa-al-Islām hal humā makhlūqān aw ghayr makhlūqayn, fa-ajabtuhum ilá dhālik, ṭāliban lil-thawāb min al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Ammā al-īmān wa-al-Islām, fa-qad ikhtalafa al-ʻulamāʼ, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum, fīhimā. Wa-lākin aṣl al-īmān ghayr makhlūq, li-anna aṣlahu min Allāh ..."
Secundo folio of al-Īmān wa-al-Islām hal humā makhlūqān aw ghayr makhlūqayn: wa-ʻamal bi-lā nīyah wa-ammā al-īmān.

Incipit of Sharḥ Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Qāla Shaykhunā wa-qudwatunā ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-muḥaqqiq al-mudaqqiq, lisān al-mutakallimīn, ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn, qāmiʻ al-mubtadiʻīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, muftī al-Muslimīn, Abū al-ʻAbbās Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad ibn Ḥamzah al-Ramlī al-Anṣārī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-ṣalāh afḍal al-ʻibādāt baʻda al-īmān, wa-jaʻala al-wuḍūʼ min aʻẓam shurūṭihā, wa-rattaba ʻalá ḥuṣūlihi al-ghufrān ..."
Secundo folio for Sharḥ Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ: shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ al-madhkūrah.

Incipit of Kashf al-awhām ʻan aḥwāl al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-dāʼim al-taslīm ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-qadīr, ʻĀmir ibn Nuʻayr ibn ʻĀmir ibn Faraj al-Shāfiʻī al-Azʹharī: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ ikhwānī al-fuḍalāʼ an ulakhkhiṣa la-hu risālah ṣaghīrah al-ḥajm qarībat al-fahm fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām min al-sabq wa-al-muwāfaqah wa-tawābiʻ dhālik ... Wa-sammaytu hādhihi al-risālah 'Kashf al-awhām ʻan aḥwāl al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām', wa-rattabtuhā ʻalá thalāth fuṣūl wa-khātimah li-yatimma bi-hā al-maʼmūl ..."
Secundo folio for Kashf al-awhām ʻan aḥwāl al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām: ʻan aḥwāl al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām.
16.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 19-21 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding; covers tooled with decorative frame and embossed with central medallion.

In fair and clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; the text in most of the pages within double red frames; very few notes and corrections on the margins; the margins are heavily damaged by wormholes without lost of text; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Ownership statements, as follows: "Hādhā al-kitāb qad ḥawá fī jīdihi // ʻiqdan jalīlan lā yusāwimuhu thaman. In kunta taʼalfuhu li-tanẓura mā bi-hi // fa-irjaʻ li-ṣāḥibihi Ibni Qayyānin Ḥasan." "Mulk al-faqīr Kha[y]r al-Dīn, ʻufiya ʻanhu." "Mulk al-faqīr Kha[y]r al-Dīn, ʻufiya ʻanhu, fī mūjib taḥrīr amīn al-ḥurūf wa-mūjib tasṭīrih."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Wasīlah ilá kashf al-ʻAqīlah Shaykh [lil-Shaykh] al-Imām al-ʻālim al-wariʻ al-muḥaqqiq al-mutqin al-muqriʼ ʻAlam al-Dīn Abī (Abū) al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sakhāwī, ḍūʻifa ajruhu wa-ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: The titles of the seven books in the codex are listed as follows: "Fahrasat mā fī hādhā al-kitāb: Sharḥ ʻAqīlah al-Shāṭibī lil-Sakhāwī, raḥimahu Allāh. Yalīhi: Sharḥ al-Nukhbah li-Ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAsqalānī, raḥimahu Allāh. Yalīhi: Lumaʻ al-adillah fī qawāʻid Ahl al-Sunnah li-Imām al-Ḥaramayn, raḥimahu Allāh. Yalīhi: Qawāʻid wa-ḍawābiṭ wa-uṣūl muhimmāt tataʻallaqu bi-ʻulūm shattá, lil-Nawawī raḥimahu Allāh. Yalīhā: Risālah, naḥwa khams waraqāt, li-Abī Isḥāq al-Tūnisī, raḥimahu Allāh, fī al-Islām wa-al-īmān, Ahumā makhlūqān am lā. Yalīhā: Risālah fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām min al-sabq wa-al-muwāfaqah wa-tawābiʻ dhālik, lil-Shaykh ʻĀmir ibn Nuʻayr. wa-qablahā Shurūṭ al-imāmah [crossed out] al-wuḍūʼ lil-Ramlī, raḥimahu Allāh."

On folio 102a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Nukhbah lil-Shaykh al-ʻallāmah wa-al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, ḥāfiẓ al-ʻaṣr, Shaykh al-Islām, Shihāb al-Dīn, Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAsqalānī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih. Āmīn."

At the left margin of folio 130a, in a different hand: "Qāla muʼallifuhu, Shaykh al-Islām, khātimat al-ḥufāẓ, aʼimmat al-aʻlām, Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAsqalānī: Faraghtu minhu fī mustahall Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat thamāniyata ʻashar wa-thamāni miʼah [biginning of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 818 of the Hijrah = 10 February, 1416], ḥāmidan Allāh taʻālá, muṣallīyan ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam [wa-musalliman]."

On folio 132a: "Kitāb Lumaʻ al-adillah fī qawāʻid Ahl al-Sunnah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-imām wa-al-ḥabr al-humām, Imām al-Ḥaramayn al-Shāfiʻī, jamaʻahum [jamaʻahā] fī uṣūl al-dīn, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-jaʻala al-Jannah maʼwāhu wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
At the head of folio 141a: "Hādhihi Qawāʻid wa-ḍawābiṭ wa-uṣūl muhimmāt wa-maqāṣid maṭlūbāt lil-Shaykh al-Imām, Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Nawawī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."

On folio 150a: A record, in a different hand, of a "rahn" (depositing as a security) of "alf qirsh illā khamsat qurūsh" (995 qirsh), in the marketable currency, with the names of the different parties and witnesses, dated Jumād Awwal, 1278 of the Hijrah (November/December, 1861).

On folio 150b, al-Ramlī attributes the poem of "Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ" which he comments upon, either to al-Nawawī (1233-1277 ), or al-Walī al-ʻIrāqī (probably Ibn al-ʻIrāqī, Walī al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm, 1361-1423). The poem starts with: Ayā ṭāliban minnī shurūṭa wuḍūʼihi // fa-khudhā ʻalá al-tartībi idh anta sāmiʻu. And ends with: "Wa-washmin bi-lā kurhin wa-ʻaẓmatu jābirin // tushaqqu bilā khawfin wa-yukshaṭu māniʻu."
On folio 158b: Quotations attributed to the Ḥadīth about "al-munāfiq" (hypocrite), and to al-Nawawī about four virtuous conducts.
Colophon of al-Wasīlah ilá kashf al-ʻAqīlah: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh bi-qalam al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥīm [ibn] Fakhr al-Dīn, sanat sitt wa-sabʻūn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."

Translation of the colophon of al-Wasīlah ilá kashf al-ʻAqīlah: "It is concluded, by the praise of God, in the handwriting of the poor ʻAbd al-Raḥï [son of] Fakhr al-Dīn, in the year seventy six [i.e., 1176 of the Hijrah = 1762/1763]. Praise be to God for everything."

Colophon of Tawḍīḥ Nukhbat al-fikar fī muṣṭalaḥ ahl al-athar: "Wa-hādhā ākhir Tawḍīḥ Nukhbat al-fikar fī muṣṭalaḥ ahl al-athar. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā nahār al-Ithnayn, awākhir Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1176, sitt wa-sabʻūn wa-miʼah wa-alf, bi-qalam afqar al-wará, ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Fakhr al-Dīn, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of Tawḍīḥ Nukhbat al-fikar fī muṣṭalaḥ ahl al-athar: "This is the end of 'Tawḍīḥ Nukhbat al-fikar fī muṣṭalaḥ ahl al-athar'. Copied on Monday, the end of Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1176 [12 June, 1763], by the poorest, ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Fakhr al-Dīn, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims, by His grace and generosity. Amen."
Colophon of Lumaʻ al-adillah fī qawāʻid Ahl al-Sunnah: "Tammat bi-qalam al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Fakhr al-Dīn al-Ḥamīdī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu bi-mannihi wa-karamih."

Translation of the colophon of Lumaʻ al-adillah fī qawāʻid Ahl al-Sunnah: "Copied by the poor ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Fakhr al-Dīn al-Ḥamīdī, may God pardon him, by His grace and generosity."
Colophon of Qawāʻid wa-ḍawābiṭ wa-uṣūl muhimmah wa-maqāṣid maṭlūbāt: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih."
Translation of the colophon of Qawāʻid wa-ḍawābiṭ wa-uṣūl muhimmah wa-maqāṣid maṭlūbāt: "It is concluded by the praise of God and His help."
Colophon of al-Īmān wa-al-Islām hal humā makhlūqān aw ghayr makhlūqayn: "Tammat."
Translation of the colophon of al-Īmān wa-al-Islām hal humā makhlūqān aw ghayr makhlūqayn: "It is completed."
Colophon of Sharḥ Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ: "Tammat awāsiṭ shawwāl, sanat 1174."
Translation of the colophon of Sharḥ Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ: "It is completed in mid Shawwāl, the year 1174 [20 May, 1761]."

Colophon of Kashf al-awhām ʻan aḥwāl al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh wa-jará bi-hi al-qalam fī hādhihi al-masʼalah, wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-nasʼaluhu an yajziyanā al-jazāʼ al-jazīl, wa-an yahdiyanā wa-aḥibbatanā ilá sawāʼ al-sabīl, bi-mannihi. Āmīn. Tammat awāsiṭ Shawwāl, sant 1174."

Translation of the colophon of Kashf al-awhām ʻan aḥwāl al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām: "This is the end of what God facilitated, and what the pen produced, concerning this issue. God, may He be praised, is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. We beseech Him to reward us with abundant reward, and to guide us and our loved ones in the right way, by His grace. Amen. It was completed in mid Shawwāl, the year 1174 [20 May, 1761]."

record.title: 880-03 Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl. Al-Juzʼ al-awwal : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar al-Bayḍāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nazzala al-Furqān ʻalá ʻabdihi li-yakūna lil-ʻālamīn nadhīran, fa-taḥaddá bi-aqṣar sūrah min suwarihi maṣāqiʻ al-khuṭabāʼ min al-ʻArab al-ʻarbāʼ, fa-lam yajid bi-hi qadīran, wa-afḥama man taṣaddá li-muʻāraḍatihi min fuṣaḥāʼ ʻAdnān wa-bulaghāʼ Qaḥṭān ḥattá ḥasibū annahum suḥirū tasḥīran, thumma bayyan lil-nās mā nazzala ilayhim ḥasbamā ʻanna lahum min maṣāliḥihim li-yatadabbarū āyātihi wa-li-yadhdhakkara ulū al-alabāb tadhkīran ..."
Secundo folio: fa-inna aʻẓam al-ʻulūm miqdāran.
15 x 20 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding with flap embossed with central medallion; covers tooled with decorative frame and embossed with central medallions; in 37 numbered quires.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a, in pencil: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min al-Bayḍāwī."
Colophon: "Tamma al-juzʼ al-awwal, wa-yalīhi al-juzʼ al-thānī. Sūrat al-Anʻām min al-Bayḍāwī, ʻalá al-tamām."
Translation of the colophon: "The first part has ended. It is completed and will be followed by the second part, starting with Sūrat al-Anʻām [Chapter VI]."

record.title: 880-03 Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl. Al-Juzʼ al-thānī : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar al-Bayḍāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Sūrat al-Anʻām Makkīyah, ghayr sitt āyāt, aw, thalāth, min qawlihi 'Qul taʻālaw atlu', wa-hiya miʼah wa-khams wa-sittūn āyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaqa al-samāwāti wa-al-arḍ. Akhbara bi-annahu, taʻālá, ḥaqīq bi-al-ḥamd, wa-nabbaha ʻalá annahu al-mustaḥiqq la-hu ʻalá hādhihi al-niʻam al-jisām, ḥumida aw lam yuḥmad, li-yakūna ḥujjatan ʻalá alladhīna hum bi-rabbihim yarhabūn [crossed out] yaʻdilūn. Wa-jamaʻa al-samāwāt dūna al-arḍ ..."
Secundo folio: wa-asbāban li-takawwunihim wa-taʻayyushihim.
15 x 19.8 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding with flap embossed with central medallion; covers tooled with decorative frame and embossed with central medallions; in 33 numbered quires.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzw al-thānī min Tafsīr al-ʻAllāmah al-Bayḍāwī li-kalām Allāh al-ʻAzīz, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn." "ʻadad karārīsihi 33."

Ends with: "... ruwiya annahu, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, kāna idhā afṣaḥ al-ghulām min Banī ʻAbd al-Muṭṭalib, ʻallamahu hādhihi al-āyah. Wa-ʻanhu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man qaraʼ Sūrat Banī Isrāʼīl wa-fariqa [?] ʻinda dhikr al-wālidayn, kāna la-hu qinṭār fī al-Jannah. Wa-al-qinṭār alf ūqīyah wa-miʼatā ūqīyah. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Colophon: "Nasʼalu Allāh al-Karīm al-Thawwāb an yamanna ʻalaynā bi-itmām al-kitāb, bi-jāh Muḥammad Sayyid al-aḥbāb wa-ālihi wa-jamīʻ al-aṣḥāb, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá Yawm al-Maʼāb."

Translation of the colophon: "We beseech God, the generous and the abundant giving, to graciously enable us to complete the book, by the intercession of Muḥammad, Master of the beloved ones, his family and all his companions. May God pray on him and on his family, a continuous and inseparable prayer and peace, until Judgement Day."

record.title: 880-03 Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl. Al-Juzʼ al-thālith : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar al-Bayḍāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Sūrat al-Kahf Makkīyah, wa-qīla illā qawluhu taʻālá 'wa-iṣbir nafsak', al-āyah. Wa-hiya miʼah wa-iḥdá ʻashrata āyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. 'al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala ʻalá ʻabdihi al-Kitāb', yaʻnaī al-Qurʼān. Rattaba istiḥqāq al-ḥamd ʻalá inzālihi, tanbīhan ʻalá annahu aʻẓamu naʻmāʼihi, wadhālika li-annahu al-hādī ilá mā fīhi kamāl al-ʻibād, fa-yakūnu waṣfan la-hu wa-al-dāʻī ilá mā bi-hi yantaẓimu ṣalāḥ al-maʻāsh wa-al-maʻād ..."
Secundo folio: al-sākinayn wa-kasr al-hāʼ lil-itbāʻ.
15.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding with flap embossed with central medallion; covers tooled with decorative frame and embossed with central medallions; in 32 numbered quires.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a (in pencil): "al-Thālith min al-Bayḍāwī."

Colophon: No colophon. Ends with: "Fa-idhā jāʼa ajaluhum fa-inna Allāh kāna bi-ʻibādihi baṣīran. Fa-yujāzīhim ʻalá aʻmālihim. ʻAn al-Nabī, Ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: 'Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Malāʼikah daʻatʹhu abwāb al-Jannah an udkhul min ayyi bābin shiʼta'."

record.title: 880-03 Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl. Al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar al-Bayḍāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Sūrat Yāsīn Makkīyah, wa-hiya thalāth wa-thamānūn āyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yāsīn, ka-ALM fī al-maʻná wa-al-iʻrāb. Wa-qīla maʻnāhu 'Yā insān' bi-lughat Ṭayyiʼ, ʻalá anna aṣlahu 'Yā unsīyīn', fa-iqtaṣara ʻalá shaṭrihi li-kathrat al-nadābah, ka-mā qīla 'Mu Allāh' fī aymun Allāh, wa-quriʼa bi-al-kasr, ka-jayri, wa-bi-al-fatḥ ʻalá al-bināʼ, ka-ayn, idh al-iʻrāb ʻalá utlu Yāsīn, aw, bi-iḍmār ḥarf al-qasam, wa-al-fatḥah li-manʻ al-ṣarf, wa-bi-al-ḍamm bināʼan ka-ḥaythu, aw iʻrāban ʻalá hādhihi Yāsīn. Wa-amāl al-yāʼ Ḥamzah wa-al-Kisāʼī wa-Abū Bakr wa-Rawḥ, wa-adghama al-nūn fī wāw ..."
Secundo folio: fa-baqaw ghāfilīn aw bi-qawlihi.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding with flap embossed with central medallion; covers tooled with decorative frame and embossed with central medallions; in 21 unnumbered quires.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ min Tafsīr al-Imām al-Bayḍāwī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Ends with "... wa-qīla bayān lil-nās, ʻalá anna al-murād bi-hi mā yaʻummu al-thaqalayn, wa-fīhi nafas, illā an yruāda bi-hi al-nās, ka-qawlihi taʻālá 'Yawma yadʻu al-dāʻī', fa-inna nisyān ḥaqq Allāh, subḥānuhu, yaʻummu al-thaqalayn. ʻAn al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: 'Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Muʻawwidhatayn, fa-kaʼannamā qaraʼ al-kutub alladhī [allatī] anzalahā Allāh taʻālá'. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

record.title: 880-03 Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl. Al-Juzʼ al-awwal : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar al-Bayḍāwī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma yassir, Yā Karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nazzala al-Furqān ʻalá ʻabdihi li-yakūna lil-ʻālamīn nadhīran, fa-taḥaddá bi-aqṣar sūrah min suwarihi maṣāqiʻ al-khuṭabāʼ min al-ʻArab al-ʻarbāʼ, fa-lam yajid bi-hi qadīran, wa-afḥama man taṣaddá li-muʻāraḍatihi min fuṣaḥāʼ ʻAdnān wa-bulaghāʼ Qaḥṭān ḥattá ḥasibū annahum suḥirū tasḥīran, thumma bayyan lil-nās mā nazzala ilayhim ḥasbamā ʻanna lahum min maṣāliḥihim li-yaddabbarū āyātihi wa-li-yatadhakkara ulū al-alabāb tadhkīran, fa-kashafa lahum qināʻ al-inghilāq ʻan āyātin muḥkamāt hunna umm al-Kitāb, wa-ukhar mutashābihāt hunna rumūz al-khiṭāb taʼwīlan wa-tafsīran ..."
Secundo folio: wa-yanṭawī ʻalá nukat bāriʻah.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 7 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān in red; markings in red; numerous notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl lil-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Qāḍī al-Bayḍāwī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-ruḍwānih wa-askanahu fasīḥ jinānih, bi-jāh Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Āmīn. M."

On the right margin of folio 1a: Three verses of poetry, in a different hand, attributed to ʻAlī Wafā (Ibn Wafā, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, 1357 or 1358-1404 or 1405), a well-known Egyptian Sufi author and poet, about the soul and its education and improvemet.
On the left margin of folio 1a: A quotation, in a different hand, from "Sharḥ al-Nuqāyah" of al-Jalāl al-Syūṭī (1445-1505).

On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqafa, wa-ḥabbasa, wa-taṣaddaqa al-Amīr ʻAbd Allāh Jurījī al-Razzāz hādhā al-tafsīr lil-Qāḍī al-Bayḍāwī kullahu ʻalá al-Muḥtaram Shaykh al-Islām al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Ṣaghīr al-Sujāʻī wa-ʻalá wālidhi Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, wārith ʻulūm Sayyid al-Mursalīn, al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī, wa-jaʻalahu taḥta yadihi, wa-min baʻdihi li-arshad dhurrīyatihi, waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan, lā yubāʻ wa-lā yurhan wa-lā yūhab, fa-man baddalahu baʻda mā samiʻahu, fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Wa-Allāh samīʻun ʻalīm. [... ...] alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wāḥid wa-thamānīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah [1767/1768], ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Shahid bi-dhālik kātib al-aḥruf, ʻAlī al-Ṣaghīr. Wa-la-ism ḥujjah fī dhālik wa-al-khahtm."
On folio 67b (in a very crude hand): "Kātib ʻĪsá Muḥammad al-Bukhārī, fataḥ Allāh ʻalayhi. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. M."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-juzʼ al-awwal min Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl lil-ʻAllāmah al-mushtahir fī al-mashāriq wa-al-maghārib, rukn al-Islām al-Qāḍī al-Bayḍāwī. Wa-yalīhi al-juzʼ al-thānī min awwal Sūrat al-Kahf ilá ākhir al-Qurʼān. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran, ẓāhiran wa-bāṭinan, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-ḥaqīr Aḥmad al-Yāsīnī al-Maḥallī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh dhunūbahu wa-satar ʻuyūbahu fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu fī yawm al-Jumʻah al-agharr al-azʹhar, khāmis ʻishrīn Shawwāl al-mubārak, sanat tisʻah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the first volume of Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl, of the learned and well-known scholar in East and West, the support of Islam, Judge al-Bayḍāwi. It will be followed by the second part, starting with the beginning of 'Sūrat al-Kahf' [Chapter 18] to the end of the Qurʼān. Praise be to God from the beginning to the end, overtly and covertly. Coped by the despised servant Aḥmad al-Yāsīnī al-Maḥallī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him his trespasses and cover his shortcomings, in this world and the hereafter, by His grace and generosity. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, on his family and his companions and grant them peace. It was completed on the noble and esteemed Friday, the twenty-fifth of blessed Shawwāl, 1129 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [2 October, 1717]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Fawāʼid al-bahīyah : manuscript / Saʻd Allāh ibn ʻĪsá Saʻdī Chalabī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Sūrat Fātiḥat al-Kitāb. Hākadhā wujidat maktūbatan fī awāʼil al-Maṣāḥif al-Karīmah, wa-hiya [khabar] mubtadaʼ maḥdhūf, ay, hādhihi al-sūrah musammāh bi-Sūrat Fātiḥat al-Kitāb, ʻalá al-taʼwīl al-mashhūr fī jumal al-khabarī [?]. Wa-al-ẓāhir anna ʻilm al-sūrah al-ʻaẓīmah huwa majmūʻ Sūrat Fātiḥat al-Kitāb. Wa-al-ʻajab anna al-ʻAllāmah al-Taftāzānī jaʻalahā ʻalá wifq mā dallat ʻalayhi al-Aḥādīth al-Nabawīyah musammāh bi-Fātiḥat al-Kitāb ..."
Secundo folio: Akmal al-Dīn wa-al-tāʼ lil-naql.
13.7 x 20.3 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding.
In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the Qurʼan commentary of al-Bayḍāwī preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a (in Latin script): "Howashi ʻala Bedawi."
Folio 2a is blank.

On the upper left margin of folio 3a: An ownership statement: "Min mann Allāh al-Malik al-Awḥad al-Ṣamad ʻalá ʻabdihi al-Ḥājj Aḥmad ibn Ḥusayn ibn Aḥmad, ʻufiya ʻanhum. 1126 [1714/1715]." And a faded seal.
At the head of folio 3b (in red): "Hādhihi Ḥawāshin li-Mawlānā Saʻdī Chalabī ʻalá al-Qāḍī al-Bayḍāwī."
Colophon: "Tamma bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá. M."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the help of God, may He be praised. M."

record.title: 880-02 Tafsīr al-Jalālayn : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī, Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-Huwa ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, ḥāfiẓ al-ʻaṣr wa-mujtahiduh, Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā wa-Shaykhunā Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Suyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī, nafaʻa Allāh al-Muslimīn bi-barakātihi, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥamdan muwāfiyan li-niʻamih, mukāfiyan li-mazīdih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-junūdih. Hādhā mā ishtaddat ilayhi ḥājat al-rāghibīn fī takmilat Tafsīr al-Qurʼān al-Karīm alladhī allafahu al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah al-muḥaqqiq Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh, wa-tammama [wa-tatmīm] mā fātahu, wa-huwa min awwal Sūrat al-Baqarah ilá ākhir al-Isrāʼ, nutimmuhu ʻalá namaṭih, min dhikr mā yufhamu bi-hi kalām Allāh taʻālá, wa-al-iʻtimād ʻalá arjaḥ al-aqwāl ..."
Secundo folio: wa-taʻbīr wajīz wa-tark al-taṭwīl.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding with flap embossed with central medallion; covers tooled with decorative frame and embossed with central medallions; in 42 mostly unnumbered quires.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān in red; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. It is completed by the praise of God and His help."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, salkh shahr Ṣafar alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn arbaʻ wa-sabʻīn, ʻalá yad kātibihi li-nafsih, wa-li-man shāʼa Allāh min baʻdih, ʻAlī Mīrah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn." Faded seal.

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It was copied on blessed Tuesday, the end of the month of Ṣafar, 1274 [of the Hijrah: 19 October, 1857], by ʻAlī Mīrah, for himself, and for whomever God wills after him, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen." Faded seal.

record.title: 880-03 Muqtabas min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān. Al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ : manuscript / ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-maʻrūf bi-al-Khāzin.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-manʻūt bi-ṣifāt al-kamāl al-munazzah ʻan al-aghrāḍ fī al-aḥkām wa-al-afʻāl, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī aẓhara al-dīn wa-li-ahlihi rafaʻa, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-man li-sharīʻatihi ittabaʻ. ʻAn Anas, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Inna li-kull shayʼ qalb, wa-qalb al-Qurʼān Yāsīn, wa-man qaraʼa Yāsīn kataba Allāh la-hu bi-qirāʼatihā qirāʼat al-Qurʼān ʻashr marrāt. Akhrajahu al-Tirmidhī, wa-qāl: Ḥadīth gharīb wa-fī isnādihi shaykh majhūl ..."
Secundo folio: akhrajahu Abū Dāwūd wa-ghayruhu.
16 x 19.3 cm; written surface: 11 x 12.5 cm; 12-13 lines per page.

Binding: The quires (19 in number) are kept in a loose cover with flap. Some of the leaves are lined in blue and seem to have been taken from a ledger copybook. The text is written horizontally across the blue lines.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ. Hādhā Muqtabas min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān li-ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-maʻrūf bi-al-Khāzin. MMM."
On the back of the back cover: Ownership statements, as follows: "Hādhā juzʼ Fāṭimah Hānum Afandim." "Hādhā kitāb Nafīsah Hānum." "Hādhā kitāb Fāṭimah Hānum Afandim."

Colophon: "Tamma ʻalá yad muʼallifihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh Muḥammad Ismāʻīl ibn Ḥasan Ismāʻīl ibn al-marḥūm Khalīfah Ibrāhīm. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tabyīḍihi yawm Aḥad [al-Aḥad] al-mubārak, ithnay ʻashar Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1331 Hijrīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. MMM."

Translation of the colophon: "Completed by the hand of its author [i.e. copyist] the poor to God Muḥammad Ismāʻīl ibn Ḥasan Ismāʼīl ibn al-marḥūm Khalīfah Ibrāhīm, on blessed Sunday, 12 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, the year 1331 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [13 October, 1913], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him. MMM."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥirz al-amānī wa-wajh al-tahānī : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb Qaṣīdat al-Shāṭibī, al-muṣannif al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-Rabbānī, wa-huwa al-Imām Aḥmad ibn Fīrruh al-Ruʻaynī thumma al-Shāṭibī, al-mulaqqabah bi-Ḥirz al-amānī wa-wajh al-tahānī, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh. Fa-qāl: Badaʼtu bi-bismillāh fī al-naẓmi awwalan // tabāraka raḥmānan raḥīman wa-mawʼilā. Wa-thannaytu ṣallá Allāhu Rabbī ʻalá al-Riḍá // Muḥammadini al-muhdá ilá al-nāsi mursalā ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-thallathtu anna al-ḥamda lillāh dāʼiman.
18.5 x 26 cm; written surface: 11 x 19 cm; 5-7 lines per page.
Binding: In buckram binding with flap.

In large naskh script, in black ink on thick white paper, ample spaces between the verses of the poem to accomodate the numerous notes and commentaries (with some in red), interlinear and on the margins; markings in red; no catchwords; inserts in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.
On the back of the front cover: An ownerhip statement: "Dakhala fī mulk al-Shaykh Fāris al-Ḥimṣī."
On folios 91a-93b: Various quotations in different hands.
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Shāṭibīyah : manuscript / Abū al-Faḍl Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Kamāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Incipit missing; starts with: "... alifayn aw wāwayn aw yāʼayn, wa-iḍrib jamʻ al-hamzatayn fī hādhā al-bāb thalāthah li-annahumā immā maftūḥatān naḥwa aandhartahum am lam tundhirhum, aw al-ūlá maftūḥah wa-al-thāniyah maḍmūmah naḥwa li-yaʼtā al-mabʻūthūn, wa-al-ūlá maftūḥah wa-al-thāniyah maḍmūmah naḥwa aanzalā ʻalayhi al-dhikr wa-qad taqaddm ..."
Secundo folio: wa-fī ḥarf Āl ʻImrān rawaw li-Hishāmihim.
17 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 14 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the phrases of "al-Shāṭibīyah" in purple; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Intahá hādhā al-sharḥ ʻalá Qaṣīdat al-Shāṭibīyah. Qāla muʼallifuhu Sayyidunā al-Shaykh ... Jalāl al-Dīn Abū al-Faḍl ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ... al-Qāḍī Kamāl al-Dīn ... Abū Bakr al-Suyūṭī ...: Waqad faraghtu min hādhā al-sharḥ yawm al-Khamīs, ʻashr [ʻishrīn] Rajab, sanat arbaʻah wa-thamānīn wa-thamān miʼah, aḥsan Allāh ʻuqbāhā bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam, kullamā dhakaraka [dhakarahu] al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

Translation of the colophon: "This commentary on al-Shāṭibīyah poem is completed. Its author, our Master, al-Shaykh ... Jalāl al-Dīn Abū al-Faḍl ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ... al-Qāḍī Kamāl al-Dīn ... Abū Bakr al-Suyūṭī said ...: 'This commentary ended on Thursday, 10 [probably 20] Rajab, the year 884 [of the Hijrah = 16 October, 1479], may God end it favorably, by His grace and generosity. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace, whenever he is mentioned by those who remember and neglected to be mentioned by the neglectful. There is no might nor power except in God, the Most High, the Almighty."

record.title: 880-02 Sirāj al-qārī al-mubtadī wa-tadhkār al-muqrī al-muntahī : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn ʻUthmān ibn al-Qāṣiḥ.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Abū al-Baqāʼ ʻAlī ibn ʻUthmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥasan ibn al-Qāṣiḥ al-ʻUdhrī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ʻallama al-Qurʼān wa-zayyana al-insān bi-nuṭq al-lisān, fa-ṭūbá li-man yatlū Kitāb Allāh ḥaqqa tilāwatih, wa-yuwāẓibu ānāʼ al-layl wa-aṭrāf al-nahār ʻalá dirāsatih, kalām Allāh alladhī anzalahu ʻalá ʻabdihi wa-Rasūlihi al-Muṣṭafá, Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-ummī al-ʻArabī al-mukhtār ..."
Secundo folio: thamān wa-thalāthīn wa-khamsimiʼah bi-Shāṭibah.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 25 loose and numbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the verses of "al-Shāṭibīyah" in purple; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Sharḥ Ibn al-Qāṣiḥ, ghafara Allāh li-man qaraʼa fīhi wa-li-ṣāḥibihi wa-kātibihi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-karīm Ḥasan ʻAlī al-Ḥakīm, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh. Āmīn. Āmīn.Āmīn." "Intaqala min mulk al-madhkūr ilá mulk al-faqīr ʻAfīfī Muḥammad ʻUmar, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu Sirāj al-qārī al-mubtadī wa-tadhkār al-muqrī al-muntahī ..."
Folio 244 is blank.

Colophon: "Hādhā ākhir al-kitāb, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb, wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Qāla muʼallifuhu, al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Ḥasan ibn al-Qāṣiḥ, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu bi-mannihi wa-karamih: Faraghtu minhu fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, thāmin ʻashar Shaʻbān al-mukarram, sanat tisʻ wa-khamsīn wa-sabʻimiʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabwah [al-Nabawīyah], ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, ithnay ʻashar khalat min shahr Shaʻbān, sanat thamāniyah wa-sabʻūn [wa-sabʻīn] wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the book. God is He who facilitates what is correct. He suffices us. He is the best advocate. Its author, the servant, poor to God, may He be praised, Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Ḥasan ibn al-Qāṣiḥ, may God forgive him, by His grace and generosity, said: I finished writing it on blessed Thursday, the eighteenth of honorable Shaʻbān, the year 759 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [3 August, 1358], may the best of prayer and the most perfect peace be upon him. This blessed book was copied on blessed Wednesday, 12 Shaʻbān, 1278 of the Hijrah [of the Prophet = 12 February, 1862], may the best of prayer and the most perfect peace be upon him. Amen. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Muqaddimat Ḥafṣ : manuscript / Fāyid ibn Mubārak al-Abyārī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr al-wāthiq bi-rabbihi al-bārī, Fāyid ibn Mubārak al-Abyārī: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ aṣdqāʼī wa-man huwa min ikhwānī fī Allāh wa-aḥbābī an ajmaʻa la-hu mulakhkhaṣ riwāyat Ḥafṣ, rāwī ʻĀṣim li-yantafiʻa bi-hi, fa-innahu yaʻjazu ʻan al-iṭṭilāʻ fī kutub al-qirāʼāt wa-maʻrifat al-tarājim, fa-ajabtuhu li-mā ṭalab, idh huwa ʻalayya mimmā wajab, fa-aqūlu, wa-billāh al-mustaʻān, wa-ʻalayhi al-iʻtimād wa-al-tiklān: Iʻlam inna riwāyatahu in wāfaqat qirāʼat Abī ʻAmr, wa-lam adhkurhā, qirāʼat Abī ʻAmr fī Miṣrinā, wa-huwa Abū ʻAmr Ḥafṣ ibn Sulaymān ibn al-Mughīrah al-Bazzāz, wa-kāna yuʻrafu bi-Ḥafṣ, wa-taʻallama al-Qurʼān min ʻĀṣim, khumsan khumsan, ka-mā yataʻallamuhu al-ṣabī min al-muʻallim, wa-kāna ʻāliman ʻāmilan, aʻlam aṣḥāb ʻĀṣim bi-qirāʼat ʻĀṣim, wa-kāna ibn zawjat ʻĀṣim ..."
Secundo folio: al-mukhtār li-jamīʻ al-qurrāʼ.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9.5-10.5 x 15 cm; 20-21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 1 quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the titles of the different sūrahs of the Qurʼān are written on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Muqaddimat Ḥafṣ."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... zakīyah bi-ghayr alif baʻda al-Zāy wa-tashdīd al-Yāʼ al-taḥtīyah. La-ittakhadhat, bi-tashdīd al-Tāʼ wa-fatʹḥ al-Khāʼ, an yubdilhumā bi-sukūn al-muwaḥḥadah wa-takhfīḍ al-Dāl, wa-kadhālika fī al-taḥārīm, an yubdilhu, wa-Nūn wa-al-qalam, an yubdilnā, fa-la-hu jazāʼ al-ḥusná, bi-hamzah mamdūdah munawwanah manṣūbah ..."

record.title: 880-03 Risālah sharīfah fī qirāʼat al-Imām Ḥafṣ : manuscript / Fāyid ibn Mubārak al-Abyārī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqqa ḥamdih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, rasūlihi wa-ʻabdih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-wāthiq bi-rabbihi al-ʻalīm al-bārī, Fāyid ibn Mubārak al-Abyārī: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ aṣdqāʼī wa-man huwa min ikhwānī fī Allāh wa-aḥbābī an ajmaʻa la-hu mā takhuṣṣu rāwiyat [riwāyat] Ḥafṣ, rāwī ʻĀṣim, yantafiʻu bi-hi, fa-innahu yaʻjazu ʻan al-iṭṭilāʻ fī kutub al-Qurʼān [al-qirāʼāt] wa-maʻrifat al-tarjamah, fa-ajabtuhu li-mā ṭalab, idh huwa ʻalayya mimmā wajab, fa-aqūlu, wa-billāh al-mustaʻān, wa-ʻalayhi al-iʻtimād wa-al-tiklān: Wa-iʻlam inna riwāyatahu in wāfaqat qirāʼat Abī ʻUmar, wa-lam adhkurhā, qirāʼat Abī ʻUmar fī Miṣrinā, wa-huwa Abū ʻAmr Ḥafṣ ibn Sulaymān ibn al-Mughīrah al-Bazzāz, wa-kāna yuʻrafu bi-Ḥafṣ, wa-taʻallama al-Qurʼān min ʻĀṣim, khumsan khumsan, ka-mā yataʻallamuhu al-ṣabī min al-muʻallim, wa-kāna ʻāliman ʻāmilan, aʻlam aṣḥāb ʻĀṣim bi-qirāʼat ʻĀṣim, wa-kāna ibn zawjat ʻĀṣim ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qāla Yaḥyá ibn Muʻīn al-riwāyah al-ṣaḥīḥah.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the phrases of the different verses of the Qurʼān preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying), in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah sharīfah fī qirāʼat al-Imām Ḥafṣ rāwī ʻĀṣim, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā wa-nafaʻanā bi-himā. Āmīn. Tamm."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-Muqaddimah yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, al-muwāfiq li-tisʻah wa-ʻishrīn yawman khalat min shahr Rabīʻ Thānī, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn sittah wa-sittīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah. Intahá."
Translation of the colophon: "This Muqaddimah [Introduction] was copied on blessed Thursday, dated 29 Rabīʻ Thānī, 1266 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [14 March, 1850]. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 al-Daqāʼiq al-muḥkamah fī sharḥ al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Shaykh al-Islām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-ʻallāmah ... Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn al-Shaykh al-ṣāliḥ Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī ...: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī fatataḥa bi-al-ḥamd kitābah, wa-ajzala li-man jawwadahu wa-ʻamila bi-hi thawābah, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-amīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-Muqaddimah al-manẓūmah fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān lil-Shaykh al-Imām ... Abī al-Khayr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Jazarī ... lammā iʻtaná bi-hā dhawū al-jidd wa-al-ijtihād, wa-kānat muḥtājah ilá bayān al-murād ... raʼaytu an aḍaʻa ʻalayhā sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓahā, wa-yubayyinu murādahā, wa-yubrizu daqāʼiqahā, wa-yuqayyid muṭlaqahā, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqahā, wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Daqāʼiq al-muḥkamah fī sharḥ al-Muqaddimah. Wa-ʻiddat abyātihā miʼah wa-sabʻah ʻalá mā fī akthar al-nusakh, wa-miʼah wa-thamāniyah ʻalá mā fī aqallihā ..."
Secundo folio: al-Muqaddimah wa-ʻiddat abyātihā.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 11.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In buckram binding.
In good medium naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the verses of al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Daqāʼiq al-muḥkamah fī sharḥ al-Muqaddimah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Abī Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Malakahu min fayḍ faḍl Rabbihi al-ghaffār ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Najjār. Thamanuhu thalāthīn."

al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah starts with: Yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa Rabbin sāmiʻi // Muḥammadu Ibn al-Jazarīyi al-Shāfiʻī. And ends with: Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh la-hā khitāmu // thumma al-ṣalātu baʻdu wa-al-salāmu.
On folio 33b, the extra verse (number 108) which is spoken about in the incipit is written as follows: "ʻAlá al-Nabīyi al-Muṣṭafá wa-ālihi // wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-tābiʻī minwālihi."
Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. 'Tamām shudam' [bi-al-Fārisīyah]. Tammat sanat 1155."

Translation of the colophon: "The commentary is completed by the praise of God and His help. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. 'I am finished' [In Persian]. It is completed. The year 1155 [1742/1743]."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah fī al-tajwīd : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa rabbin sāmiʻi // Muḥammadu ibn al-Jazarīyi al-Shāfiʻī. al-Rajāʼ, al-ṭamaʻ fīmā yumkinu ḥuṣūluhu. Wa-al-ʻafw, al-ṣafḥ ʻan al-dhanb wa-tark mujāzāt al-mutaʻaddī. Wa-al-samʻ bi-maʻná al-qubūl wa-al-ijābah, wa-minhu qawl al-muṣallī 'Samiʻa Allāh li-man ḥamidah', ay, ajāba Allāh la-hu. Ṣ. al-Ḥamd lillāh wa-ṣallá Allāh, al-ḥamd huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-lisān, ʻalá qaṣd al-taʻẓīm, wa-Allāh ism al-dhāt al-mastajmiʻ li-jamīʻ al-ṣifāt al-wājib al-wujūd al-mustajmiʻ li-jamīʻ al-maḥāmid. Wa-al-ṣalāh min Allāh raḥmah, wa-min al-malāʼikah istighfār, wa-min al-jinn wa-al-ins duʻāʼ, wa-hiya wājibah li-man samiʻa ismahu ..."
Secundo folio: wa-muqriʼ al-Qurʼān ay wa-ʻalá.
14.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 18-21 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink on white paper; text within double red frame; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Fī ʻilm al-tajwīd. Hādhā sharḥ al-Jazarīyah fī ʻilm al-tajwīd lil-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Shihāb al-dunyā wa-al-dīn, Shaykh al-Islām Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Āmīn." However, above this statement, another statement attributes the treatise to another author: "al-Ṣaḥīḥ annahu sharḥ al-Shaykh Khālid, shāriḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah [Probably: Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī, died 1499], nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Qad ṣāra fī mulk afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá Rabb al-Anām, al-faqīr Muḥammad Abū al-ʻIzz ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām al-faqīh, al-faqīh bi-al-Manṣūrah, taḥrīran dhālik fī ghurrat shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām min shuhūr sanat 1175 Hilālīyah [1761/1762], wa-Allāh aʻlam." "Wa-intaqala bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī [ilá] al-faqīr ilá al-Qarīb al-Mujīb ʻAbdū ibn ʻAbduh Ḥasan al-Qalyūbī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Sanat 1237 [1821/1822]."
On folios 27b-28b: Various quotations about the recitation of the Qurʼān, in a different hand.

Colophon: "Wa-qad ʻallaqahā li-nafsihi wa-li-man shāʼa Allāh baʻdahu, ʻan ghayr taḥrīr, al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-ḥaqīr al-Sharīf Sulaymān ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Aytihī [?] al-Ḥanafī, sibṭ al-ʻārif billāh Sayyidī ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥalafāwī al-Ḥasanī al-Ṭūkhī, ghafara Allāh la-hu."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied, without editing, by the poor and despised servant, al-Sharīf Sulaymān ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Aytihī [?] al-Ḥanafī, sibṭ al-ʻārif billāh Sayyidī ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥalafāwī al-Ḥasanī al-Ṭūkhī, for himself and for whomever God wills after him. May God forgive him.

record.title: Excerpts on Arabic grammar and early Islamic history : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The excerpt on Arabic grammar (morphology) starts with: "... aklub, thumma yujmaʻu aklub ʻalá akālib, wa-kadhālika naʻam yujmaʻu ʻalá anʻām, thumma yujmaʻu anʻām ʻalá anāʻīm. Wa-akālib wa-anāʻīm lā yujmaʻān baʻda dhālika, fa-humā ʻalá ṣīghah waqafat ʻindahā jumūʻ al-taksīr. Wa-qawlunā lā yumkin an yujmaʻa jam taksīr lā yunāfī imkān jamʻihi jamʻ salāmah, naḥwa al-ṣawāḥibāt jamʻ ṣawāḥib, fa-ṣawāḥib lā yujmaʻu taksīran baʻda hādhihi al-ṣīghah allatī hiya ʻalayhā wa-in jumiʻat jamʻ salāmah ʻalá ṣawāḥibāt ..."
Secundo folio for the excerpt on Arabic grammar (morphology): ka-khamsata ʻashar fa-innahu mabnī ʻalá fatḥ al-juzʼayn.
