The excerpt on early Islamic history (first century of the Hijrah) starts with: "... thumma amara bi-hā fa-ḥufira la-hā ilá ṣadrihā, wa-amar al-nās fa-rajamūhā, fa-yuqbilu Khālid ibn al-Walīd bi-ḥajar, fa-ramá raʼsahā, fa-yanḍaḥu al-dam ʻalá wajh Khālid fa-sabbahā, fa-samiʻa Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam sabbahu īyāhā, fa-qāla: Mahlan, yā Khālid, fa-walladhī nafsī bi-yadihi laqad tābat tawbatan law tābahā ṣāḥib maks la-ghufira la-hu. Thumma amara bi-hā, fa-ṣulliya ʻalayhā wa-dufinat ..."
Secundo folio for the excerpt on early Islamic history (first century of the Hijrah): an taqūma fa-taqūla maqālatan yaṭīru bi-hā ʻanka kulla maṭīr.
16.3 x 23.2 cm; written surface: 11 x 17 cm; 25 lines per page.
16.2 x 22.3 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 19-23 lines per page.
Binding: Both excerpts are unbound

The excerpt on Arabic grammar (morphology) is in fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords. The excerpt on early Islamic history (first century of the Hijrah) is in good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon of the excerpt on Arabic grammar (morphology): No colophon; text ends abrubtly with "... wa-law qāla al-shāriḥ: Wa-al-amr ʻinda Sībawayh mabnī ʻalá mā yujzamu bi-hi muḍāriʻuhu mā lam yattaṣil bi-hi nūn al-niswah, wa-illā fa-mabnī ʻalá al-sukūn aw nūn al-tawkīd, wa-illā fa-mabnī ʻalá al-fatʹḥ ka-al-muḍāriʻ fīhimā, la-kāna akhṣar wa-ashmal. Wa-ʻalá ḥadhf al-ākhir in kāna muʻtallan muqayyad bi-mā idhā lam yattaṣil bi-hi alif ithnayn aw wāw jamʻ aw yā mukhāṭabah aw nūn niswah aw nūn tawkīd mubāsharatan lafẓan aw taqdīran, fa-in ittaṣala bi-hi dhālik fa-qad ashāra li-ḥukmihi baʻdu bi-qawlihi aw ʻalá ḥadhf al-nūn, lākinnahu lam yadhkur ḥukm nūn al-niswah wa-nūn al-tawkīd ..."

Colophon of the excerpt on early Islamic history (first century of the Hijrah): No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-ruwiya ʻanhu qāl: Amaranī ʻAlī an aṭūfa fī al-manāzil min Minan bi-Barāʼah, wa-kuntu aṣīḥu ḥattá ṣuḥila ḥalqī. Fa-qīla la-hu bi-ma kunta tunādī? Fa-qāla bi-arbaʻ: An lā yadkhula al-Jannah illā muʼmin, wa-an lā yaḥujja baʻda al-ʻām mushrik, wa-an lā yaṭūfa bi-al-Bayt ʻuryān, wa-man kāna la-hu ʻahd fa-la-hu ajal arbaʻat ashhur, thumma lā ʻahda la-hu. Qāla al-ʻulamāʼ, raḥimahum Allāh taʻālá: Wa-kāna al-sabab fī baʻth ʻAlī baʻda Abī Bakr annahu qad kāna fī ʻurf al-ʻArab an lā yatawallá ʻaqd al-ʻuhūd wa-naqḍahā ..."

record.title: Louis Popon de Maucune travel journals : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Spine title: "Journal de voyage. / 1763-1769."
Binding: 19th-century cloth over marbled boards. Red leather spine tag, lettered in gilt.

record.title: Mêlanges de regles physiognomiques : manuscrit pour des amis : avec quelques lignes characteristiques : 1ere centaine : pour le profit des pauvres : respectez la misère et ce qui la soulage!.
record.note: The unbound manuscript comprises a title page, dedication "A mes amis," epilogue, and 98 numbered leaves (of 100, see below), written on one side only in a neat calligraphic hand (leaf 68 in a different hand), on paper bearing a double border in pink and black. Many leaves are illustrated with physiognomical diagrams of the human face or its parts. Preserved in the original calf book-shaped box, lined with pink glazed paper, with an engraved label pasted to the inside cover with motto "Lache des Elends nicht und der Mittel das Elend zu lindern für Arme."
From the library of Christopher Hogwood (1941-2014)

record.title: A true presentation of forepast parliaments : to the view of present tyme and posteritie : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.
Ownership inscription of Fabian Phillips, heavily crossed out, at the top of the caption title page.
Inscription incorrectly attributing the authorship of the manuscript to Fabian Phillips at the top of the caption title page.
Sections written in alternating italic and secretary scripts.
Annotations and corrections in a law hand throughout, attributed to Fabian Phillips.
Binding: contemporary limp parchment; part of front cover damaged.

record.title: Catalogue of the nobilitie of England : and a collection of his Majesties courtes of record as of his highnes most honourable houshold, the counsells of the north of Wales & the marches, the islandes, his majesties townes of warre castles bulwarkes & fortresses, with his highnes howses parkes forests and chaces : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page.
Ownership inscription on back pastedown: "Clement Cottrell / sat qui sapit."
Ownership inscription on title page: "Phillipps MS 16641."
Bookplate on title page: Edward Almack.
Bookplate on front pastedown: Regimental Headquarters of the Grenadier Guards. Typed identifying information on printed form: "Various Diaries. Historical. / H. 400."
Binding: contemporary limp white vellum, with gilt ruling and central gilt ornament of four fleur-de-lis. Spine blank. Remains of pink silk ribbon ties.

record.title: Mary Allcard commonplace book : manuscript.
record.note: Ownership inscription in each notebook: "Mary Allcard."
Volume 2 is more than half blank.
Typed contents list laid in to volume 1.
Bindings: original marbled paper wrappers.

record.title: Commonplace book : manuscript.
record.note: Volume opens with a table of contents.
Binding: original calf, worn.

record.title: Poetry, 1791 : manuscript.

Bound in black leather, with titles stamped in gilt on front cover and on spine. Binder's label, on front paste-down: "Barth, relieur et doreur ... Tours."

Expenses for April 5 and July 13th for: Dunham Registers, attendance book, readers, history books, needles, rulers, compostion books, pencils totaling £47.10 with an additional £7/9/0/ added on July 13th. Receipt of payment of £7/9/0 on September 13th,1897,
Includes a Penny Lilac tax stamp.

Laid in: note in an unidentified hand concerning the watermark on the manuscript, undated.

Bookplate of Alan John Jarvis on case.

Two folio letter books (310 x 200 mm), pp. [118, plus blanks]; [156, plus blanks, and some loosely inserted leaves]; and one small 4to bill book (200 x 150mm), pp. [274, plus blanks]; Britannia watermarks; contemporary full vellum with double blind fillets to two of the volumes; upper boards lettered in ms. ink.

record.title: 880-02 Radd maʻānī al-āyāt al-mutashābihāt ilá maʻānī al-āyāt al-muḥkamāt : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn al-Labbān.
record.note: Title from folio 1a, the colophon, and reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Baʻda ḥamd Allāh al-wāḥid bi-dhātih wa-ṣifātih, al-munazzah fī aḥadīyatihi ʻan mushābahat makhlūqātih, wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá Muḥammad ʻabdihi wa-rasūlih, al-mūḍiḥ bi-sunnatihi mutashābih āyātih, al-bāqī madaduhu li-awliyāʼih baʻda mamātih, kamā kān lahum fī ḥayātih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih, alladhīn kāna aḥaduhum idhā zārahu fī qabrih, sallama ʻalayhi, wa-rafaʻa yadayhi kamā kāna yarfaʻuhumā ʻinda iftitāḥ ṣalātih, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Fa-innaka saʼaltanī, arshadanī Allāh wa-īyāka, ʻan amr ʻaẓuma fī hādhā al-zamān khaṭbuh wa-ʻamma ḍararuh, wa-huwa mā taẓāhara bi-hi baʻḍ al-mubtadiʻah al-muntasibīn ilá al-Ḥadīth wa-al-fiqh, wa-ashāʻahu fī al-ʻāmmah wa-al-khāṣṣah min iʻtiqād ẓawāhir al-āyāt al-mutashābihah fī asmāʼihi taʻālá wa-ṣifātih, min ghayr taʻarruḍ li-ṣarfihā ʻammā yūhim al-tashbīh wa-al-tajsīm, wa-yazʻumu annahu fī dhālika mutamassik bi-al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah, māshin fī ṭarīqat al-salaf al-ṣāliḥ, wa-yushanniʻu ʻalá man taʻarraḍa ilá shayʼ minhā bi-taʼwīl, aw ṣarafahu ʻan ẓāhirihi bi-dalīl, wa-yansibuhu fī dhālik ilá mukhālafat al-Ṣaḥābah wa-al-Tābiʻīn ..."
Secundo folio: ṭahārat qalbih wa-salāmat fiṭratih.
16 x 21.2 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: The leaves were separated and placed in a larger, light brown cover, which seems to have belonged to another manuscript.

In good naskh script, in black ink, headings and markings in red; some corrections, and editorial notes (in pencil), on the margins; some wormholes without loss of text; catchwords; text within red frames.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Dhikr Radd maʻānī al-āyāt al-mutashābihāt ilá maʻānī al-āyāt al-muḥkamāt lil-Shaykh al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá al-Shaykh Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī raḍiya Allāh ʻanh [The book is by Ibn al-Labbān, not Ibn al-ʻArabī]."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr al-muʻtarif ilá Allāh bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr <ilá Allāh> al-Sayyid Muḥammad Ḥakīm Bāshī ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad, Raʼīs al-Ṭibb, wa-dhālika ghurrat Rajab al-fard, sanat 1204 [17 March, 1790]." A seal. "Dakhala fī mulk al-ʻabd al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr al-Ḥājj [... ...]."
The note on folio 1a, in pencil, and the editorial notes on the margins of the leaves, indicate that the manuscript was being prepared to be printed.
Folio 47 is blank.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tanmīq hādhā al-juzʼ al-sharīf, wa-huwa al-musammá Kitāb Dhikr Radd al-āyāt al-mutashābihāt ilá maʻānī al-āyāt al-muḥkamāt, nahār al-thalāthah, thānī ʻashar yawm min Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat miʼatayn wa-alf, ʻalá yad al-faqīr wa-al-ʻājiz al-ḥaqīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Allāh, al-Sayyid Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad Afandī, Raʼīs al-Ṭibb, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn jamīʻan. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble component, titled 'Kitāb Dhikr Radd al-āyāt al-mutashābihāt ilá maʻānī al-āyāt al-muḥkamāt', was completed on Tuesday, 12 Jumādá al-Thānī, 1200 [of the Hijrah = 12 April, 1786] by the poor, feeble and despised, who hopes for the forgiveness of God, al-Sayyid Muḥammad son of al-Shaykh Muḥammad Afandī, the Head of Medicine, may God have mercy upon him and upon all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 al-Taysīr fī qawāʻid ʻilm al-tafsīr : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Kāfiyajī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir, Yā Karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala al-Qurʼān raḥmatan lil-anām, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī alladhī fassara al-Furqān wa-bayyana al-aḥkām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-nujabāʼ al-kirām. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna madār al-sharāʼiʻ wa-al-Islām kalām Allāh al-Malik al-ʻAllām, wa-inna tafsīrahu ahamm al-muhimmāt al-ʻiẓām, lā yakādu yatimmu taʻāṭīhi illā li-wāḥid baʻda wāḥid fī kull zamān, fa-innahu baḥr lā yanqaḍī ʻajāʼibuh, wa-lā yantahī gharāʼibuh, badīʻ al-shān. Thumma inna ʻilam al-tafsīr min bayn al-ʻulūm, lammā kāna bi-manzilat al-insān lil-ʻayn wa-al-ʻayn lil-insān, wa-qad dalla ʻalá afḍalīyatihi al-burhān, wa-kān ghayra muntaẓimin ʻalá ḥidatin fī silk al-naẓm wa-al-bayān, wa-aradtu tadwīnahu bi-qadr al-wisʻ wa-al-imkān, rattabtu hādhihi al-risālah ʻalá bābayn wa-khātimah, tuḥfatan minnī lil-ikhwān ..."
Secundo folio: innaka anta al-karīm al-jawwād.
13.3 x 17.8 cm; written surface: 8.2 x 12.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap.
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; many notes on the margins, in different hands; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Taysīr fī qawāʻid ʻilm al-tafsīr, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Kāfiyajī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... inna fī ummatī la-muḥaddithīn, wa-inna ʻUmar minhum. Wa-al-ḍarb al-thānī mā yakūnu bi-ṣināʻah muʻlamah, wa-huwa al-istidlāl bi-al-ashkāl al-ẓāhirah ʻalá al-aḥwāl al-bāṭinah. Wa-qāla ahl al-maʻrifah fī qawlihi taʻālá 'A-fa-man kāna ʻalá bayyinah min Rabbihi wa-yatlūhu shāhidun', inna al-bayyinah huwa al-qism al-awwal, wa-huwa al-ishārah ilá ṣafāʼ jawhar al-rūḥ, wa-al-shāhid huwa al-qism al-thānī, wa-huwa al-istidlāl bi-al-ashkāl ʻalá al-aḥwāl."
Folio 33 is blank.

record.title: 880-03 Muqtabas min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān. Al-Juzʼ al-thālith : manuscript / ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-maʻrūf bi-al-Khāzin.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh dhī al-kamāl wa-al-jalāl alladhī jaʻala al-ahillah mawāqīt li-ṣāliḥ al-aʻmāl, wa-ṣalātuhu wa-salāmuhu ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-musharrif lil-makān wa-al-zamān, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-kull man talāhum bi-iḥsān. Qiṣṣat Yūsuf fīhā bayān akhbār al-umam al-sālifah wa-al-qurūn al-māḍiyah, wa-fīhā min al-ʻibar wa-al-ḥikam wa-al-nukat wa-al-fawāyid allatī taṣluḥu lil-dīn wa-mā fīhā min siyar al-mulūk wa-al-mamālīk wa-al-ʻulamāʼ wa-makr al-nisāʼ wa-al-ṣabr ʻalá adhā [adhá] al-aʻdāʼ wa-ḥusn al-tajāwuz ʻanhum ..."
Secundo folio: nawāṭiq ḥassāsah wa-qīl.
15 x 18.5-19.5 cm; written surface: 9.5-10.5 x 13 cm; 12-13 lines per page.

Binding: Unbound (in 28 numbered quires). Some of the leaves in the quires are lined in blue and seem to have been taken from a ledger copybook. The text is written horizontally across the blue lines.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thālith. Muqtabas min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān li-ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-maʻrūf bi-al-Khāzin."
Folio 168 is blank.

Colophon: "Qad tamma al-juzʼ al-thālith ʻalá yad muʼallifihi Muḥammad Ismāʻīl ibn Ḥasan Ismāʻīl ibn Khalīfah Ibrāhīm, ghafara Allāh lahum wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi fī 14 Ramaḍān, sanat 1331 Hijrīyah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm. M.M."

Translation of the colophon: "The third part is completed by the hand of its author [i.e. copyist] Muḥammad Ismāʻīl ibn Ḥasan Ismāʻīl ibn Khalīfah Ibrāhīm, may God forgive them and all Muslims. Written on 14 Ramaḍān, 1331 of the Hijrah [17 August, 1913]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. It is completed. M.M."

record.title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-Raḥmān bi-kashf mā talabbasa fī al-Qurʼān : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā Shaykh mashāyikh al-Islām, malik al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu fasīḥ Jannatih: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nawwara qulūb al-ʻārifīn bi-Kitābihi al-ʻazīz, wa-aṭlaʻahum ʻalá khabāyā al-zawāyā bi-al-barāhīn [bi-al-burhān] al-qawīm, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá khayr al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-bararah al-kirām. Fa-hādhā mukhtaṣar fī dhikrāyāt al-Qurʼān al-mutashābihāt, al-mukhtalifāt bi-ziyādah, aw taqdīm, aw ibdāl, aw ghayr dhālik, maʻa bayān sabab al-ikhtilāf, wa-fī dhikr ghayr al-mukhtalifah, maʻa bayān sabab takrārih, wa-fī dhikr unmūdhaj min asʼilat al-Qurʼān al-ʻazīz wa-ajwibatihā ṣarīḥan, aw ishāratan, jamaʻtuhu min kalām al-ʻulamāʼ al-muḥaqqiqīn, maʻa mā fataḥa Allāh bi-hi min fayḍ faḍlihi al-matīn. Wa-sammaytuhu bi-Fatʹḥ al-Raḥmān bi-kashf mā talabbasa fī al-Qurʼān. Wa-Allāh asʼalu bi-hi wa-bi-jaʻlihi khāliṣan li-wajhihi, wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: al-ʻibādah ʻalá al-istiʻānah.
16 x 21.7 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 10 unnumbered quires).
In fair medium naskh script, in black ink on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Fatʹḥ al-Raḥmān bi-kashf mā talabbasa fī al-Qurʼān, lil-Imām Shaykh al-Islām Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, Qaddasa Allāh sirrahu. M."
Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."
Translation of the colophon: "The blessed book is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. God suffices us. He is the best advocate."

record.title: 880-03 al-Taysīr fī al-qirāʼāt al-sabʻ : manuscript / ʻUthmān ibn Saʻīd al-Dānī.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ al-muqriʼ Abū ʻAmr ʻUthmān ibn Saʻīd ibn ʻUthmān al-Madanī al-Dānī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-munfarid bi-al-dawām, al-mutaṭawwil bi-al-inʻām, khāliq al-khalq bi-qudratih, wa-mudabbir al-amr bi-ḥikmatih, lā rādda li-amrih, wa-lā muʻaqqiba li-ḥukmih, wa-huwa sarīʻ al-ḥisāb. Aḥmaduhu ʻalá jamīʻ niʻamih, wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá tatābuʻ ālāʼihi wa-minanih, wa-asʼaluhu al-mazīd min inʻāmih wa-al-jazīl min iḥsānih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá al-Bashīr al-Nadhīr, al-sirāj al-munīr, Nabīyinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Ammā baʻd, fa-innakum saʼaltumūnī an uṣannifa lakum kitāban mukhtaṣaran fī madhhab al-qurrāʼ al-sabʻah bi-al-amṣār, raḥimahum Allāh taʻālá, yaqrubu ʻalaykum mutanāwaluh wa-yasʹhulu ʻalaykum ḥifẓuhu ..."
Secundo folio: wa-tark al-taṭwīl wa-al-takrār.
11 x 16.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 13 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Taysīr lil-qurrāʼ al-sabʻah, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum ajmaʻīn. M."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mimmā manna Allāh, subḥānahu wa-taʻālá, bi-hi ʻalá ʻabdihi ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Shammāʻ, ghufira la-hu." Faded seal.

On folio 112a: A quotation, in a different hand, from Muḥammad ibn Ṭayfūr al-Sajāwandī (Ibn Ṭayfūr, Muḥammad, -1165 or 1166), on the different kinds of "waqf" (pausing in the recitation of the Qurʼān), probably from his book "al-Waqf wa-al-ibtidāʼ" (Pausing and continuation).
On folio 112b: An explanation, in a different hand, on the difference between "al-qaḍāʼ wa-al-qadar" (predestination) and negligence.

Colophon: "Kamula Kitāb al-Taysīr fī al-qirāʼāt al-sabʻ bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Darwīsh ibn al-Ḥājj Niʻmah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʻlīqihā ghurrata shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-mubārak, min shuhūr sanat 1118."

Translation of the colophon: "The book of 'al-Taysīr fī al-qirāʼāt al-sabʻ' is completed, by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Copied at the beginning of blessed Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 1118 [of the Hijrah = 4 February, 1707], by the poor to God, may He be praised, Darwīsh ibn al-Ḥājj Niʻmah, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl. Al-Juzʼ al-awwal : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar al-Bayḍāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The right half of the first leaf, and the center of the upper part of the second leaf, are torn off. The text starts with: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam [... ... ... ?] lil-ʻālamīn nadhīran, fa-taḥaddá bi-aqṣar sūrah min suwarihi [... ... ... ?] qadīran, wa-afḥama man taʻarraḍa li-muʻāraḍat [li-muʻāraḍatihi] min fiṣaḥāʼ ʻAdnān [... ... ... ?] thumma bayyana lil-nās mā nuzzila ilayhim ḥasba mā ʻanna [... ... ... ?] ulū al-alabāb tadhkīran, fa-kashafa lahum qināʻ al-inghilāq ..."
Secundo folio: baʻda an utmimahu bi-Anwār al-tnazīl wa-asrār.
18 x 26 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 23 cm; 35 lines per page.
Binding: The twenty-three seperate and unnumbered quires of the codex are placed in red leather cover with flap, the cover is tooled with geometric design.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the names of the sūrahs and verses of the Qurʼān in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On the left margin of the colophon, the following invocation by the copyist: "Allāhumma tawaffanī Musliman, wa-alḥiqnī bi-al-ṣāliḥīn, wa-ikhtim lī bi-khayr wa-ʻāfiyah mink, wa-li-wālidayya wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, bi-jāh Rasūlika Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ṣalātan dāʼimah ilá Yawm al-Dīn."

The codex starts with the commentary on Sūrat al-Fātiḥah (Qurʼān, Chapter one), and ends with the commentary on Sūrat al-Naḥl (Qurʼān, Chapter sixteen), as follows: "... Wa-ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Naḥl, lam yuḥāsibhu Allāh bi-mā anʻama ʻalayhi fī dār al-dunyā, wa-in māta yawma talāhā, aw laylahu, kāna la-hu min al-ajr ka-alladhī māta wa-aḥsana al-waṣīyah. Ṣadaqa Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min itmām hādhā al-juzʼ al-awwal, bi-faḍl Allāh, ʻalá yad ʻabdihi al-ḍaʻīf al-faqīr, asīr al-shahawāt wa-al-zallāt, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Yāsīn al-Ḥāfiẓ al-Wakham, ghafara Allāh dhunūbah wa-satara ʻuyūbah fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Fī awākhir Ṣafar al-khayr, sanat 1272, ithnayn wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "This first volume was completed, by the favor of God, at the hand of His feeble servant, a captive of lusts and errors, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Yāsīn al-Ḥāfiẓ al-Wakham, may God pardon his sins and cover his shortcomings, in this world and the hereafter, and pardon his parents and all Muslims, entirely. Amen. Amen. Amen. Dated, the end of Ṣafar, 1272 [10 November, 1855]."

record.title: 880-03 Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl. Al-Juzʼ al-awwal : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar al-Bayḍāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The first leaf of the codex is missing; text starts with: "... al-sharʻ wa-asāsuhā lā yalīqu li-taʻāṭīhi wa-al-taṣaddī lil-takallum fīhi illā man baraʻa fī al-ʻulūm al-dīnīyah kullihā, uṣūlihā wa-furūʻihā, wa-fāqa fī al-ṣināʻāt al-ʻArabīyah wa-al-funūn al-adabīyah bi-anwāʻihā. Wa-la-ṭāla mā uḥaddithu nafsī bi-an uṣannifa fī hādhā al-fann kitāban yaḥtawī ʻalá ṣafwat mā balaghanī min ʻuẓamāʼ al-ṣaḥābah wa-ʻulamāʼ al-tābiʻīn, wa-man dūnahum min al-salaf al-ṣāliḥīn, wa-yanṭawī ʻalá nukat bāriʻah wa-laṭāʼif rāʼiʻah istanbaṭṭuhā [istanbaṭtuhā] anā wa-man qablī min afāḍil al-mutaʼakhkhirīn wa-amāthil al-muḥaqqiqīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-sammaytu wa-majīʼ sumá ka-hudá.
20.5 x 30 cm; written surface: 11.3 x 22.2 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding (in 31 unnumbered quires), cover tooled with decorative frame and central medallion.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān in large script; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the label glued to the front cover: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min al-Bayḍāwī. sanat 1002."
On a folded sheet inserted at the front of the codex is an English translation of the first three and half lines of the manuscript.

The text ends with: "... Wa-ʻanhu ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man qaraʼ Sūrat al-Kahf min ākhirihā kānat la-hu nūran min qarnihi ilá qadamih, wa-man qaraʼahā kullahā kānat la-hu nūran min al-arḍ ilá al-samāʼ."
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, min yad ʻabd ḍaʻīf al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá, ʻUmar ibn Walī. 1002."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the feeble, miserable and poor to the mercy of God, may He be praised, ʻUmar ibn Walī. 1002 [of the Hijrah = 1593 or 1594]."

record.title: 880-03 Lāmīyat al-afʻāl : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mālik.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi lā abghī bi-hi badalā // ḥamdan yuballighu min ruḍwānihi al-amalā ..."
Secundo folio: Dhā al-wāwi fāʼan awi al-yāʼi ʻaynan.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 16 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound, wrapped in a larger sheet (folded to 16.5 x 24 cm).

In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; text fully vocalized; catchwords. The last six verses are written in fair naskh, in a different hand.
On folios 1a (in pencil): "al-Lāmīyah fī ʻilm al-ṣarf."

On folio 2a: "Hādhā Matn al-Lāmīyah fī ʻilm al-ṣarf, taʼlīf sālik ashraf al-masālik alladhī huwa bi-qawāʻid al-ʻulūm khabīr nāsik, lisān kull niḥrīr fātik, Sayyidī al-Imām wa-al-Shaykh al-humām, sāḥil al-abḥur, shuyūkh al-anām, wa-qamar al-tamām, wa-miṣbāḥ al-nās fī al-ẓalām, shāyiʻ al-dhikr ʻinda al-khāṣṣ wa-al-ʻāmm, wa-shaykh kull muqriʼ ʻallām, al-Sayyid al-mumajjad, wa-al-kanz al-nafīs al-musaddad, Mawlāy wa-Sayyidī al-Shaykh al-Sayyid Muḥammad, alladhī bi-hi nār shawqī tukhmad, wa-ʻasāhu yutḥifunī bi-lamḥah minhu li-asʻad, fa-min riḥābihi lā yuṭrad, al-shahīr bi-Ibn Mālik, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Yā Karīm."
Colophon: "... Wa-ann yuyassira lī saʻyan akūnu bi-hi // mustabshiran jadhilan lā bāsiran wajilā. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "... May He (God) facilitate to me an endeavor in which // I will be joyous and happy not saddened and frightened. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad the illiterate Prophet and on his family and companions and grant them peace. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 al-Shamāʼil : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá al-Tirmidhī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ḥāfiẓ Abū ʻĪsá Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá ibn Sūrah al-Tirmidhī: al-Bāb al-awwal fīmā jāʼa fī khalq Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Akhbaranā Abū Rajāʼ Qutaybah ibn Saʻīd ʻan Mālik ibn Anas ʻan Rabīʻah ibn Abī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ʻan Mālik annahu samiʻahu yaqūlu: Kāna Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, laysa bi-al-ṭawīl al-bāyin, wa-lā bi-al-qaṣīr, wa-lā bi-al-abyaḍ al-amhaq, wa-lā bi-al-ādam ..."
Secundo folio: ḥamrāʼ, aḥsan min Rasūl Allāh.
14.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: The three unnumbered quires are placed in a yellow cardboard cover with flap; the cover is smaller in size than the quires.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: The book is mistakenly attributed to al-Ghazzālī: "al-Shamāʼil. Ḥujjat al-Islām al-Ghazzālī, al-musammá bi-al-Laʼālī."
On the back of the front cover the attribution of "al-Shamāʼil" to al-Ghazzālī is refuted: "Bal huwa lil-Imām Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá al-Tirmidhī."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir Kitāb Shamāʼil al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Ḥurrirat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād, Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Ḥanafī al-Rīḥāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi fī al-Qusṭanṭīnīyah sanat 1142."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of Kitāb Shamāʼil al-Nabī, may God pray on him and grant him peace. This blessed copy was written by the hand of the weakest of the servants, Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Ḥanafī al-Rīḥāwī, may God forgive him and his parents, in al-Qusṭanṭīnīyah [Constantinople/Istanbul, Turkey], in the year 1142 [of the Hijrah = 1729 or 1730]."

record.title: 880-03 Uns al-munqaṭiʻīn li-ʻibādat Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn : manuscript / al-Muʻāfá ibn Ismāʻīl ibn Abī al-Sinān al-Mawṣilī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Muʻāfā [al-Muʻāfá] ibn Ismāʻīl ibn al-Ḥusayn ibn Abī al-Fatʹḥ ibn Abī al-Sinān: Istakhartu Allāh taʻālá fī jamʻ kitāb yashtamilu ʻalá thalāthimiʼat Ḥadīth ʻan Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá thalāthimiʼat ḥikāyah, wa-atbaʻtuhā abyātan min al-shiʻr, maḥdhūfat al-asānīd, ṭāliban lil-ikhtiṣār, qāṣidan bi-hi wajh al-ʻAzīz al-Ghaffār, li-yantafiʻa bi-hā man waqafa ʻalayhā wa-yurshada man addat fikratuhu ilayhā, wa-Allāh al-mustaʻān wa-ʻalayhi al-tiklān ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-ushkur faḍīlata ṣunʻi Allāh.
12.2 x 19.8 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14.7 cm; 14-26 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding with flap.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script (in different hands), in black ink on white aging paper; headings in red with some in green and blue; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf: An invocation against headache and another invocation against all sicknesses.
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī mulk al-ḥaqīr al-mukmad ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Aḥmad, sanat 1165 [of the Hijrah = 1751/1752]."

On folio 1b: "Kitāb Uns al-munqaṭiʻīn, wa-huwa yashtamilu ʻalá thalāthimiʼat Ḥadīth ʻan Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá thalāthimiʼat ḥikāyah, wa-yatbaʻuhā abyātan [abyātun] min al-shiʻr, thalāthumiʼah. Jamʻ al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ Ismāʻīl ibn Abī al-Sinān, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu, wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu, wa-nafaʻa bi-hi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 2a: Two ownership statements: "Lā zāla hādhā al-kitāb yasūquhu sāʼiq al-taqdīr ilá [an] insalaka fī mulk al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Khaṭīb, bi-Qalʻat al-Shām." "Tamallka hādhā al-kitāb, min faḍl musabbib al-asbāb wa-muʻtiq al-riqāb, Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ʻabduhu al-Shaykh Ḥasan ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-musaṭṭar khaṭṭuhu aʻlā [aʻlá] hādhā al-khaṭṭ, al-Imām wa-al-Khaṭīb bi-Qalʻat Dimashq al-Shām, fī shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat 1146 [1734/1735] [corrected to] 1145 [1733/1734]."

On folio 137a: An invocation which the Prophet Muḥammad taught to his grandson al-Ḥasan, quoted from "Kitāb Bughyat dhawī al-aḥlām bi-khabar man furrija karbuhu bi-ruʼyat al-Muṣṭafá fī al-manām" of al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ḥalabī (little known author, died around 1022/1613. See Kaḥḥālah 7:83).
On folio 139a: An invocation quoted from Mukhtaṣar al-Jāmiʻ al-kabīr of al-Suyūṭī; quoted also from Kitāb al-Waṣāyā of Ibn al-ʻArabī.
Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of God, may He be praised, and His abundant benevolence. May prayer and peace be on His Prophet Muḥammad, his family and his companions. It is completed."

record.title: Bible (fragment).
record.note: Script: neat, small Gothic bookhand
Decoration: the leaf has no decoration, though spaces remain for initials with guide letters present.
Layout: 2 columns of 57 lines each. Brown ink.

record.title: Prayers in Anglo-Norman French and Latin (fragment).
record.note: Script: Gothic bookhand.

Decoration: two decorated 3-line initials and one decorated 2-line initial with vegetal motif in blue, pink, green, red, and gold; decorated 1-line initials in blue with red penwork; line fillers in blue, pink, and gold; half border with vine motif in blue, pink, and gold.
Layout: 1 column of 17 lines; in brown ink.

record.title: Covers from a medical textbook with historical annotations (fragment).
record.note: Script: early modern script in more than one hand.
Decoration: little decoration is present, though the scribe has included several decorative capital letters of varying heights at the bottom of one of the sheets.
Layout: the fragments are not ruled and the various texts are arranged haphazardly and oriented in different directions.

record.title: Summary of plans to investigate an unknown incident (fragment).
record.note: Script: neat Gothic rotunda.
Decoration: a series of three geometric penwork designs appear in the top margin of both the fragment's recto and verso.
Layout: 1 column of 34 lines. Black ink.

record.title: Bond concerning hunting rabbits (fragment).
record.note: Script: documentary cursive hand for both Middle English and Latin.
Decoration: no decoration present.
Layout: one side of the document contains the Middle English text while the other contains the Latin. Brown ink.

record.title: Partial leaf from the Epistola (fragment).
record.note: Script: neat Protogothic bookhand.
Decoration: no decoration present.
Layout: 2 columns of 19/20 surviving lines.

record.title: Sénéchal (fragment).
record.note: Script: early Gothic vernacular hand.
Decoration: remnants of a 3-line initial in red and rubrics.
Layout: remains of 2 columns of 33 lines each. Black ink.

record.title: Breviari d'Amor (fragment).
record.note: Accompanied by: nineteenth-century printed description in French and translation into modern French.
Script: main text in vernacular Gothic bookhand. Marginal notes in a late medieval hand and an early modern hand.
Decoration: nine four-line initials in alternating red and blue with contrasting penwork. Two two-line initials in red. A single red capitulum mark. Rubrics present in red.
Layout: single column of thirty lines; the initial letter of each line is set slightly apart. Light brown ink.

record.title: Legal documents (fragment).
record.note: Script: small Gothic cursive documentary script.
Decoration: no decoration is present.
Layout: in a single column with 3-4 line capitals at changes in sections. Holes along the right side of the document suggest this fragment may have been sown together with another item.

record.title: To the editor of the Morning Chronicle : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.

record.title: Duke of Beaufort letter, to Lord Orrery, 1711 May 3 : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger from text written on front and back of folded sheet.
One folded sheet with internal pages blank.

Laid in preceding page 261 in volume one of an extra-illustrated copy of: The history and antiquities of the city and suburbs of Worcester ... / by Valentine Green. London : Printed for the author by W. Bulmer and Co., and sold by G. Nichol ... [and 13 others], MDCCXCVI [1796].

record.title: James Worcester, signed letter to the Governor of the bounty of Queen Anne for the augmentation of small liviings, 1762 May 21 : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger from text written on front and back of folded sheet.
One folded sheet with internal pages blank.

Window-mounted following page 216 in volume one of an extra-illustrated copy of: The history and antiquities of the city and suburbs of Worcester ... / by Valentine Green. London : Printed for the author by W. Bulmer and Co., and sold by G. Nichol ... [and 13 others], MDCCXCVI [1796].

record.title: Journal du siège de la citadelle d'Anvers par un detachement de l'armée du roy en 1746 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.
Original paper wrapper; remains of green silk ribbon.

record.title: Letters to Elizabeth Alder, 1765 February-1774 September : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

record.title: James Sampson account book : manuscript.
record.note: The volume also contains a few unrelated notes in an unidentified hand and accounts dated 1811.
Title "1815 Foreign Letter Book. 22" has been added to the back board.
Binding: original parchment, stitched.

record.title: Essay on the diseases most fatal to infants : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.

record.title: Essays on potatoes and hay : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

record.title: La clemence de Titus : drame lirique en trois actes. Traduit litteralement de l'italien de Metastase : manuscript / par mesdames Justine & Julie de Chamborant, chanoinesses-comtesses de l'Argentière.
record.note: Title from title page.
Binding: contemporary full red calf, gilt.

record.title: William Redgrave invoice for Sir Robert Kennedy, King's Road, Pimlico, London : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

"W. Redgrave, King's Road, manufacturer of pheasantries, aviaries, larders, varandas & greenhouses, pleasure ground fences, gates, balconies & ornamental works in general"--Engraved as letterhead text, followed by four engraved lines illustrating types of fences, gates, and other ornamental garden features.
Third page blank. Last page with manuscript address panel "Sir R. Kennedty Bt. Wimpole Street, No. 75" and remains of wax seals.

record.title: Commonplace book concerning Scottish and English theology : manuscript.
record.note: Ownership signature of Anthony Addington dated 1726 on front pastedown.
Laid in: autograph letter, signed, from "W. Hatton" to "Sir," dated 7 May 1849, sending this manuscript to the unidentified recipient.
Binding: contemporary full calf.

record.title: Jeweler's pattern book : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Binding: original half calf over marbled boards; worn.

record.title: Sentences of the philosophers.
record.note: The manuscript contains a dedicatory preface from George Hermonymus to "Gulielmum," the Abbot of St. Albans, either William Albon (1465-1475) or William of Wallingford (1476-1492); this manuscript was probably presented while Hermonymus was on a diplomatic mission to England between 1475 and 1476. The coat of arms of the Totewhill family of Cornwall have been overpainted in the heraldic miniature.
Script: main text in a humanist hand, possibly that of George Hermonymus. Later English and Latin verses in three early modern hands.

Decoration: heraldic illumination on f. 1v of two angels holding a coat of arms, overpainted to that of the Totewhill family (sable, three covered cups argent); the mitre associated with the abbacy of St. Albans floats above. Borderwork around the miniature consists of gold leaf and alternating red and blue flowers. 1 four-line gilt initial "M" on 2r with accompanying blue and red design and gold borderwork with blue and red background. Between 1 and 3 two to three-line gilt initials per page with blue and red background. Rubrics in red.
Layout: single column of 14 lines.
Binding: original, worn velvet over wooden boards.

record.title: Architectura militar : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.
Binding: eighteenth-century full calf; spine gilt. Red spine tag in gilt: "Architect. Militar" horizontally aligned.

record.title: True relation of a strange passage betwene a certain coniurer and a yong nobleman. set down by Boissardus, as followeth : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.
Ownership annotation in margin of first page; "Narcissus Luttrell His Book. 1682. A Collection of Miscellaneous Papers."

record.title: An inventory of the Scots Arms, Hermitage, Wapping, 1824 / Mess. Taylor & Co., to Mr. James Woods : manuscript.
record.note: Title from first line of text.
In original plain wrapper.

record.title: Statutes of Hereford cathedral : manuscript.
record.note: Title from spine tag.
Bookplate of Joseph Joseph, F.S.A. on front pastedown.
Ownership inscription of T. F. Davies, September, 1864 on front pastedown.
Binding: late 19th-century full soft buff leather. Red spine tag with gilt lettering: "The Statutes of Hereford Cathedral."

record.title: Traicté d'aymer dieu.
record.note: Script: neat, regular Roman script.
Decoration: two decorated initials of reserved Roman capitals on grounds of acanthus leaves with a hatched design traced in brown ink.
Layout: ruled in red ink; up to 22 lines in a single column per page. Rubrics in red; one rubric in blue.

Binding: bound in 19th-century English binding of full dark blue morocco; smooth spine with gilt filets and gilt title "S. Bernard de l'amour de Dieu" and date at foot of spine "MS Saec. XV". Center of boards contains gilt heraldic arms and the motto of Philip Augustus Hanrott, "Carpe Diem."

Ownership Marks: first flyleaf contains an unidentified stamp with illegible letters; image appears to contain a village scene with a church in the background. Stamp in blue on f. 1r: "BIBLIOTHEQUE d'Armand de Crochard, Fontaine Milon, Maine et Loire". Coat of arms with motto of Philip Augustus Hanrott ("Carpe Diem") on front and back boards of binding.

record.title: John Walker commonplace book : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: original marbled paper covers bound into later marbled boards; leather spine.

record.title: Commonplace book on Shakespearean actors and actresses : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Binding: original quarter red roan morocco over marbled boards.
Stationer's label: Partridge & Cooper, 1 & 2 Chancery Lane, & 191 & 192 Fleet Street, London.

record.title: 880-03 al-Daqāʼiq al-muḥkamah fī sharḥ al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, zayn al-millah wa-al-dīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafar Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh, wa-aʻāda ʻalayya wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakatih bi-Muḥammad wa-ālih: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī iftataḥa bi-al-ḥamd kitābah, wa-ajzala li-man jawwadahu wa-ʻamila bi-hi thawābah, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-amīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-Muqaddimah al-manẓūmah fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān lil-Shaykh al-Imām ... Abī al-Khayr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Jazarī ... lammā iʻtaná bi-hā dhawū al-jidd wa-al-ijtihād, wa-kānat muḥtājah ilá bayān al-murād ... raʼaytu an aḍaʻa ʻalayhā sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓahā, wa-yubayyinu murādahā, wa-yubrizu daqāʼiqahā, wa-yuqayyid muṭlaqahā, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqahā, wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Daqāʼiq al-muḥkamah fī sharḥ al-Muqaddimah. Wa-ʻiddat abyātihā miʼah wa-sabʻah ʻalá mā fī akthar al-nusakh, wa-miʼah wa-thamāniyah ʻalá mā fī aqallihā ..."
Secundo folio: sammaytuhu bi-al-Daqāʼiq al-muḥkamah.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding.

In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the phrases of the verses of al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah in purple and red; some notes on the margins; some wormholes on the margins without loss of text; catchwords.
Folio 38 is blank.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Jazarīyah li-Shaykh al-Islām."

al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah starts with: Yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa Rabbin sāmiʻī // Muḥammadu Ibn al-Jazarīyi al-Shāfiʻī. And ends with: Abyātuhā Qāfun wa-Zāyun fī al-ʻadad // Man yuḥsini al-tajwīda yaẓfar bi-al-rashad."

Colophon: "Wa-qad tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr Ismāʻīl ibn al-marḥūm Ṣāliḥ, fī yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, fī sanat ʻashr [?], iftitāḥ Muḥarram, wa-huwa min sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-thalāthah wa-sabʻūn, 1273, min baʻd al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed commentary was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of its copyist, the poor Ismāʻīl ibn al-marḥūm Ṣāliḥ, on blessed Tuesday, in the year ten [?], the beginning of Muḥarram, the year 1273 after the Hijrah of the Prophet [1 September, 1856], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-03 al-Daqāʼiq al-muḥkamah fī sharḥ al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-huwa ḥasbī. Qāla Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, zayn al-millah wa-al-dīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī ...: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ifatataḥa al-ḥamd bi-kitābah, wa-ajzala li-man jawwadahu wa-ʻamila bi-hi thawābah, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-amīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-Muqaddimah al-manẓūmah fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm lil-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-ḥabr al-humām, Shaykh al-Islām, ḥāfiẓ al-ʻaṣr wa-al-awān Abī al-Khayr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Jazarī al-Shāfiʻī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh, wa-jaʻala al-Jannah maʼwāh, lammā iʻtanā bi-hā dhawū al-jidd wa-al-ijtihād, wa-kānat muḥtājah ilá bayān al-murād, wa-ḥawat, maʻa ṣighar al-ḥajm wa-ḥusn al-ikhtiṣār, mā lam taḥwihi fī hādhā al-fann kathīr min al-kutub al-kibār, raʼaytu an aḍaʻa ʻalayhā sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓahā, wa-yubayyinu murādahā, wa-yubrizu daqāʼiqahā, wa-yuqayyid muṭlaqahā, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqahā, sammaytuhā bi-al-Daqāʼiq al-muḥkamah fī sharḥ al-Muqaddimah. Wa-ʻiddat abyātihā miʼah wa-sabʻah ʻalá mā fī akthar al-nusakh, wa-miʼah wa-thamāniyah ʻalá mā fī aqallihā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ghayruh wa-lā taʻāruḍ bayna al-riwāyatayn.
13.5 x 18 cm; written surface: 8 x 12 cm; 16 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good, medium naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the phrases of the verses of al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah in red; many notes on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Daqāʼiq al-muḥkamah fī sharḥ al-Muqaddimah, aʻnī al-Jazarīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, zayn al-millah wa-al-dīn, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, Abū Yaḥyá, al-Qāḍī Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakatih. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A reader wrote: "Ṭālaʻa fīhi afqar al-wará ilá rabbih, Muḥammad ibn [...] dāʻiyan li-mālikih wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn bi-al-maghfirah, ʻasá an yadkhula maʻahum."

al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah starts with: Yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa Rabbin sāmiʻi // Muḥammadu Ibn al-Jazarīyi al-Shāfiʻī. And ends with: Wa-qad taqaḍḍá naẓmiya al-Muqaddimah // minnī li-qāriʼi al-Qurʼān taqdimah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh la-hā khitāmu // thumma al-ṣalātu baʻdu wa-al-salāmu. ʻalá Nabīyin jāʼa bi-al-Qurʼān // Muḥammadin wa-ṣafwati al-Raḥmān ... Wa-fī nuskhah, baʻda wa-al-salām: ʻAlá al-Nabīyi al-Muṣṭafá wa-ālihi // wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-tābiʻī minwālihi.
Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman kathīran."
Translation of the colophon: "The commentary is completed by the praise of God and His help. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace."

record.title: 880-02 al-Qawāʻid al-muqarrarah wa-al-fawāʼid al-muḥarrarah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Qāsim ibn Ismāʻīl al-Baqarī.
record.note: Title from reference sources and the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-muʻtarif bi-dhunūbihi al-rājī min rabbihi satra ʻuyūbihi, Muḥammad ibn Qāsim ibn Ismāʻīl al-Muqrī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá afḍālih, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, shahādatan, shahādatan arjū bi-hā al-najāh min ʻadhābih, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammad ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-muwaffaq fī aqwālihi wa-afʻālih, ṣallá Allāh wa-sallama ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-qāʼilīn bi-maqālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān an ajmaʻa risālatan tashtamilu ʻalá mā yataʻallaqu bi-madhhab kull wāḥid min al-qurrāʼ bi-infirādih, sālikan ṭarīq al-ikhtiṣār, fa-ajabtuhu ilá suʼlih, ṭāliban lil-thawāb, sāʼilan min Allāh an yajʻalahā khāliṣatan li-wajhih. Wa-qad jamaʻtu fīhā mā istafadʹtuhu min durūs Shaykhī wa-qudwatī ... al-Syakh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Yamanī ..."
Secundo folio: limā yurīdu wa-bi-yadihi al-khayr.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 21-26 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In large naskh script, in black ink on white paper; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi risālah ʻaẓīmat al-nafʻ li-man arāda al-akhdh bi-al-qirāʼāt al-sabʻ, dhukira fīhā qawāʻid al-qurrāʼ al-sabʻ wa-ruwātuhum, wa-mā li-kull wāḥid minhum min madd al-munfaṣil, wa-ibdāl al-hamz al-sākin, wa-tasʹhīl al-hamazāt, wa-tarqīq al-rāʼāt, wa-tafkhīm al-lām, wa-maʻrifat al-idghām, ka-al-mutaqāribayn, wa-al-mathalayn, al-kabīr wa-al-ṣaghīr, wa-ghayr dhālik, kamā sa-tarāhu mufaṣṣalan, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, bi-tamāmih wa-kamālih, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, ʻumdat al-muḥaqqiqīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, zubdat al-mudarrisīn, al-Shaykh al-ajall, Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Baqarī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
At the end of the text: An invocation by the anonymous copyist (folio 14b).

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-lā yaʼtī al-ishmām, li-annahu mubdal. Wa-kadhā idhā waqaʻa hamz baʻda mutaḥarrik, naḥwa al-malaʼ, fa-dhakara baʻḍuhum fīhi al-rawm, wa-qaraʼnā bi-hi ʻalá Shaykhinā. Wa-ẓāhir kalām al-Shāṭibī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-mā taqaddama fī al-wāw al-aṣlīyah wa-al-yāʼ kadhālik, fa-naqala ʻan baʻḍihim ziyādah ʻalá mā taqaddam, al-idghām. Wa-man manaʻa al-rawm, wa-iʻtadda bi-maḥḍ sukūn al-hamz, wa-alḥaqa al-maksūr wa-al-maḍmūm bi-al-maftūḥ faqad salaka ṭarīqn tawaghghulan."

record.title: 880-02 al-Mukarrar fīmā tawātara min al-qirāʼāt al-sabʻ wa-taḥarrar : manuscript / ʻUmar ibn Qāsim al-Nashshār.
record.note: Title from reference sources and the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Starts with: "Sūrat Umm al-Qurʼān. Qaraʼa ʻĀṣim wa-al-Kisāʼī 'Mālik' bi-alif baʻda al-mīm, wa-qaraʼ al-bāqūn 'Malik' bi-ghayr alif, wa-adgham al-mīm min 'al-Raḥīm' fī mīm 'Malik' Abū ʻAmr bi-khilāf ʻan al-Dūrī wa-al-Sūsī; fa-min riwāyat al-Dūrī al-iẓhār ashhar, wa-min riwāyat al-Sūsī al-idghām ashhar, wa-lā rawm fī hādhā al-idghām, limā fī dhālika min al-kulfah al-ḥāṣilah bi-inṭibāq al-shafatayn wa-al-waqf ʻalá 'Yawm al-Dīn' fīhi. Li-jamīʻ al-qurrāʼ fīhi arbaʻat awjuh ..."
Secundo folio: bi-baʻḍ al-ḥarakah wa-qad dhukira qarīban.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding (in 22 numbered quires); with central medallions; the inside of the covers tooled with frames and small central circle in gold.

In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink on white paper; the phrases of the Qurʼān which have different readings are preceded by "qawluhu taʻālá" (His saying, may He be praised) in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes on the margins, without loss of text; catchwords.
Folios 218-220 are blank.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Mukarrar fī ʻilm al-qirāʼah."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, dhakir [dhākir] luṭf [...] Rabbihi al-wāduud [al-wadūd] ʻabduhu [... ... ...] Abū Ghazālah, ʻafá Allāh ʻanu. Āmīn." An illegible seal.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends, with a paragraph in a different hand, as follows: "Qawluhu taʻālá 'al-Kitāb bi-al-ḥaqq', qaraʼa Abū ʻAmr bi-khilāf ʻanhumā, bi-idghām al-bāʼ fī al-bāʼ, wa-al-bāqūn bi-al-iẓhār. Qawluhu taʻālá 'fī buṭūn ummahātikum' qaraʼa Ḥamzah wa-al-Kisāʼī fī al-waṣl ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Durr al-naẓīm fī faḍāʼil al-Qurʼān al-ʻAẓīm wa-al-āyāt wa-al-Dhikr al-Ḥakīm : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Asʻad al-Yāfiʻī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aṭlaʻa min āfāq Kitābih al-ʻAzīz nayyirāt awḍāḥ al-ghurar, wa-ḥaffahu bi-āthār al-karāmāt wa-karāmāt al-athar, wa-jaʻalahu baḥran yakhruju minhu fawāʼid al-jawāhir wa-nafāʼis al-durar, wa-amadda nārīyat al-afhām bi-nūrīyat al-ilhām, fa-tajallat minhu bawāhir al-āyāt wa-ʻajāʼib al-ʻibar. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna Allāh jaʻala Kitābah lil-adwāʼ shifāʼ, wa-li-ṣadaʼ al-qulūb jalāʼ, fa-huwa al-nūr alladhī lā yushbihuhu nūr, wa-al-burhān alladhī tushfá bi-hi al-nufūs, wa-thushraḥu bi-hi al-ṣudūr, fa-raʼayt an ajmaʻa fī hādhā al-kitāb bayna kitāb al-Barq al-lāmiʻ wa-al-ghayth al-hāmiʻ maʻa [min] taʼlīf al-Faqīh al-Qāḍī Abī Bakr al-Ghassānī, wa-bayna kitāb fīhi Khawāṣṣ āyāt min al-Qurʼān wa-fawātiḥ min al-suwar lil-Imām Ḥujjat al-Islām, wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Durr al-naẓīm fī faḍāʼil al-Qurʼān al-ʻAẓīm wa-al-āyāt wa-al-Dhikr al-Ḥakīm ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalayhi al-salām annahu qāl.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 20-23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 17 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; many magic squares in red and black; some notes on the margins in different hands; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Durr al-naẓīm fī faḍāʼil al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm wa-al-āyāt wa-al-Dhikr al-Ḥakīm, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-ʻārif al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, al-qudwat al-maslak, al-muḥaqqiq, al-muʼaddib, Sayyidī ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāfiʻī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-barakatihi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi al-Muslimīn fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālih. Āmīn. M."
At the head of folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjāri."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhih al-nuskhah al-mubārakah ṣabīḥat yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, rābiʻ shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, iftitāḥ ʻām 1167, sanat sabʻah wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Wednesday morning, 4 Muḥarram, the start of the year 1167 [1 November, 1753] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ. Al-Juzʼ 9 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bāb al-Khurūj fī al-tijārah, wa-qawl Allāh taʻālá 'Fa-intashirū fī al-arḍ, wa-ibtaghū min faḍl Allāh'. Ḥaddathanā Muḥammad ibn Sallām, akhbaranā Mukhlid ibn Yazīd, qāl, anbaʼanā Ibn Jurayj, qāl, [akhbaranī ʻAṭāʼ ʻan ʻUbayd] ibn ʻUmayr anna Abā Mūsá al-Ashʻarī istaʼdhana ʻannī ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, fa-lam yuʼdhin la-hu, wa-ka-annahu kāna mashghūlan, fa-rajiʻa Abū Mūsá, fa-farigha ʻUmar, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, fa-qāl: A-lam asmaʻ ṣawt ʻAbd Allāh ibn Qays? Iʼdhunū la-hu. Qīl: Qad rajiʻ. Fa-daʻāhu, fa-qāl: Kunnā nuʼmaru bi-dhālik. Fa-qāl: Taʼtīnī ʻalá dhālika bi-al-bayyinah ..."
Secundo folio: majlis al-Anṣār fa-saʼalahum.
13.8 x 18 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 11.5 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; cover tooled with central medallion and decorative frame.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper with headings in red; text fully vocalized; catchwords.
On folio 1a: A reader's statement: "Tasharrafa bi-muṭālaʻatihi Ḥusayn ibn Niʻmah, ghufira la-hu."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Malaka al-juzʼ wa-mā qablahu wa-mā baʻdahu aḍʻaf al-wará Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá al-Faqīh al-Shāmī, sāmaḥahu Allāh bi-luṭfih."
Folio 102 is blank.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-juzʼ al-tāsiʻ min tajziʼat thalāthīn min al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ li-Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanh. Wa-yatlūhu awwal al-juzʼ al-ʻāshir, Bāb al-Muzāraʻah bi-al-shaṭr wa-naḥwuhu. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of part nine of thirty parts, of al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ, of Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī, may God have mercy upon him and be pleased with him. It will be followed by the beginning of part ten, titled 'Bāb al-Muzāraʻah bi-al-shaṭr wa-naḥwuhu'. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on the Seal of the Prophets [Prophet Muḥammad]."

record.title: 880-02 ʻArf al-taʻrīf bi-al-Mawlid al-Sharīf : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī.
record.note: Title of ʻArf al-taʻrīf bi-al-Mawlid al-Sharīf from incipit (folio 1b).
Title of Umm al-qurá fī madḥ Sayyidinā Rasūl Allāh khayr al-wará from incipit (folio 15b).
Title of Dīwān al-Wāʻiẓ al-Baghdādī supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of ʻArf al-taʻrīf bi-al-Mawlid al-Sharīf: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Hādhā Kitāb ʻArf al-taʻrīf bi-al-Mawlid al-Sharīf, akhbaranā bi-hi muʼallifuhu Shaykhunā al-ʻAllāmah Shams al-Dīn ibn al-Jazarī, adāma Allāh al-nafʻ bi-hi qirāʼatan ʻalayhi wa-naḥnu nasmaʻu ʻinda al-Mawlid al-Sharīf bi-Makkah al-Musharrafah, yawm al-Ithnayn, ḥādī ʻashar Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat thalāth wa-ʻishrīn wa-thamānimiʼah. Qāla al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī, jamaʻa Allāh shamlahu: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal bi-al-Mawlid al-Sharīf rabīʻa al-qulūb, wa-jalā bi-hi ʻan ʻibādihi al-ghumūm, wa-azāla bi-wujūdihi al-kurūb, wa-aṭfaʼa bi-hi nār al-shirk, wa-ṣadaʻa bi-hi īwān al-ifk, wa-rafaʻa bi-hi jamīʻ al-naqāʼiṣ wa-al-ʻuyūb, wa-aḍāʼa bi-nūrihi mashāriq al-arḍ wa-maghāribihā ishāratan ilá ẓuhūr hādhā al-dīn, fa-subḥāna ʻAllām al-Ghuyūb ..."
Secundo folio of ʻArf al-taʻrīf bi-al-Mawlid al-Sharīf: al-akramīn khuṣūṣan al-Khulafāʼ al-Rāshidīn.

Incipit of Umm al-qurá fī madḥ Sayyidinā Rasūl Allāh khayr al-wará: "al-Qaṣīdah al-mubārakah, al-farīdah al-muʻaẓẓamah, al-mutaqabbalah, allatī mā daʻā Allāh taʻālá aḥadun, baʻda qirāʼatihā, illā istajāba la-hu, wa-lā tawassala bi-hā mutawassil illā qabila tawassulahu, al-musammāh bi-Umm al-qurá fī madḥ Sayyidinā Rasūl Allāh khayr al-wará, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-azwājihi wa-dhurrīyātihi ʻadad mā khalaqa wa-baraʼa, naẓm al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah, al-Shaykh Sharaf al-Dīn, Abī ʻAbd Allāh, Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd al-Būṣīrī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-shakara saʻyahu fī madḥ Muṣṭafāh, wa-jamaʻanā fī dār karāmatihi wa-īyāh bi-Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kayfa yarqā ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalatʹhā samāʼu ..."
Secundo folio of Umm al-qurá fī madḥ Sayyidinā Rasūl Allāh khayr al-wará: Nasabun taḥsibu al-ʻulā bi-ḥulāhu.

Incipit of Invocation and praise to the Prophet Muḥammad and the Qurʼān by an anonymous author: "Allāhumma ijʻal sharāyifa ṣalawātik, wa-nawāmiya barakātik, wa-raʼfata taḥīyatik, wa-faḍāʼila ālāʼik, wa-azká taḥīyātik, wa-awfá salāmik, ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad ʻabdika, wa-nabīyika, wa-rasūlika, wa-dalīlika, wa-ḥabībika, wa-khalīlika, wa-najīyika, wa-khīratika min sāʼir al-bashar ..."
Secundo folio for An invocation and praise to the Prophet Muḥammad and the Qurʼān by an anonymous author: bi-al-iʻdhār wa-al-indhār wa-al-iqrār.

Incipit of Dīwān al-Wāʻiẓ al-Baghdādī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-faqīh, al-ʻālim al-fāḍil, Majd al-Dīn, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr ibn Rashīd al-Wāʻiẓ al-Baghdādī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu wa-ʻan wālidayhi, wa-ʻan jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, ajmaʻīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī faḍḍala baʻḍ al-nabīyīn ʻalá baʻḍ, wa-rafaʻa baʻḍahum fawqa baʻḍ darajāt, fa-ātá Ādam al-ṣafwah, wa-Ibrāhīm al-khullah, wa-Mūsá tisʻ āyāt bayyināt, wa-baʻatha ʻĪsá bi-ibrāʼ al-akmah wa-al-abraṣ wa-aḥyā ʻalá yadihi al-amwāt, aḥmaduhu ʻalá kull niʻamih al-sālifāt wa-ayādīhi al-mutalāḥiqāt ..."
Secundo folio of Dīwān al-Wāʻiẓ al-Baghdādī: wa-lam yataʻarraḍū lil-witr.

Invocation in verse by an anonymous poet (Istighāthah li-baʻḍihim), starts with: Yā man tafarrada ʻan ʻālin wa-ʻan dūnī // anta al-ilāhu alladhī qad qulta udʻūnī. And ends with: Wa-ighfir li-kātibihā bi-al-Hāshimī al-Qurashī // wa-bi-al-Ṣaḥābati ahli al-ʻilm wa-al-dīnī."
13 x 17.3 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap; covers tooled with central medallion and decorative frame.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; text within red frame; catchwords.
Folio 63 is blank.
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Min kutub al-faqīr ilá al-Ghanī [... ... ...] al-Ḥanafī. Fī sanat 10050 [i.e. 1050 of the Hijrah = 1640/1641]."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-Huwa ḥasbī. Intaqalat hādhihi al-mujalladah al-mushtamilah ʻalá al-Mawlid al-Sharīf, al-Taʻrīf bi-al-Mawlid al-Sharīf, lil-ʻAllāmah Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Jazarī, wa-[al-qaṣidah] al-musammāh bi-Umm al-Qurá fī madḥ Sayyidinā Rasūl Allāh khayr al-wará, naẓm al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd al-Būṣīrī [...?]."

On folio 1a: "Mawlid al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, al-musammá bi-ʻArf al-taʻrīf bi-al-Mawlid al-Sharīf, lil-ʻAllāmah Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Jazarī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu. Wa-hādhihi [Qaṣīdah] mubārakah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd al-Būṣīrī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu."
On folio 1a: A quotation from Kitāb al-Mujālasah of Aḥmad ibn Marwān al-Mālikī al-Dīnawarī, Qāḍī Aswān [Dīnawarī, Aḥmad ibn Marwān, -approximately 940. al-Mujālasah wa-jawāhir al-ʻilm].
On folio 15a: A reader's note dated 1158 of the Hijrah (1745/1746): "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻānīhi al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad Shiḥādhah min qaryat al-Marj, al-Biqāʻ, sanat 1158."
On folio 31a: "Hādhā Dīwān al-Shaykh Ibn Rashīd al-Wāʻiẓ al-Baghdādī."
At the upper left corner of folio 31a: The date 1181 (1767/1768) is repeated three times.
On folio 31a: An ownership note: "Tamallakahu al-faqīr al-Sayyid Sulaymān al-Qādirī, ghurrata Muḥarram al-ḥarām, 30 yawman, nahār al-Jumʻah, sanat 1181 [30 May, 1767]."
Folios 34-35 are left blank, lacking eleven verses from the "Qāfiyah of Alif", all the twenty-one verses from the "Qāfiyah of Bāʼ" and ten verses from the "Qāfiyah of Tāʼ".

Colophon of ʻArf al-taʻrīf bi-al-Mawlid al-Sharīf: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Allāhumma ijʻal afḍal ṣalawātik abadan, wa-anmā [wa-anmá] barakātik sarmadan, wa-azká taḥīyātik faḍlan wa-ʻadadan ʻalá ashraf al-ḥaqāʼiq al-īmānīyah wa-ṭawr al-tajallīyāt al-iḥsānīyah wa-mahbiṭ asrār al-raḥmānīyah, wāsiṭat ʻiqd al-nabīyīn, wa-muqaddam jaysh al-mursalīn wa-qāʼid rakb al-anbiyāʼ al-mukarramīn, wa-afḍal al-khalq ajmaʻīn ... al-khalīl al-aʻẓam wa-al-ḥabīb al-akram Sayyidinā Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd al-Muṭṭalib, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn ʻadad maʻlūmātik wa-midād kalimātik, kullamā dhakaraka al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrika al-ghāfilūn. Wa-sallama wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn."
On folio 62b: A reader's statement: "Naẓara fīhi al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānah Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥamzah, ghufira lahumā, bi-mannih."
Colophon of Umm al-qurá fī madḥ Sayyidinā Rasūl Allāh khayr al-wará: "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-ʻiddatuhā arbaʻmiʼah wa-arbaʻah wa-khamsūn."
Translation of the colophon of Umm al-qurá fī madḥ Sayyidinā Rasūl Allāh khayr al-wará: "It is concluded by the help of God and His abundant benevolence, in four-hundred and fifty-four verses."

Colophon of An invocation and praise to the Prophet Muḥammad and the Qurʼān by an anonymous author: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Allāhuma infaʻnā bi-āyātihi al-bayyināt, wa-irfaʻnā bi-kalimātihi al-muḥkamāt, wa-iḥfaẓnā bi-ḥurūfihi al-muʻjamāt, wa-iḥrisnā bi-suwarihi al-mufaḍḍalāt, wa-ihdinā bi-aʻlāmihi al-ẓāhirah, wa-qudnā li-aḥkāmihi al-bāhirah, wa-ʻidnā bi-anwārihi al-zāhirah, wa-ijmaʻ lanā bi-hi bayna khayry al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Innaka anta ahl al-taqwá wa-ahl al-maghfirah, bi-raḥmah mink, yā arḥam al-rāḥimīn. Tamm."
Colophon of Dīwān al-Wāʻiẓ al-Baghdādī: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon of Dīwān al-Wāʻiẓ al-Baghdādī: "It is concluded by the praise of God and His help. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Insān al-ʻuyūn fī sīrat al-Amīn al-Maʼmūn. Al-Juzʼ al-thālith : manuscript / Nūr al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: Title from printed versions and reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān [al-Raḥīm], wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Ghazwat Banī Liḥyān, bi-nāḥiyat ʻAsfān. Wa-Liḥyān bi-kasr al-Lām wa-fatʹḥihā, qabīlah min Hudhayl. [Lā] yakhfá an baʻda muḍī sittat ashhur min Ghazwat Banī Qurayẓah, ghazā Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, Banī Liḥyān, yaṭlubuhum bi-aṣḥāb al-Rajīʻ, ay, wa-hum Khubayb wa-aṣḥābuhu alladhīna qutilū bi-Biʼr Maʻūnah, ka-mā sayaʼtī dhikr dhālik fī al-sarāyā, ay, li-annahu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wajada, ay, ḥazina, wajdan shadīdan ʻalá aṣḥābihi al-maqtūlīn bi-al-Rajīʻ, wa-arāda an yantaqima min Hudhayl, fa-amar aṣḥābahu bi-al-tahayyuʼ, wa-aẓhara annahu yurīdu al-Shām, li-yudrika min al-qawm gharrah, ay, ghaflah ..."
Secundo folio: fa-ʻalá bukāʼī hādhā.
15.5 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 25-29 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding with flap and red leather spine.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; many wormholes with some loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thālith min al-Sīrah al-Ḥalabīyah, wa-bi-hi tamāmuhā, bi-ʻawnihi, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá."

Colophon: "Tammat al-Sīrah al-Ḥalabīyah. Raḥima Allāh muʼallifahā wa-kātibahā wa-sāmiʻahā wa-qāriyahā wa-al-dāʻī li-muʼallifihā billāh. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wāfaqa al-farāgh min itmām hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah fī awākhir shahr Shaʻbān al-muʻaẓẓam, min shuhūr sanat 1135, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá ʻafw al-Karīm al-Jawwād, ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭarābulusī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "al-Ḥalabīyah Biography is completed. May God have mercy upon its author, its copyist, the one who hears it, the one who reads it, and the one who beseeches God on its author's behalf. Amen. O Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. This blessed copy was completed at the end of the noble month of Shaʻbān, 1135 [of the Hijrah = 4 June, 1723], by the hand of the poorest servant, and the most needy to the forgiveness of the Generous and most Benevolent One, ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭarābulusī. May God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Mawāhib al-ladunīyah bi-al-minaḥ al-Muḥammadīyah. Al-Juzʼ al-awwal : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Khaṭīb al-Qasṭallānī.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: First leaf and title page missing. Starts with: "... Qāla ʻAbd Allāh: Fa-wallāh laqad raʼytuhum ṣarʻá Yawm Badr, thumma suḥibū ilá al-Qalīb, Qalīb Badr. Thumma qāala Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-atbaʻa aṣḥāb al-Qalīb laʻnah, wa-ustudilla bi-hādhā al-Ḥadīth ʻalá anna man ʻaraḍ la-hu fī ṣalātihi mā yamnaʻu inʻiqādahā ibtidāʼan, lā tabṭulu ṣalātuhu. Fa-law kānat najāsah fa-azālahā fī al-ḥāl wa-lā athara la-hā ṣaḥḥat ṣalātuhu ittifāqan, wa-ustudilla bi-hi ayḍan ʻalá ṭahārat farth mā yuʼkalu laḥmuhu, ʻalá anna izālat al-najāsah laysat bi-farḍ, wa-huwa ḍaʻīf ..."
Secundo folio: al-rūḥ min amr Rabbī.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm, 21-24 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap and red leather spine (in 36 mostly unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink on white paper; some headings in red some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Tamma al-juzʼ al-awwal min kitāb al-Mawāhib al-ladunīyah bi-al-minaḥ al-Muḥammadīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, yatlūhu fī al-juzʼ al-thānī, wa-huwa tamām al-kitāb, al-maqṣad al-khāmis, fī takhṣīṣihi, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, bi-khaṣāʼiṣ al-Miʻrāj wa-al-Isrāʼ, in shāʼa Allāh, taʻālá. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi fī al-yawm al-mubārak, al-khāmis min shahr Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu wa-ḥurmatuh, sanat wāḥid wa-sittīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm. Wa-katabahu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-ʻājiz bi-yadihi al-fāniyah, Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Salām al-Qarāfī al-Ṣiddīqī. Allāhumma ighfir dhunūbahu wa-ustur fī al-dārayn ʻuyūbahu, wa-li-man raʼa [raʼá] fīhi shayʼan wa-aṣlaḥahu, wa-li-man naẓara fīhi, wa-daʻā li-kātibihi bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-raḥmah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon: "The first part of al-Mawāhib al-ladunīyah bi-al-minaḥ al-Muḥammadīyah is completed. May the best of prayer and peace be upon the Prophet Muḥammad. It will be followed by the second part, which is the last part of the book, starting with the fifth chapter, God willing, on Isrāʼ and Miʻrāj [Night journey to Jerusalem]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Copied on the blessed day, the fifth of the noble and holy month of Ramaḍān, the year 1061 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [22 August 1651], may the best of prayer and peace be upon him. Written by the perishing hand of the weak and feeble servant, Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Salām al-Qarāfī al-Ṣiddīqī, may God forgive his sins and cover his shortcomings, in the two abodes [in this world and in the world to come]. May God also forgive him who finds a deficiency in the book and emends it, and him who looks into the book and beseech God to forgive and have mercy upon the copyist. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: 880-03 al-Shamāʼil : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá al-Tirmidhī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Kitāb Shamāʼil Sharīf. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ḥāfiẓ Abū ʻĪsá ibn Sūrah al-Tirmidhī al-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh: Bāb mā jāʼa fī khalq Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ḥaddathanā Abū Rajāʼ Qutaybah ibn Saʻīd ʻan Mālik ibn Anas, ʻan Rabīʻah ibn Abī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, ʻn Anas ibn Mālik, annahu samiʻahu yaqūl: Kāna Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, laysa bi-al-ṭawīl al-bāʼin, wa-la bi-al-qaṣīr, wa-lā bi-al-abyaḍ al-amhaq, wa-lā bi-al-ādam ..."
Secundo folio: qaṭṭu aḥsan minh.
14 x 20 cm; written surface: 8 x 13 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap.

In good naskh script, in black ink on white aging paper; headings and markings in red; text within frames of blue and gold; some corrections on the margins in black and red; some notes in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish on the margins; titles of the paragraphs on the different traits of the Prophet are written on the margins in red and numbered (1-53 "maṭlab"); catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Ḥadīth Sharīf. Ḥadīth Sharīf."
Folios 54a-55a are blank; text folios 2b-53b.
On folio 55b: Three miscellaneous maxims in Arabic, in a different hand.

Colophon: "Tammat. Qad faraghtu min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-musammá bi-al-Shamāʼil al-Sharīf fī māh Dh[ū] al-Qaʻdah, fī 17, baʻda al-ʻaṣr. Wa-anā Ḥāfiẓ ʻUthmān al-Tūqātī ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAlī, sanat 1181."

Translation of the colophon: It is completed. I, Ḥāfiẓ ʻUthmān al-Tūqātī ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAlī, finished copying this book, titled al-Shamāʼil al-Sharīf, in the afternoon of 17 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1181 [of the Hijrah = 5 April, 1768]."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-Arbaʻīn al-Nawawīyah : manuscript / Abū Zakarīyā Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-awḥad al-wariʻ, al-qudwah al-ḥāfiẓ, Muḥyī al-Dīn, muftī al-Muslimīn, ʻālim al-ʻulamāʼ, awḥad al-ʻālamīn, Abū Zakarīyā, Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Marwī ibn Ḥasan ibn Ḥusayn al-Nawawī al-Shāfiʻī, akrama Allāh tharāh wa-jaʻala al-jannah maʼwāh: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, qayyūm al-samāwāt wa-al-araḍīn, mudabbir al-khalāʼiq ajmaʻīn, bāʻith al-rusul, ṣalawāt Allāh wa-salāmuhu ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn, ilá al-mukallafīn, li-hidāyatihim wa-bayān sharāʼiʻ al-dīn bi-al-dilālāt al-qaṭʻīyah wa-wāḍiḥāt al-barāhīn ..."
Secundo folio: jamīʻ niʻamihi wa-asʼaluhu.
16 x 22.8 cm; written surface: 7x12; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap.
In good and clear naskh script, in black ink, on white thick paper; headings in red, numerous commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Arabʻīn al-Nawawīyah. Raḥima Allāh muʼallifahā wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

On folio 1a: Three verses of poetry recording in "ḥisāb al-jummal" (alphabetical reckoning) the date of birth, the date of death and age of the four Sunnī Islamic law scholars: Abū Ḥanīfah, Anas ibn Mālik, Ibn Ḥanbal and al-Shāfiʻī, with numerical calculations.
On folio 1a: Two Ḥadīths, one Nabawī and one "Qudsī" (a saying of the Prophet Muhammad in which the meaning is revealed by God and the phrasing is formulated by the Prophet)

Colophon: "Qāla al-Shaykh, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Fa-hādhā ākhir mā qaṣadtuhu min bayān al-Aḥādīth allatī jamaʻat qawāʻid al-Islām wa-taḍammanat mā lā yuḥṣá min anwāʻ al-ʻulūm fī al-uṣūl wa-al-furūʻ, wa-al-ādāb, wa-sāʼir wujūh al-aḥkām. Wa-hā anā adhkuru bāban mukhtaṣaran jayyidan [jiddan] fī ḍabṭ alfāẓihā murattabatan, liallā yughlaṭa fī shayʼ minhā, wa-yastaghnī bi-hā ḥāfiẓuhā ʻan murājaʻat ghayrihi fī ḍabṭihā. Wa-lillāh al-ḥamd awwalan wa-ākhiran, wa-ẓāhiran wa-bāṭinan. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Tamma. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The Shaykh, may God be pleased with him, said: This is the end of what I intended to demonstrate about the Ḥadīths which summarized the edicts of Islam and included numerous kinds of sciences, the principals and the subsidiaries, the ethical and the different rules. I am also introducing a very short chapter, enumerating alphabetically the technical terms it contained, so that no one will err in any of them, and the memorizer will have no need to refer to someone else to scrutinize it. Praise be to God, in the beginning and at the end, inwardly and outwardly. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Amen. It is completed. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Talkhīṣ wa-ikhtiṣār li-khuṭbat al-ʻAllāmah al-Qasṭallānī fī sharḥihi ʻalá al-Bukhārī : manuscript / Sulaymān ibn ʻUmar al-ʻUjaylī al-Jamal.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī sharaḥ bi-maʻārif ʻawārif al-Sunnah al-Nabawīyah ṣudūr awliyāʼih, wa-rawwaḥa bi-samāʻ Aḥādīthihā al-ṭayyibah arwāḥ ahl widādih wa-aṣfiyāʼih. Aḥmaduhu ʻalá mā waffaqa min irshādih wa-asdá min ālāʼih, wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá faḍlihi al-mutawātir al-kāmil al-wāfir, wa-asʼaluhu al-mazīd min ʻaṭāʼih wa-kashf ghiṭāʼih ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr, al-qalīl al-biḍāʻah al-kathīr al-taqṣīr, Sulaymān al-Jamal, khādim al-fuqarāʼ: Lammā raʼaytu al-Imām al-Qasṭallānī afād fī khuṭbat sharḥihi ʻalá Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī wa-ajād ... raʼaytu fī ʻibāratihi ṭūlan lā taḥtamiluhu ḍaʻafat al-ʻuqūl ka-amthālī, fa-aḥbabtu an akhtaṣirahā wa-ulakhkhiṣahā fī hādhihi al-awrāq li-yashula ʻalá al-qāṣir mithlī muṭālaʻatuhā wa-tafahhumuhā ..."
Secundo folio: baʻda ṣalāt al-Jumʻah bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azʹhar.
16.5 x 22.8 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17 cm; 25-27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in three unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and keywords in red; many notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
Folios 24-25 are blank.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā talkhīṣ wa-ikhtiṣār li-khuṭbat al-ʻAllāmah al-Qasṭallānī fī sharḥihi ʻalá al-bukhārī lil-faqīr Sulaymān al-Jamal, khādim al-fuqarāʼ, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-muḥibbīhi. Āmīn."
Colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih."
Translation of the colophon: "It is concluded by the praise of God and His help."

record.title: 880-02 al-Abḥāth allatī ka-al-baḥr al-jārī ʻalá ākhir Ḥadīth fī al-Bukhārī : manuscript / Tāj al-ʻĀrifīn ibn Muwaffaq al-Dīn.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala lil-dhunūb mukaffirāt, wa-hiya al-dhikr wa-al-ṣawm wa-sāʼir al-ʻibādāt, wa-jaʻala naql al-aqdām lil-masājid ʻalá ṭahārah li-adāʼ al-ṣalawāt māḥiyan lil-dhunūb wa-rāfiʻan lil-darajāt. Aḥmaduhu, subḥānahu wa-taʻālá, ʻalá mā asdá min al-ʻaṭīyāt, wa-ashkuruhu fī sāʼir al-azmān wa-al-awqāt ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-Sayyid Tāj al-ʻĀrifīn ibn Muwaffaq al-Dīn, maḥá Allāh ʻanhu sayyiʼātihi, wa-rafaʻa li-khidmat al-ʻilm darajātih: Qad aradtu an aktuba kitābah jāmiʻah, lil-fawāʼid ḥāwiyah, lil-abḥāth wa-al-taḥqīqāt wa-al-farāʼid ʻalá Ḥadīth khatama bi-hi jāmiʻuhu al-Imām al-Bukhārī ... wa-sammaytuhu al-Abḥāth allatī ka-al-baḥr al-jārī ʻalá ākhir Ḥadīth fī al-Bukhārī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-lākin khalā min al-alif allatī qabla al-tāʼ.
16.5 x 22.3 cm; written surface: 9 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
At head of folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá."

On folio 1a: "al-Abḥāth allatī ka-al-baḥr al-jārī ʻalá ākhir Ḥadīt fī al-Bukhārī, li-Mawlānā wa-Sayyidinā al-Ustādh al-aʻẓam wa-al-malādh al-ḥabr al-afkham al-akram, al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá wa-al-dāll ʻlayhi al-Sayyid Tāj al-ʻĀrifīn, lā zālat taʼālifuhu nāfiʻah lil-ṭālibīn, ʻalá madā [madá] al-ayyām wa-al-shuhūr wa-al-sinīn, bi-jāh Sayyid al-Mursalīn wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn wa-ṣaḥābatihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
There seems to be a gap between the end of folio 1b and the start of folio 2a.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat dhālik, yawm al-Thalāth, sabʻah wa-ʻishrūn min shahr Ṣafar, sanat thamānīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-rājī raḥmat Mawlāhu al-ghanī al-laṭīf, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Raydī al-Rifāʻī al-Azʹharī, ghafara Allāh lahumā wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Tuesday, 27 Ṣafar, 1180 [of the Hijrah = 4 August, 1766], by the poor to the mercy of his affluent and kind Lord, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Raydī al-Rifāʻī al-Azʹharī, may God forgive both of them and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Raʼūf ibn Tāj al-ʻĀrifīn al-Munāwī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala ahl al-Ḥadīth aʻlā manāzil al-tashrīf, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī shahidat al-āy al-Qurʼānīyah wa-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah bi-annahu al-sayyid al-ʻafīf, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-maʻṣūmīn fī maqālihim ʻan al-taḥrīf. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-raʼūf al-laṭīf, Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Raʼūf ibn al-Munāwī al-Ḥaddādī, kafāhu Allāh sharr kull munāwin wa-muʻādī: Hādhā kitāb awradtu fīhi mā waqaftu ʻalayhi bi-mā lam usbaq min al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah al-wāridah bi-al-asānīd min Khayr al-Barīyah, murattiban la-hu ʻalá bābayn, al-awwal fīmā ṣaddarahu al-Muṣṭafá, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, bi-lafẓ 'Qāla ʻazza wa-jall', wa-al-thānī fīmā ṣuddira bi-ghayrihā, wa-qawl Allāh taʻālá fī ḍimnihi. Wa-rattabtu kilā al-bābayn ʻalá ḥurūf al-muʻjam, sāʼilahu an yaghfira lī mā irtakabtuhu min al-dhunūb wa-yarḥam, innahu jawwād karīm, raʼūf raḥīm. Wa-sammaytuhu: 'al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah' ..."
Secundo folio: al-dīn wa-ammā allatī baynī wa-baynaka.
14 x 21 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
