In good and large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Niṣf al-thānī min Zahrat al-riyāḍ wa-nuzhat al-qulūb al-mirāḍ."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu. Min niʻam Allāh al-qadīr ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Muʼaqqit bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Kabīr bi-Ḥalab. Sanat 1099 [1687/1688]." An illegible seal. "Dakhala fī silk mulk al-Sayyid Muḥammad Hāshim ibn al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Muʼaqqit. Sanat 1237 [1821/1822]."

Colophon: "Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah al-musammāh bi-'Zahrat al-riyāḍ wa-nuzhat al-qulūb al-mirāḍ' ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-dhalīl, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-qadīr, Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf ibn ʻAltāz al-Jīzī, fī ʻāshir shahr al-Muḥarram, sanat aḥad wa-tisʻimiʼah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam." And on the right margin of the colophon: "Naqalahā lil-Shaykh Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad. Wa-nusikha kulluhu min al-nuskhah al-mubārakah al-muʼarrakhah fī sanat arbaʻīn wa-sabʻimiʼah al-Nabawīyah, mulk al-Shaykh <al-Shaykh> Shihāb al-Dīn [... ... ...] wa-qūbila wa-ṣuḥḥiḥa ʻalá qadr al-wisʻ wa-al-ṭāqah, wa-jaʻalahā Allāh taʻālá mubārakan ʻalayh, wa-nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-barakāt muṣannifihā. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Muḥammad wa-sallama taslīman kathīran."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy called 'Zahrat al-riyāḍ wa-nuzhat al-qulūb al-mirāḍ' was completed by the poor and humble servant, who aspires for the forgiveness of his mighty Lord, Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf ibn ʻAltāz al-Jīzī, on 10 Muḥarram, 901 [of the Hijrah = 9 October, 1495]. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace. And on the right margin of the colophon: "He copied it for al-Shaykh Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad. All of it was copied from the blessed copy, dated in the year 740 of the Prophet [1339/1340], owned by al-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn [... ... ...]. It was collated and corrected, as much as possible and to the best of ability; may God, Most High, render it a blessing on him, and May God, Most High, benefit us by the blessings of its author. May God pray on Muḥammad and grant him abundant peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Mukaffirāt lil-Badr al-Rashīd : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Qārī al-Harawī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The first four lines are water damaged and illegible: "... Iʻlam anna al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah al-maʻrūf bi-al-Badr al-Rashīd, raḥimahu Allāh, min al-aʼimmah al-Ḥanafīyah, jamaʻa akthar al-kalimāt al-kufrīyah bi-al-ishārah al-īmāʼīyah, fa-hā anā ubayyinu rumūzahā, wa-ubayyinu kunūzahā, wa-aḥullu ghumūḍahā, wa-uḥallī ḥumūḍahā, fa-fī al-Ḥāwī al-fatāwī [lil-fatāwī]: Man kafara bi-al-lisān wa-qalbuhu muṭmaʼinn bi-al-īmān fa-huwa kāfir wa-laysa bi-muʼmin ʻinda Allāh taʻālá. Intahá. Wa-huwa maʻlūm min mafhūm qawlihi taʻālá: Man kafara billāh min baʻdi īmānihi illā man ukriha wa-qalbuhu muṭmaʼinn bi-al-īmān, wa-lākin man sharaḥa bi-al-kufr ṣadran fa-ʻalayhim ghaḍab min Allāh ..."
Secundo folio: wāʻiẓ aw mudarris aw muṣannif.
11.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 14 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with green central medallion; cover heavily damaged.
In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; text within red frame; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Mukaffirāt lil-Badr al-Rashīd, lil-ʻAllāmah Mullā ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Qārī al-Ḥanafī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."

Colophon: "Tamma dhālika al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Katabahu al-ḥaqīr aḍʻaf al-ʻibād, bi-hi taqṣīr, Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥājjī ʻUthmān al-Ayyūbī, ghafara Allāh taʻālá dhunūbahu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-ustādhihi, ḥāmidan Allāh taʻālá, wa-muṣallīyan ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad, ʻalayhi al-salām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn, sanat aḥad wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. M.M.M."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King. Copied by the despised and weakest of the servants, the inadequate, Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥājjī ʻUthmān al-Ayyūbī, may God, may He be praised, forgive his sins, his parents, and his teacher. Praise be to God, may He be praised, and prayers upon His Prophet Muḥammad, may peace be upon him, and upon his family and all his companions. The year 1141 [1728/1729]. M.M.M."

record.title: 880-02 al-Durrah al-fākhirah fī kashf ʻulūm al-Ākhirah : manuscript / al-Ghazzālī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh mustaḥiqq al-ḥamd, al-bāriʼ al-laṭīf, al-mutaʻālī bi-al-ḥamd, al-mursil sawakib [sawākib] raḥmatih ilá jamīʻ khalqih, al-wāḥid al-aḥad, alladhī infarada ʻalá jamīʻ makhlūqātih bi-al-dawām wa-al-baqāʼ, amāta wa-aḥyā, fa-subḥānahu min ilāh, lam yattakhidh ṣāḥibatan wa-lā waladan ..."
Secundo folio: khalaqa ummat Muḥammad al-muʼminīn.
17 x 23.7 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 17.5 cm; 14-25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Bahjat al-ḥaqāʼiq, wa-qīl al-Durrah al-fākhirah fī kashf ʻulūm al-ākhirah, lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah Muḥammad al-Ghazzālī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. M M M M."
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Jumʻah min shahr Jumād Ākhir, fī ʻāshir yawm minhu, sanat alf w-miʼtayn wa-arbaʻat ʻashar. 1241 [i.e. 1214]."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on Friday, in the month of Jumād Ākhir, on the tenth day, the year one thousand two hundred and fourteen. 1241 [i.e. 1214 of the Hijrah = 9 November, 1799]."

record.title: 880-02 al-zajr bi-al-hajr : manuscript / Abū al-Faḍl Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Allāh taʻālá: Wa-aʻriḍ ʻan al-jāhilīn. Wa-qāla al-Ṭabarānī: Ḥaddathanā Abū Dharr Hārūn ibn Sulaymān al-Miṣrī qāl ḥaddathanā Yūsuf ibn ʻAdī qāl thanā Shihāb ibn khurāsh ʻan abīhi ʻan Yusayr ibn ʻAmr wa-kāna qad raʼá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qāl Iṣrim al-aḥmaq fa-laysa lil-aḥmaq min khayr min al-hijrān ..."
Secundo folio: Inna Amīr al-Muʼminīn qad arsalanī.
14 x 19.3 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā juzʼ yusammá al-Zajr fī al-hajr, taʼlīf khātimat al-ḥuffāẓ wa-al-mujtahidīn Abī al-Faḍl Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-ruḍwānih. Āmīn."

On folio 6a-6b: Quotation from al-juzʼ al-sādis wa-al-ʻishrīn min al-tadhkirah al-musammāh bi-al-Fulk al-mashḥūn: 'Qāl asmāʼ al-muhājirīn Saʻd ibn Abī Waqqāṣ kāna muhājiran li-ʻAmmār ibn Yāsir ḥattá mātā ..."

On folio 6b-7a: Quotation from Dīwān al-ṣabābah: "Fāʼidah. Qāla fī Dīwān al-ṣabābah: Wa-qad qassamū al-hajr ʻalá arbaʻat aqsām: Hajr dalāl, wa-hajr malāl, wa-hajr mukāfaʼah ʻalá dhanb, wa-hajr yūjibuhu al-bughḍ al-mutamakkin fī al-qalb ..."
On folio 7b: And endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
Colophon: "Intahá al-taʼlīf al-mubārak, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."
Translation of the colophon: "The blessed composition is completed. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma ṣallī [ṣalli] ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallim. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Faqīh al-Imām Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī al-Ḥasanī, laṭafa Allāh taʻālá bi-hi wa-binā wa-bi-man yaqifu ʻalaynā: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wāsiʻ al-jūd wa-al-ʻaṭāʼ, alladhī shahidat bi-wujūb wujūdihi wa-waḥdānīyatihi wa-ʻaẓīm jalālihi wujūb iftiqār al-kāʼināt kullihā fī al-arḍ wa-al-samāʼ, al-ʻazīz alladhī ʻazza mulkuhu ʻan an yakūna la-hu sharīk fī tadbīr shayʼ mā, fa-taʻālá wa-jalla ʻan al-shurakāʼ, al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, alladhī ʻammat niʻamuhu al-ʻawālim kullahā, fa-lā makhlaṣa li-kāʼin ʻan tilka al-naʻmāʼ, al-wāsiʻ al-karīm, al-munfarid bi-al-ījād ..."
Secundo folio: al-qulūb wa-al-alsinah wa-al-jawāriḥ.
10.5 x 15.2 cm; written surface: 5.2 x 9.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather binding.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins, the phrases of "Umm al-Barāhīn" preceded by the letter Ṣ and the commentary by the letter Sh, both in red; markings in red; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover: A reader's statement: "Naẓara fīhi al-ḥaqīr al-Sayyid Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh [...] al-Ḥanafī bi-Ḥalab. Sanat 135 [probably 1135 of the Hijrah = 1722/1723]."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb ʻAqāʼid al-Sanūsī, ʻalayhi al-raḥmah wa-al-riḍwān." "Kitāb ʻAqāʼid al-Sanūsī, ʻalayhi al-raḥmah wa-al-riḍwān bi-mannihi."

On folio 1a: Ownership statements, as follows: "Dakhala fī kutub Muḥammad ʻArabshāh ibn Muṣṭafá. Ghafara [Allāh] la-hu wa-satara ʻuyūbahu. Āmīn." "Dakhala bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī [... ...]". "Mulk al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-munkasir al-khāṭir, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi, ʻAlī ibn Ramaḍān, ghafara Allāh [...] [wa-]al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Sanat 1084 [of the Hijrah = 1673/1674]". An illegible ownership statemnt. "Tasharrafa bi-mulkatihi [bi-mulkīyatihi] al-Sayyid Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad Afandī al-Muftī bi-madīnat Ḥalab al-Shahbāʼ [...]". Two seals in the name of Aḥmad Rifʻat."
On folio 1a: "Yā Kubaykij Kubaykij. Adhhib al-ʻitt [al-ʻithth]." This statement is repeated three times.

On folio 4b: "... wa-hā anā amudduka thāniyan bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá bi-sharḥ lahā mukhtaṣar yukmilu laka minhā al-maqṣūd, wa-yakshifu laka, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá al-ghiṭāʼ ʻammā ubhima minhā min al-maʻná al-masdūd ..."
On folio 5a: "... wa-hādhā awān al-shurūʻ fī hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak, bi-faḍl Allāh taʻālá al-karīm al-wahhāb, fa-salhu subḥānuhu an yuʻīnanī ʻalayhi wa-yuwaffiqanī fīhi al-ṣawāb ..."
On folio 129b: Two invocations, one to be read at the beginning of the year and one at the end of the year.
Colophon: "Tammat ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānuhu Muḥammad ibn ʻUbayd min qaryat Bakfālūn, yawm al-Abiʻāʼ [al-Arbiʻāʼ] min shahr Shawwāl, sanat 1080."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor to Him, may He be praised, Muḥammad ibn ʻUbayd, from the village of Bakfālūn, on Wednesday [probably the 4th] of Shawwāl, 1080 [25 February, 1670]."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-mutabarrak bi-hi, waḥīd dahrih wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī al-Ḥasanī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu bi-mannih wa-faḍlih: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wāsiʻ al-jūd wa-al-ʻaṭāʼ, alladhī shahidat bi-wujūb wujūdihi wa-waḥdānīyatihi wa-ʻaẓīm jalālihi wujūb iftiqār al-kāʼināt kullihā ilayh, fī al-arḍ wa-al-samāʼ, al-ʻazīz alladhī ʻazza fī mulkihi ʻan an yakūna la-hu sharīk fī tadbīr shayʼ mā, fa-taʻālá Rabbunā wa-jalla ʻan al-shurakāʼ wa-al-wuzarāʼ, al-Raḥīm al-Raḥmān, alladhī ʻammat niʻamuhu al-ʻawālim kullahā, fa-lā makhlaṣa li-kāʼin ʻan tilka al-naʻmāʼ, al-wāsiʻ al-karīm, al-munfarid bi-al-ījād, fa-lā yustaṭāʻu shukr niʻamihi illā bi-mā huwa min niʻamihi al-jammāʼ ..."
Secundo folio: naḥmaduhu subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá.
16.5 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 7.3 x 11.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 11 unnumbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Umm al-Barāhīn" in red; extensive commentaries on the margins of the first 12 leaves; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn lil-muʼallif al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻumdah al-humām, al-ʻāmil al-ʻālim wa-al-quṭb al-wāṣil, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī al-Ḥasanī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-raḥimanā bi-hi. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak yawm al-Thulāth al-mubārak, rābiʻ ʻashar yawman khalat min shahr Shaʻbān, sanat 1234, ʻalá yad kātibihi wa-mālikihi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad Aḥmad Naʻīm al-Ṭaḥlāwī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī khirqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-ikhwānihi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-ghufrān al-dhanb wa-satr al-ʻayb, bi-mannika wa-karamika, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed commentary was concluded on blessed Tuesday, 14 Shaʻbān, 1234 [of the Hijrah = 8 June, 1819], by its copyist and owner, the poor and despised, Muḥammad Aḥmad Naʻīm al-Ṭaḥlāwī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī khirqatan, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren, all Muslims, and him who invokes [God] to pardon his sin and cover his blemish, by Your benevolence and generosity, O Most Merciful. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Qāla al-Shaykh al-faqīh Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī al-Ḥasanī, laṭafa Allāh taʻālá bi-hi wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wāsiʻ al-jūd wa-al-ʻaṭāʼ, alladhī shahida bi-wujūb wujūdihi wa-waḥdānīyatihi wa-ʻaẓīm jalālihi wujūb iftiqār al-kāʼināt kullihā ilayh, fī al-arḍ wa-al-samāʼ, al-ʻazīz alladhī ʻazza fī mulkihi ʻan an yakūna la-hu sharīk fī tadbīr shayʼ mā, fa-taʻālá wa-jalla ʻan al-shurakāʼ, al-Raḥīm al-Raḥmān, alladhī ʻammat niʻamuhu al-ʻawālim kullahā, fa-lā makhlaṣa li-kāʼin ʻan tilka al-naʻmāʼ, al-wāsiʻ al-karīm, al-munfarid bi-al-ījād, fa-lā yustaṭāʻu shukr niʻamihi illā bi-mā huwa min niʻamihi al-jammāʼ, al-Ghanī al-Quddūs ..."
Secundo folio: jallat ʻan al-ʻadd wa-al-iḥṣāʼ.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 33 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 6 numbered quires).

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Umm al-Barāhīn" preceded by the letter Ṣ and the commentary by the letter Sh in red; markings in red; some commentaries on the margins; some wormholes with some loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ ʻAqīdat al-Sanūsīyah, li-muʼallifihā, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-barakātihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn [Muḥammad Darwīsh] al-Abzārī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt. Āmīn. Āmīn". "Dakhala fī mulk kātibihi Muḥammad Rāshid, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wāfaqa al-farāgh min naskh hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah fī ithnā ʻashar yawman, min shahr [Muḥarram?] al-ḥarām al-mubārak, sanat 1147, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad kātibihi, al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Darwish al-Abzārī, al-Mālikī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was copied on the twelfth day in the Sacred and blessed month of [Muḥarram?], the year 1147 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the poor who admits his disability and insufficiency, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Darwish al-Abzārī, al-Mālikī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: Title from the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tawaḥḥada fī dhātih, wa-tanazzaha ʻan shawāʼib al-naqṣ fī nuʻūtihi wa-simātih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Ghanī al-Qadīr: Saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, aṣlaḥa Allāh taʻālá lī wa-lahum al-ḥāl wa-al-shān, an aktuba kitābah bahīyah ʻalá al-muqaddimah al-mashhūrah bi-al-Sanūsīyah, fa-insharaḥ ṣadrī li-dhālik, wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-mā hunālik, li-annahā wa-in kānat ṣaghīrat al-jurm, kabīrat al-ʻilm, muḥtawiyah ʻalá jamīʻ al-ʻaqāʼid, maʻa ziyādat al-fawāʼid, wa-li-dhālika kānat aḥsan al-muʼallafāt fī al-tawḥīd, wa-akhlaṣahā min al-ḥashw wa-al-taʻqīd. Wa-hā anā ashraʻu fī al-maqṣūd bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-maʻbūd, fa-aqūlu, wa-billāh taʻālá al-tawfīq. Qawluhu 'Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm' ..."
Secundo folio: bi-ḥaythu lā yakūnu muḥarraman.
17.7 x 23.4 cm; written surface: 12.8 x 19.3 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap (in 8 numbered quires).
In fair, large and clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, ʻalá al-Sanūsīyah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh tabāraka wa-taʻālá ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-sharīf yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, tisʻah ʻashar yawm khalat min shahr Rabīʻ Thāni alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-iḥdá wa-sabʻūn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh tabāraka wa-taʻālá ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble book was copied on blessed Monday, 19 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1271 [of the Hijrah = 9 January, 1855]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. May God, the Blessed and Exalted, pray on our Master Muḥammad, and all his family and companions, as long as He is remembered by those who remember, and forgotten to be remembered by the forgetful."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: Title from the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tawaḥḥada fī dhātih, wa-tanazzaha fī nuʻūtihi ʻan shawāʼib al-naqṣ wa-simātih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Ghanī al-Qadīr: Saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, aṣlaḥa Allāh lī wa-lahum al-ḥāl wa-al-shān, an aktuba kitābah bahīyah ʻalá al-muqaddimah al-mashhūrah bi-al-Sanūsīyah, fa-insharaḥ ṣadrī li-dhālik, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-mā hunālik, li-annahā wa-in kānat ṣaghīrat al-jurm, kabīrat al-ʻilm, muḥtawiyah ʻalá jamīʻ al-ʻaqāʼid, maʻa ziyādat al-fawāʼid, wa-li-dhālika kānat aḥsan al-muʼallafāt fī al-tawḥīd, wa-akhlaṣahā min al-ḥashw wa-al-taʻqīd. Wa-hā anā ashraʻu fī al-maqṣūd bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-maʻbūd, fa-aqūlu, wa-billāh al-tawfīq: Qawluhu 'Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm' ..."
Secundo folio: li-mā huwa al-qāʻidah min annahu.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 18 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap (in 6 numbered quires).

In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in purple on the upper margins of the pages; markings in red; the phrases of "al-Sanūsīyah" preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (his saying) in red and purple; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Sanūsīyah lil-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, adāma Allāh baqāhu. Āmīn. Yā Mawlāh."
On folio 1a: "Yā Kubaykij Yā Kubaykij Yā Kubaykij Imanaʻ hādhā al-ʻithth min hādhā al-kitāb."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Ḥasan Nāṣif. Sanat 1270 [of the Hijrah = 1853/1854]." A seal in the name of Ḥasan Nāṣif. "Min baʻdihi mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad Ismāʻīl. Sanat 1293 [of the Hijrah = 1876/1877]."
On folio 53b: Seal of Ḥasan Nāṣif. And an ownership statement: "Min baʻdihi kātibuhu al-faqīr Muḥammad Ismāʻīl."
leaf 54 is blank.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, aḥada ʻashar khalat min shahr Rajab al-ḥarām, sanat 1270, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād Ibrāhīm Ḥasan al-Musallamī nasaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. M. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was concluded on blessed Sunday, 11 Rajab, 1270 [of the Hijrah = 9 April, 1854], by the poorest of the servants, Ibrāhīm Ḥasan al-Musallamī nasaban, may God forgive him, his parents and the Muslims. Amen. M. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the illiterate Prophet, on his family and his companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: Title of Ḥashiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah from the printed version.
Title of Tuḥfat al-murīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd form folio 57b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tawaḥḥada fī dhātih, wa-tanazzaha fī nuʻūtihi ʻan shawāʼib al-naqṣ wa-simātih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Ghanī al-Qadīr: Saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, aṣlaḥa Allāh lī wa-lahum al-ḥāl wa-al-shān, an aktuba kitābah bahīyah ʻalá al-muqaddimah al-mashhūrah bi-al-Sanūsīyah, fa-insharaḥ ṣadrī li-dhālik, wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-mā hunālik, li-annahā, wa-in kānat ṣaghīrat al-jurm, kabīrat al-ʻilm, muḥtawiyah ʻalá jamīʻ al-ʻaqāʼid, maʻa ziyādat al-fawāʼid, wa-li-dhālika kānat aḥsan al-muʼallafāt fī al-tawḥīd, wa-akhlaṣahā min al-ḥashw wa-al-taʻqīd. Wa-hādhā awān al-sharʻ fī al-maqṣūd bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-maʻbūd, fa-aqūlu, wa-billāh al-tawfīq ..."
Secundo folio of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah: ay dhikran ghayr maḥḍ ka-al-Qurʼān.

Incipit of Tuḥfat al-murīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-munfarid bi-al-iʻdām wa-al-ījād, al-munazzah ʻan shawāʼib al-naqṣ wa-al-aḍdād, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh, al-qadīm, al-mukhālif li-mā ʻadāh fī al-kāʼināt, al-bāqī wa-hālik kull man ʻadāh min al-makhlūqāt. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-ṣādiq al-amīn, al-muballigh li-kull mā umira bi-tablīghih min Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, jawāhir al-maʻārif wa-azhār riyāḍ al-faṣāḥah wa-al-ʻawārif ..."
Secundo folio of Tuḥfat al-murīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd: wa-Allāh asʼal wa-bi-Nabīyihi atawassal.
16 x 21 cm; written surface: 9 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallions (in 18 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf: An endowment statement: "Awqafa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī." The word "Waqf" (Endowment) is also written on servral other pages in the codex.
Folio 55b-57a are blank.
On folio 57b: "... wa-sammaytuhā Tuḥfat al-murīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd ..."

Author's colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah (folio 54b): "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá ʻalá hādhā al-matn al-sharīf, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-mudhnib al-ḍaʻīf, al-muftaqir, al-Bājūrī Ibrāhīm, jalaʻahu [jaʻalahu] Allāh khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm, wa-nafaʻa bi-hi al-nafʻ al-ʻamīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn wa-sallam. Wa-sallāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min dhālik yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, fī Jumādá al-Awwal, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1227, sabʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-salām wa-azká al-taḥīyah. Wa-ghafara Allāh lanā, wa-li-waladaynā [wa-li-wālidaynā], wa-li-mashāyikhinā, wa-li-ikhwāninā fī Allāh taʻālá, aḥyāʼan wa-amwātan, wa-li-kāffat al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of author's colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah: "This is the end of what God, Most High, facilitated of the commentary on this noble text, by the sinner, feeble and despised servant, al-Bājūrī Ibrāhīm. May God render it worthy of His gracious face and benefit us from it abundantly. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions, and grant them peace. May peace be upon the Messengers [of God]. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. It was completed on blessed Monday, in Jumādá al-Awwal, of the year 1227 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [18 or 25 May, 1812], may the best prayer and the purest peace be upon him. May God forgive us, our parents, our masters, our brethren in God, Most High, the living among them and the dead, and all the Muslims. Amen. Amen."

Copyist's colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Thalāth, li-tisʻ wa-ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1206 [1260], alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sittīn, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá ʻafw al-Bārī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ʻĪsá al-Najjārī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslaimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Innaka qarīb mujīb al-daʻawāt, Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi, wa-ʻalá āl baytih, kullamā dhakaraka al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Tammat."

Translation of the copyist's colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Sanūsīyah: "This noble copy was completed on Tuesday, 29 Jumādá al-Ākhir, 1260 [of the Hijrah = 16 July, 1844], by the poor to the forgiveness of the Creator, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ʻIsá al-Najjārī, may God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims, men and women, and all believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. [O God], You are close and fulfills the needs [of those who call upon You] O Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and those of his household, whenever You are remembered by those who remember, and whenever He is not remembered by the forgetful. It is completed."

Colophon of Tuḥfat al-murīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, li-tisʻ wa-ʻishrīn khalat min Jumād al-Ākhir, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sittīn, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá ʻafw al-Bārī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Najjārī. Allāhumma, Ighfir la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼmīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Innaka qarīb, mujīb al-daʻawāt. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of Tuḥfat al-murīd ʻalá Jawharat al-tawḥīd: "This copy was completed on blessed Tuesday, 29 Jumād al-Ākhir, 1260 [of the Hijrah = 16 July, 1844], by the poor to the forgiveness of the Creator, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Najjārī. O God! Forgive him, his parents and Muslim men and women, and the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. You are close and fulfills the needs [of those who call upon You] O Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Sharqāwī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī ʻalá Umm al-barāhīn : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-Sharqāwī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-iʻtimādī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mutawaḥḥid fī dhātih, al-mutanazzih fī nuʻūt jabarūtih ʻan shawāʼib al-naqṣ wa-simātih, al-faʻʻāl li-mā yurīdu, fa-lā muʻāriḍ li-mā qaḍāhu, wa-lā rādda li-hibātih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wāsiṭat ʻiqd al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn, al-ṣādiq, al-muballigh li-amr Rabbih al-amīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-tābiʻīn, wa-tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān. Fa-yaqūlu kathīr al-masāwī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-mashhūr bi-al-Sharqāwī: Qad ṭalab minnī baʻḍ al-ikhwān an aktuba ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī ʻalá Umm al-barāhīn, al-musammāh bi-al-Ṣughrá ..."
Secundo folio: al-istighrāq mathalan fa-man naẓara.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 11 x 17 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 10 quires, some numbered).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat Shaykh al-waqt ʻalá al-iṭlāq, man thabuta faḍluhu ʻalá aqrānih bi-al-wifāq, shaykh al-muslikīn wa-ʻumdat al-muḥaqqiqīn, Shaykh shuyūkhinā, ʻAbd Allāh al-Sharqāwī, ʻalá Sharḥ al-Hudhudī, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-sādah al-aʻlām, wa-sallam."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-lā yaṣiḥḥu an yaqūla ʻajiztu ʻan al-qiyām, li-annahu laysa mawjūdan, wa-taʻalluqu al-ṣifah al-mawjūdah bi-al-maʻdūm khayāl maḥḍ, hākadhā maqālat al-Ashʻarī, wa-yarāhu baʻḍuhum bi-annahu lā yalzamu min kawn al-ṣifah mawjūdah annahā lā tataʻallaqu illā bi-al-mawjūd. Alā tará anna al-ʻilm wa-al-irādah mathalan ṣifatān wujūdīyatān wa-yataʻallaqān bi-al-maʻdūm, fa-al-ʻajz ʻalá taqdīr an yakūna ..."

record.title: 880-02 Taqāyīd ʻalá Sharḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām al-Laqānī li-Jawhart wālidih : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: Title from Incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Subḥānaka, mā qaddaraka aḥadun ḥaqqa qadrika. Wa-al-ḥamdu minka wa-ilayk. Wa-ṣalli wa-sallim ʻalá Sayyid kull man laka ʻalayhi siyādah, wa-wāsiṭat ḥijābika al-aʻẓam alladhī lā sabīla li-mujāwazatih, ʻabdika wa-rasūlika Muḥammad, al-dāll ʻalayka, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-atbāʻih, wa-dhurrīyatihi wa-ashyāʻih. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu ʻabd rabbih wa-rājī ḥasabih Muḥammad al-Amīr najjāh Allāh min kull khaṭīr. Āmīn: Hādhihi taqāyīd ʻalá Sharḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām al-Laqānī li-Jawharat wālidih, arjū min faḍl Allāh taʻālá al-luṭf fīhā wa-al-shukr li-mūlīhā [li-muʼallifihā] ..."
Secundo folio: li-qawlihi taʻālá la-hu al-asmāʼ al-ḥusná.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Unbound (in 10 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script; in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Yaqūlu man lā qawla la-hu, Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Miṣrī al-Azʹharī al-Mālikī al-Shādhilī: Wāfaqa al-kamāl laylat al-Khamīs al-thāniyah wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min sanat khams wa-thamānīn wa-miʼah wa-alf ..."

Translation of the author's colophon: "He who has no say, Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Miṣrī al-Azʹharī al-Mālikī al-Shādhilī, says: It was completed on Thursday night, 22 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1185 [of the Hijrah = 5 July, 1771]."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-qad wāfaqa al-farāgh minhā yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, al-muwāfiq thamān ʻashrah yawman khalat min shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1285, alf wa-miʼatayn wa-khamsah wa-thamānīn min Hijrat al-Muṣṭafá, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻaẓẓam, wa-sharraf, wa-majjad, wa-karram, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād, wa-aḥwajihim ilá alṭāfihi yawm al-maʻād, Muḥammad al-Shabīnī ibn al-marḥūm ʻAlī al-Shabīnī ibn al-marḥūm Ḥasan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi wa-li-kāffat al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, ka-mā [kullamā] dhakarahu al-dhākirūn, wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It was completed on blessed Tuesday, 18 Ṣafar, 1285 of the Hijrah of al-Muṣṭafá, may God pray on him, grant him peace, exalt, honor, glorify and revere him, by the poorest of the servants and the neediest to His [God's] favors, on the Day of Returning, Muḥammad al-Shabīnī ibn al-marḥūm ʻAlī al-Shabīnī ibn al-marḥūm Ḥasan, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren and all Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, whenever he is remembered by those who remember and forgotten to be remembered by the forgetful."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Muqaddimat Abī al-Layth : manuscript / Dhū al-Nūn ibn Aḥmad.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nazzala aḥsan al-ḥadīth hudan lil-muttaqīn, wa-bayyana bi-hi aṣwab al-ʻaqāʼid shirʻatan li-ahl al-yaqīn, wa-khaṣṣa min al-ʻibād man yashāʼu bi-raḥmatihi wa-istiqāmat al-dīn, wa-shayyada bunyān al-Islām wa-qawwá arkānahu bi-iqāmat al-ṣalāh fī al-ʻālamīn, wa-jaʻalahā farqan bayna al-ḥaqq wa-al-ḍalāl ilá Yawm al-Dīn, naḥmaduhu ʻalá mā razaqanā min tawātur ālāʼihi, wa-ʻalá al-rāsikhīn. Inna Allāh huwa al-razzāq, dhū al-qūwah al-matīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá nabīyihi al-ʻArabī, qudwat al-sālikīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-iswat al-sābiqīn Muḥammad.
26 x 33.7 cm; written surface: 18 x 24.5 cm; 9 lines per page.
In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap; the codex is in a case of marbled cardboard with cover and dark red leather on the edges.
In beautiful and large naskh script; in black, red, blue and gold ink, on white paper; folios 1a and 102b are ornamented in gold and blue; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Muqaddimat Abī al-Layth, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil kanz al-ṭālibīn wa-al-mujtahidīn ... ... ... al-Ḥanafī."
Author's name from colophon.
On the upper left corner of folio 1a: "... Muḥammad Asʻad al-Ḥamzāwī, ʻufiya ʻanh. Sanat 1272 [1855/1866]."

Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥamdih, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, baqīyat al-mujtahidīn, Dhū al-Nūn ibn Aḥmad, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá [bi-hi] fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed commentary is concluded by the help of God, Most High, and His praise, written by al-Shaykh al-Imām, the learned scholar, the remnant of the legists, Dhū al-Nūn ibn Aḥmad, may God benefit us through him in this world and the hereafter."

record.title: 880-02 Ḍawʼ al-maʻālī li-Badʼ al-amālī : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Qārī.
record.note: Title from folio folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī wajaba wujūd dhātih, wa-karam wujūdih wa-shuhūd ṣifātih, wa-ẓahara afʻāluhu al-ḥamīdah fī ṣaḥāʼif maṣnūʻātih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá zubdat makhlūqātih wa-ʻumdat mawjūdātih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-atbāʻih, fī ḥarakātihi wa-sakanātih. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-multajī ilá ḥaram Rabbihi al-Bārī ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Qārī: Lammā sharaʻtu fī sharḥ al-Fiqh al-akbar lil-Imām al-aʻẓam wa-al-humām al-aqdam, kāna fī nīyatī wa-ṭawīyatī an yakūna mukhtaṣaran ..."
Secundo folio: saʼaltahum man khalaqa al-samāwāt.
17 x 24.3 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard (in 3 unnumbered quires)
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "Badʼ al-amālī" in red; many notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Ḍawʼ al-maʻālī Sharḥ Badʼ al-amālī, lil-ʻAllāmah al-ʻumdah al-fahhāmah, ʻAlī al-Qārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-barakātih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih, wa-li-kātibihi, wa-li-man qaraʼ fīhi min al-ṭālibīn, bi-ḥurmat Sayyid al-Mursalīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu Ḍawʼ al-maʻālī li-Badʼ al-amālī ..."

On folios 28b-29a: An anecdote quoted from "al-Mishkāh" (could not be identified) about a miraculous translation of Khālid ibn al-Walīd (died 641 or 642) to the military camp of a certain enemy and his encounter there with a Christian monk.
Leaf 30 is blank.

Author's colophon (folio 28a): "Qāla al-shāriḥ, raḥimahu Allāh: Furigha min taʼlīfihi ʻalá yad muʼallifihi, bi-tawfīq Rabbihi wa-luṭfihi, fī khamsah shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, khutima bi-al-khayr wa-al-iqbāl, fī silk shuhūr ʻām thalāth wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf min al-Hijrah ilá al-Madīnah al-Mukarramah, wa-kāna dhālika bi-Makkah al-Musharrafah, zādahumā Allāh al-birr wa-al-mahābah. Kadhā dhakarahu fī aṣl al-nuskhah. Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-huwa al-murshid wa-[ilayhi] al-maʼāb."

Translation of the author's colophon (folio 28a): "The commentator, may God have mercy upon him, said: the author finished writing his work, by the benevolence and graciousness of his Lord, on 5 Rabī al-Awwal, may it end with wellness and prosperity, 1243 of the Hijrah to the noble Medina [26 September, 1827], in honored Mecca, may God increase the reverence and dignity of both cities. This is what was mentioned in the original copy. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. He is the guide and to Him is the returning."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taswīd hādhā al-kitāb al-naẓīf bi-luṭf Rabbihi al-laṭīf, fī shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah, min sanat ithnayn wa-thamānīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf, fī al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar, min yad afqar al-anām wa-aḥwajihim ilá al-Malik al-ʻAllām, Maḥmūd ibn al-ʻĀlim Bakr Afandī, ghafara Allāh lahumā wa-li-wālidayhimā, wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn. Āmīn. Yā mujīb al-sāʼilīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy of this neat book was completed in the month of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1282 [of the Hijrah = April/May, 1866], at al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar [in Cairo, Egypt], by the favor of the Gracious Lord to the poorest and the neediest of mankind to the All Knowing King, Maḥmūd ibn al-ʻĀlim Bakr Afandī, may God forgive both of them, their parents and all believers. Amen. O You who answers the requesters."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mutawaḥḥid bi-jalāl dhātih wa-kamāl ṣifātih, al-mutaqaddis fī nuʻūt al-jabarūt ʻan shawāyib al-naqṣ wa-simātih, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad, al-muʼayyad bi-sāṭiʻ ḥujajihi wa-wāḍiḥ bayyinātih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi hudāt al-ḥaqq wa-ḥumātih. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna mabná ʻilm al-sharāʼiʻ wa-al-aḥkām, wa-asās ʻaqāʼid al-Islām huwa ʻilm al-tawḥīd wa-al-ṣifāt, al-mawsūmah bi-al-kalām al-munjī min ghayāhib al-shukūk wa-ẓulumāt al-awhām, wa-inna al-mukhtaṣar al-musammá bi-al-ʻAqāʼid lil-Imām al-humām, qudwat ʻulamāʼ al-Islām, Najm al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, ʻUmar al-Nasafī, aʻlá Allāh darajatahu fī Dār al-Salām, yashtamilu min hādhā al-fann ʻalá ghurar al-fawāʼid wa-durar al-farāʼid ..."
Secundo folio: lil-dalāʼil ithra taḥrīr wa-tafsīr lil-maqāṣid.
16.5 x 23.3 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard (in 2 unnumbered quires)
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; many commentaries on the margins; the phrases of al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi qiṭʻah min 3 lil-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah wa-al-sharḥ lil-Saʻd al-Taftāzānī."
On the label pasted to the front cover: "Muḥammad Fuʼād. Faṣl thānī. Sanah ūlá bi-Madrasat al-Tajhīzīyah."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-al-adillah al-qaṭʻīyah qāʼimah ʻalá al-tanzīhāt, fa-yajibu an yufawwaḍa ʻilm [al-ʻilm] bi-al-nuṣūṣ ilá Allāh, ʻalá mā huwa daʼb al-salaf, īthāran lil-ṭarīq al-aslam, aw yuʼawwala taʼwīlāt ṣaḥīḥah, ʻalá mā ikhtārahu al-mutaʼkhkhirūn, dafʻan li-maṭāʻin al-Jāhilīyah, wa-jadhban [...] al-qāṣirīn sulūkan lil-sabīl al-aḥkam, wa-lā yushbihuhu shayʼ, ay, lā yumāthiluhu. Ammā idhā urīda bi-al-mumāthalah al-ittiḥād fī al-ḥaqīqah, fa-ẓāhir, wa-ammā idhā urīda bi-hā kawn al-shayʼayn, bi-ḥaythu sanadda aḥaduhumā sanad al-ākhar, ay, yaṣluḥu kamā yaṣluḥu al-ākhar, fa-li-anna shayʼan min al-mawjūdāt ..."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh [ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad]. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mutawaḥḥid bi-jalāl dhātih wa-kamāl ṣifātih, al-mutaqaddis [fī nuʻūt] al-jabarūt ʻan shawāyib al-naqṣ wa-simātih, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad, al-muʼayyad bi-sāṭiʻ ḥujajihi wa-wāḍiḥ bayyinātih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, hudāt ṭarīq al-ḥaqq wa-ḥumātih. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna mabná ʻilm al-sharāʼiʻ wa-al-aḥkām, wa-asās qawāʻid ʻaqāʼid al-Islām huwa ʻilm al-tawḥīd wa-al-ṣifāt, al-mawsūm bi-ʻilm al-kalām, al-munjī min ghayāhib al-shukūk wa-ẓulumāt al-awhām, wa-inna al-mukhtaṣar al-musammá bi-al-ʻAqāʼid, lil-Imām al-humām, qudwat ʻulamāʼ al-Islām, Najm al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, ʻUmar al-Nasafī, aʻlā Allāh darajatahu fī Dār al-Salām, yashtamilu min hādhā al-fann ʻalá ghurar al-fawāʼid wa-durar al-farāʼid ..."
Secundo folio: minhā mā yataʻallaqu bi-kayfīyat al-ʻamal.
14 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap, cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In fair and clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafī lil-Saʻd al-Taftāzānī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Fī nawbat al-faqīr ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥamādah al-Mardāwī. Sanat 1171 [of the Hijrah = 1757/1758]."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid lil-Taftāzānī ... ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 64a, after the colophon: A note by a reader/auditor (Shihāb al-Dīn ibn Aḥmad al-Dalḥamūnī), dated 10 Ramaḍan 1073 of the Hijrah (18 April, 1663), stating that he read the book with his teacher, al-Shaykh Sulṭān al-Mizāḥī, as follows: "Taḥammalahā kātib al-ḥurūf al-ḥaqīr Shihāb al-Dīn ibn Aḥmad al-Dalḥamūnī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Nuṣayrī kunyatan wa-laqaban, samāʻan min fam Shaykh al-ʻaṣr wa-al-zamān, nūr Allāh fī arḍih, Mawlānā wa-Sayyidinā, al-Shaykh Sulṭān al-Mizāḥī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, mattaʻa Allāh bi-wujūdihi al-anām, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī khatama Allāh bi-hi al-nubūwah wa-al-risālah khayra khitām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-tābiʻīhi, wa-ḥizbihi wa-ṣaḥābatihi ḥuamāt dīn al-Islām. Katabahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah al-ḥaqīr al-madhkūr, fī ʻā [ʻāshir] shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak, al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, aḥad shuhūr sanat 1073, rājiyan bi-dhālika mimman qaraʼahu, aw naẓara ilá shayʼ minhu an yadʻuwa bi-al-raḥmah la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn."

Colophon: "Najaz taḥrīr al-kitāb fī yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, khāmis ʻishrīn Jumādá al-Thānī, fī sanat 862 [... ...]. Wa-ʻallaqahu li-nafsihi al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed on blessed Friday, 25 Jumādá al-Thānī, 862 [... ... of the Hijrah = 19 May, 1458]. Copied by the despised Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī, for himself. May God forgive him and him who invokes [God] for his forgiveness."

record.title: 880-02 Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī.
record.note: Title from from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa li-ahl al-Sunnah al-Muḥammadīyah fī al-khāfiqayn aʻlāman, wa-waḍaʻa bi-wāḍiḥ adillatihim min shubah al-mukhālifīn aʻlāman, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lahu, shahādatan takūnu bi-al-takhalluṣ fī al-dārayn iʻlāman, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mamnūḥ man ittabaʻahu fī al-jinān aʻlāman, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih mā ubbidat qawāʻid al-ʻaqāʼid wa-mā ḥulliyat al-jiyād bi-jawāhir al-farāʼid. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-fānī, ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Qad kuntu lakhkhaṣtu mā ʻallaqahu Ustādhunā min ʻUmdat al-murīd ʻalá ʻaqīdatihi al-musammāh bi-Jawharat al-tawḥīd ..."
Secundo folio: fī al-jinān aʻlāman.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 6.7 x 13.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap (in 15 unnumbered quires)
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of Jawharat al-tawḥīd and markings in red; many notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 2b: "... wa-sammaytuhā 'Itḥāf al-murīd bi-Jawharah al-tawḥīd' ..."
"Jawhart al-tawḥīd" starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ṣilātihi // thumma ṣalāt Allāh maʻa ṣalāmihi."
Leaf 153 is blank.

Author's colophon (folios 151b-152a): "Qāla kātibuhu wa-jāmiʻuhu al-ḥaqīr ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī: Faraghtu min jamʻihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, li-ʻishrīn khalat min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr al-sābiʻah wa-al-arbaʻīn baʻda al-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm, wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author and compiler, the despised ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, said: I finished compiling the book on blessed Thursday, the twentieth of noble Ramaḍān, the year 1047 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [5 February, 1638], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful, He suffices me, He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, and grant them peace. Amen. Amen."

Owner/copyist's colophon: "Mulk al-faqīr al-dhalīl al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Muḥammad al-madʻū Shāfiʻī al-Bisāṭī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih."

Translation of the owner/copyist's colophon: "Owned by the poor and feeble, he who admits his inability and insufficiency, Muḥammad al-madʻū Shāfiʻī al-Bisāṭī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, and all Muslims. Amen, Amen, Amen, Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions."

record.title: 880-02 Fatḥ al-qarīb al-majīd bi-Sharḥ Jawharat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Barr ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ujhūrī.
record.note: Title from from incipit (folio 1b)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ʻlayhi tawakkulī wa-iʻtimādī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala lanā ilayhi ṭarīqan wa-sabīlan, wa-aqāma lanā ʻalá maʻrifatihi burhānan wāḍiḥan wa-dalīlan, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, shahādatan tamnaḥu qāʼilahā sharāban mizājuhu zanjabīlan, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, wa-ḥabībuhu wa-khalīluh, baʻathahu ilaynā muʻalliman wa-rasūlan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi bukratan wa-aṣlan [wa-aṣīlan]. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻAbd al-Barr ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn al-Shaykh Sayf al-Dīn al-Ujhūrī al-Shāfiʻī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu: Qad kuntu sharaḥtu manẓūmat Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā wa-Shaykhinā al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Laqānī al-musammah bi-al-Jawharah fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd sharḥan muṭawwalan, wa-qad suniḥa lī an akhtaṣirahu fī naḥw niṣf ḥajmihi, li-yashula al-tanāwul minhu ʻalá al-mubtadī, wa-lā yaqṣuru ʻan ifādat al-muntahī. Wa-ʻalá Allāh al-karīm iʻtimādī fīhi wa-fī ghayrihi min jamīʻ umūrī, dunyā wa-ukhrá, wa-ilayhi tafwīḍ [tafwīḍī] wa-isnādī. Wa-sammaytuhu Fatḥ al-qarīb al-majīd li-sharḥ Jawhart al-tawḥīd ..."
Secundo folio: wa-in kāna shiʻran li-annahu min baḥr al-rajaz.
15.5 x 22.2 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding (in 15 unnumbered quires)
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of Jawharat al-tawḥīd in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Jawharah, lil-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-ʻālim al-humām, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Barr ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Ujhūrī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Burhānī adaban. Wa-muʼallif al-Manẓūmah al-Laqānī. Raḥimahumā Allāh taʻālá, wa-nafaʻanā bi-himā fī al-dārayn, wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."
On folio 1a: Five verses of poetry in which are mentioned the names of the major prophets who ought to be believed: "Asmāʼ al-anbiyāʼ al-aʻlām alladhīna yajibu al-īmān bihim tafṣīlan."

On folio 1a: A quotation from an unidentified source about the difference between two different kinds of God's attributes: "Ṣift al-dhāt" and "Ṣifat al-fiʻl" (Essence and Action attributes), as follows: "Iʻlam anna al-farq bayna ṣifat al-dhāt wa-ṣifat al-fiʻl anna kull ṣifah lā yūṣafu Allāh bi-ḍiddihā fa-hiya ṣifat dhāt, ka-al-qudrah, fa-lā yūṣafu bi-ḍiddihā wa-hiya al-ʻajz, wa-al-ʻilm kadhālika lā yūṣafu bi-ḍiddihā, wa-hiya al-jahl. Wa-inna kull ṣifah yūṣafu bi-ḍiddihā, fa-hiya ṣiffat fiʻl, ka-la-hidāyah, fa-yūṣafu bi-ḍiddihā, wa-huwa al-iḍlāl, wa-ka-al-riḍá, ḍidduhu al-sukhṭ. Intahá."
"Jawhart al-tawḥīd" starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ṣilātihi // thumma ṣalāt Allāh maʻa ṣalāmihi."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā awradahu al-Shaykh al-Imām, wa-al-ʻālim al-humām, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Barr ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn al-Shaykh Sayf al-Dīn al-Ujhūrī baladan wa-masqaṭan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban wa-maḥtidan, al-Burhānī adaban, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu wa-ʻan wālidayhi wa-mashāyikhihi, wa-ʻan muʼallif hādhihi al-manẓūmah, al-ʻAllāmah al-Laqānī, wa-aqrānihi, wa-man yalūdhu bi-hi. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taswīdihi fī Shawwāl, sanat 1236 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what was written by al-Shaykh al-Imām, the diligent scholar al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Barr ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn al-Shaykh Sayf al-Dīn al-Ujhūrī baladan wa-masqaṭan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban wa-maḥtidan, al-Burhānī adaban, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, and the author of this poem, the learned scholar al-Laqānī, his colleagues, and his associates. Copied during the month of Shawwāl, the year 1236 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [July, 1821]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalá sayyid al-khalq Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim. Qāla al-faqīr al-ḍaʻīf al-miskīn ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-rājī min karamihi an yunjiyahu min al-qawm al-ẓālimīn, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī al-Shāfiʻī, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi fī shiddatah: Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh alladhī jaʻala al-duʻāʼ li-radd al-qaḍāʼ, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad Sayyid al-Anbiyāʼ, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-atqiyāʼ al-aṣfiyāʼ, fa-inna hādhā 'al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn', wa-silāḥ al-muʼminīn min khizānat al-Nabī al-amīn, wa-al-haykal al-ʻaẓīm, min qawl al-Rasūl al-karīm, wa-al-ḥirz al-maknūn min lafẓ al-Maʻṣūm al-Maʼmūn ..."
Secundo folio: min sharr al-nās wa-al-jinnah.
13 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 13.5; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding.

In beautiful naskh script, in black ink on white paper; text fully vocalized; the abbreviations of the sources of the sited Ḥadīths in red; markings in red; numerous commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn."
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi bi-khaṭṭ muʼallifihā, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."

On strips of paper pasted to the back of the front and back covers: "Hādhihi al-nuskhah qad tasharrafat bi-anwār maṭlaʻat al-Amīr Ḥasab Allāh, shaqīq Sulṭān Darfūr, alladhī sarāy iqāmatihi amām shāriʻ al-Sayyidiah Fāṭimah al-Nabawīyah, wa-li-ḥubbihi fī nasl al-Ḥusayn qad tasharrafnā bi-al-muthūl baynā yadayhi, lammā amar aḥad al-ashrāf aḥbābih bi-an yuḥḍiranā ilá ḥaḍratihi, li-ʻilmihim bi-annanā narghabu al-kutub al-nafīsah, fa-lammā iṭṭalaʻa ʻalayhim ikhtāra hādhihi minhum, wa-an yuʻṭīnā qīmat al-rahn aḍʻāf, fa-lam naqbal. Fa-yā awlādanā, takūnū malʻūnīn idhā taṣarraftum fīhā bi-thiqlihā almās idhā lam yaḥḍur al-sanad, wa-tusallam li-aṣḥabihā [li-aṣḥābihā]. Wa-alladhī waṣṣalahā ilaynā huwa al-Sayyid Bakrī al-Ḥusaynī al-Dimashqī, zawj al-sitt bint ibn bint bint ibn al-muʼallif. Wa-aṣl al-rahn kāna ʻalá khamsat Junayhāt Ifrankī, wa-akhadha ʻalaynā sanad muḥarrar la-hu bi-khaṭṭinā, bi-anna hādhihi al-nuskhah al-dhākirīn ʻanhā bi-al-īṣāl, bi-annanā lā nusallimuhā illā la-hu, aw, man yuʼtaman ṣārifuhu, wa-yursiluhu maʻahu, wa-nastalim al-mablagh minhu. Wa-bi-khilāf dhālik lā yumkin al-taslīm li-aḥad, wa-lā yaṣuḥḥ bayʻuhā, wa-lā yarhunuhā li-aḥad qaṭṭ. Thumma fī yawm al-safar akhadha Junayh Ifrankī wa-qayyadahu bi-al-sanad ayḍan. Thumma fī al-miḥaṭṭah ishtará baʻḍ ashyāʼ tablugh thalāthah wa-thalāthūn Ghirsh Ṣāgh, wa-tawajjaha, wa-ṣāra la-hu muddah lam yaḥḍur. Wa-bi-al-istiʻlām ʻanhu, qīla lanā innahu tawajjaha bi-tijārat bilād al-Turk, ḥasaba ʻādatih, wa-lam yaḥḍur li-Dimashq min muddah. Wa-bi-al-iṭṭilāʻ ʻalá hādhihi al-nuskhah min al-sādah al-akābir, dufiʻa lanā fīhā ʻasharat Junayhāt. Fa-naẓaran li-kawnihā amānah wa-marhūnah, lā saḥamat [samaḥat] nafsī bi-dhālika qaṭṭ."

On folio 105b (in red color): A note from an owner (or borrower): "Hādhihi al-nuskhah qad istaḥwaztu ʻalayhā min warathat al-muʼallif, wa-ṣarafnā min ajlihā jumlat maṣārīf, fī al-hadāyā lahum, tazīdu ʻan al-sittimiʼat Qirsh, li-ajl al-tabarruk bi-khaṭṭ al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-bi-asrārih. Āmīn. al-Faqīr Ḥusayn ibn Rāshid al-Mashhadī al-Ḥanafī. 11 Rajab, sanat 1282 [30 November, 1865]."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ajall, ruḥalat ajillat al-ʻualamāʼ, wārith ʻulūm al-anbiyāʼ ... Mawlānā Shams al-Dīn, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī ... Faraghtu min taṣnīf hādhā 'al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn' yawm al-Aḥad baʻda al-ẓuhr, al-thānī wa-al-ʻishrīn min Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat iḥdá wa-tisʻīn wa-sabʻimiʼah, bi-madrasatī allatī anshaʼtuhā bi-raʼs ʻAqabat al-Kattān, dākhil Dimashq al-maḥrūsah, ḥamāhā Allāh taʻālá min al-āfāt, wa-sāʼir bilād al-Muslimīn, hādhā, wa-jamīʻ Abwāb Dimashq mughlaqah, bal musaddah bi-al-aḥjār, wa-al-khalāʼiq yastaghīthūn ʻalá al-aswār, wa-al-nās fī juhd ʻaẓīm min al-ḥiṣār, wa-al-miyāh maqṭūʻah, wa-al-aydī ilá Allāh taʻālá bi-al-taḍarruʻ marfūʻah, wa-qad uḥriqa al-balad wa-nuhiba aktharuhu, wa-kull wāḥid khāʼif ʻalá nafsihi wa-ahlihi wa-mālih, wajilun min dhunūbihi wa-sūʼ aʻmālih, wa-qad taḥaṣṣana bi-mā yaqdiru ʻalayhi, fa-jaʻalatu hādhā al-Ḥiṣn ḥiṣnī, wa-tawakkaltu ʻalá Allāh wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-qad ajaztu awlādī Abā al-Fatḥ Muḥammadan, wa-Abā Bakr Aḥmad, wa-Abā al-Qāsim ʻAlīyan, wa-Abā al-Khayr Muḥammadn, wa-Fāṭimah, wa-ʻĀʼishah, wa-Salmá, wa-Khadījah, riwāyatahu sanadan ʻanī, maʻa mā yajūzu lī riwāyatuhu, wa-kadhālika ajaztu ahl ʻaṣrī. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu, awwalan wa-ākhiran, wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá Sayyid al-khalq Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-salāmuh. Allāhumma ighfir li-muʼallifihi, wa-kātibihi, wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi, wa-li-man daʻā lahum, wa-li-sāʼir al-Muslimīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá āl Muḥammad, wa-aṣḥāb Muḥammad, wa-sallam. Ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Subḥāna man lā yaʻlamu qadrahu ghayruh, wa-lā yablughu al-wāṣifūn ṣifatah."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, the most esteemed, al-Shaykh al-Imam, to whom the most learned scholars journey, the inheritor of the knowledge of the Prophets, Mawlānā, Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī, said ... I finished authoring this book, titled 'al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn', on the afternoon of Sunday, 22 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 791 [of the Hijrah = 20 December, 1389], at my school which I built at the top of ʻAqabat al-Kattān [neighborhood], inside protected Damascus (May the Almighty God protect it from calamities, and all the lands of the Muslims), during the time when all the gates of Damascus were closed, rather, blocked by boulders, while all the people were calling [upon God] for help, above the walls, whilst in great agony, because of the siege. The waters were cut off, the hands lifted up in supplication to God Almighty. The city was burnt, and most of it plundered. While everyone was afraid for himself, his family and his possessions, scared of his sins and evil acts, having fortified himself with whatever he could, I made this Ḥiṣn ["Fortress", i.e., the book which he authored] my fortress, entrusting myself to God, who suffices me and is my best advocate. I have authorized my children: Abū al-Fatḥ Muḥammad, Abū Bakr Aḥmad, Abū al-Qāsim ʻAlī, Abū al-Khayr Muḥammad, Fāṭimah, ʻĀʼishah, Salmá, and Khadījah, to transmit this book on my behalf, in addition to all what I myself am authorized to transmit. I have also authorized my contemporary scholars to do the same. Praise be to God alone in the beginning and at the end. May His prayers and peace be upon Muḥammad, the Lord of the created beings, and upon his family and his companions. May God forgive the author of this book, its copyist, its reader, he who beseeches God to forgive them, and all Muslims. Praise be to God, May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the family of Muḥammad, the companions of Muḥammad, and Muslims. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There in no power nor might except in God, the All Mighty, the All Powerful. Praise be to Him who no one knows his might except Him, and to whom no one can describe His attributes."
Copyist's colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Tamm."
Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá sayyid al-khalq Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim. Qāla al-faqīr al-ḍaʻīf al-miskīn al-munqaṭiʻ ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-rājī min karamihi an yunjiyahu min al-qawm al-ẓālimīn, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī, laṭafa Allāh taʻālá bi-hi fī shiddatah: Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh alladhī jaʻala al-duʻāʼ sababan li-radd al-qaḍāʼ, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad Sayyid al-Anbiyāʼ, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-atqiyāʼ al-aṣfiyāʼ, fa-inna hādhā 'al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn', wa-silāḥ al-muʼminīn min khizānat al-Nabī al-amīn, wa-al-haykal al-ʻaẓīm, min qawl al-Rasūl al-karīm, wa-al-ḥirz al-maknūn min lafẓ al-Maʻṣūm al-Maʼmūn badhaltu fīhi al-naṣīḥah, wa-akhrajtuhu min al-Aḥādīth al-ṣaḥīḥah ..."
Secundo folio: min kull ẓālim bi-mā ḥawá.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 13.5; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 10 unnumbered quires); red leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the abbreviations of the sources of the sited Ḥadīths in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover and on folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn lil-ʻAllāmah al-Jazarī."
Folio 96 is blank.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah laylat al-Sabt al-mubārak, ithnayn wa-ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1220 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá raḥmat al-Rabb al-karīm, ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī mawlidan, al-Fayyūmī aṣlan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻAlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble copy was completed on the night of blessed Saturday, the 22 of blessed Ramaḍān, 1220 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [14 December, 1805], may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the poorest of the servants to the mercy of the generous Lord, al-Ujhūrī mawlidan, al-Fayyūmī aṣlan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, and the Muslims. Peace be upon the messengers. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-Islām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Allāhumma ṣallī [ṣalli] wa-sallim ʻalá man ashraf asmāʼihi Sayyidunā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam ..."
Secundo folio: Aḥmad, Ḥāmid, Maḥmūd, Aḥyad.
8.2 x 11.2 cm; written surface: 5.2 x 8.7; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding, with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

In clear naskh script, in black ink on white paper; names of God and the Prophet Muḥammad in red; some headings and markings in red; on folios 7b and 8a are the representations of two chambers, decorated in red and blue, with lamps, two minarets and headstones of three tombs; catchwords.
Folios 107-110 are blank.

Colophon: "Qad tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah laylat al-Jumʻah al-mubārakah, sittah khalat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1264, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtari[f] bi-al-dhunūb wa-al-taqṣīr ilá Mawlāhu al-farḍ [al-fard] al-ṣamad, ʻabduhu Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Ḥājj ʻAlī Manīs, al-Muṭawwibī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Burhānī al-Shādhilī ṭarīqan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on the night of blessed Friday, 6 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1264 [of the Hijrah = 11 February, 1848], by the poor and despised, who confesses his sins and admits his deficiency to his Lord, the Peerless and the Everlasting, His servant, Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Ḥajj ʻAlī Manīs, al-Muṭawwibī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Burhānī al-Shādhilī ṭarīqan, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Kawkab al-mabānī wa-mawkib al-maʻānī sharḥ Ṣalawāt Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf, wa-sarḥ li-ṭayf al-khayāl al-muṭīf, kashafa bi-hi ʻAbd al-Ghanī ʻammā taḍammanahu al-matn min kull maʻnan sanī, wa-sirrun bi-hi jāmiʻuhu muʻtanī. Kayfa, wa-jāmiʻuhu, al-jāmiʻ al-fāriq, al-ʻālim al-mashhūr fī al-maghārib wa-al-mashāriq, al-ʻārif al-Rabbānī wa-al-haykal al-ṣamadānī, Janāb Abī Ṣāliḥ, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī, Shaykhunā ijāzatan wa-ʻahdan, wa-ubūwatan rūḥānīyah, muḥāḍanatan wa-mahdan, saqá Allāh taʻālá sāḥat qalbihi saḥāʼib al-madad al-dāʼim min samāwāt qurbihi, wa-qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu ... Alā wa-inna al-matn huwa kitāb al-Ṣalawāt al-Muḥammadīyah wa-al-taslīmāt al-mubārakāt al-Aḥmadīyah ... wa-laqad salaktu fīhā maslak al-ikhtiṣār, fa-inna ẓulmat hādhā al-waqt lā taḥtamilu ishrāq hādhihi al-anwār ... wa-sammaytuhu 'Kawkab al-mabānī wa-markab al-maʻānī sharḥ Ṣalawāt Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī' ..."
Secundo folio: athar asmāʼihi wa-ṣifātih.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the "Ṣalawāt" of al-Jīlānī in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Kawkab al-mabānī wa-mawkib al-maʻānī sharḥ Ṣalawāt al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn, taʼlīf Shaykhinā al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-humām, al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, man huwa malḥūẓ bi-alṭāf Rabbihi al-muḥṣī, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Tamm."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr ʻAẓm Zādah, Wajīh al-Muʼayyad ibn al-Ḥājj Aḥmad Muʼayyad, fī 6 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1206 [3 November, 1791]."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Kawkab al-mabānī wa-mawkib al-maʻānī sharḥ Ṣalawāt Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī' ..."
Between folios 53b and 54a is an insert, in a different hand, quoting commentaries from different authors on the Ḥadīth "Anā dār al-ḥikmah wa-ʻAlī bābuhā".
Folios 65-68 are blank.

Author's colophon: "Qāla al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Wa-qad ittafaqa al-farāgh min taʼlīf hādhā al-kitāb ʻashīyat yawm al-Jumʻah, al-tāsiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn min Shaʻbān, sanat sabʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."
Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, said: 'This book was completed on Friday evening, 29 Shaʻbān, 1127 [of the Hijrah = 30 August, 1715]."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak, ittifāqan, ʻashīyat yawm al-Jumʻah, al-tāsiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn min Rabīʻ al-Awwal, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat sittah wa-sittūn wa-miʼah <wa-miʼah> wa-alf, bi-khaṭṭ al-faqīr ilá Mawlāh al-Qadīr, ʻAlī ibn Bakrī Darwīsh, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the copyist colophon: "This blessed book was copied, coincidentally, on Friday evening, 29 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1166 [of the Hijrah = 3 February, 1753], in the handwriting of the poor to his Almighty Lord, ʻAlī ibn Bakrī Darwīsh, may God forgive him, his parents, him who reads it, him, who, invokes God to forgive him [the copyist], and all the Muslims. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Ṣalawāt ʻalá al-Nabī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-qawī, Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mujīrī al-Mullawī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Raḥīm al-Ghaffār, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-mukhtār, wa-ʻalá sāʼir al-nabīyīn, wa-ālihim wa-aṣḥābihim al-akhyār al-abrār, wa-al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān ilá yawm al-dīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi Ṣalawāt ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh [ʻalayhi] wa-sallam, jalīlat al-miqdār, asʼalu Allāh an yarzuqanī wa-kull man iʻtaná bi-hā al-ikhlāṣ wa-mazīd al-istibṣār ..."
Secundo folio: fī amrī. al-Ṣalāh al-thālithah.
14.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Wa-hādhihi Risālah fī ṣiyagh [ṣalawāt] ʻan [ʻalá] al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-muḥaqqiq, imām waqtihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Mullawī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tammat al-risālah bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá, wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The epistle was completed by the praise of God Almighty, His help and His abundant benevolence, thoroughly and perfectly. Praise be to God in all circumstances. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dārayn. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-Islām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā bi-hi min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, fa-al-gharaḍ fī hādhā al-kitāb dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-faḍāʼilihā, adhkuruhā maḥdhūfat al-asānīd li-yashula ḥifẓuhā ʻalá al-qāriʼ, wa-hiya min ahamm al-muhimmāt li-man yurīdu al-qurb min Rabb al-Arbāb. Wa-sammaytuhu bi-kitāb 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad al-mukhtār', ibtighāʼ marḍāt Allāh taʻālá, wa-maḥabbatan fī Rasūlihi al-karīm, Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam ..."
Secundo folio: Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam.
16.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding, with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative frame.
In beautiful and large naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; numerous commentaries on the margins; some collations with other copies; text within double red frames; catchwords.

On the preliminary page: An ownership statement: "Qad dakhala hādhā al-kitāb, bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, fī mulk al-faqīr, Dhikr al-Jalālah, Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Masʻūd Abū Ghazālah, ʻafá Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu. Āmīn. Sanat 1206 [1791/1792]."
On the verso of the preliminary page, in a different handwriting: "Tārīkh al-Aʼimmah al-arbaʻah, [wa] tārīkh al-aqṭāb al-arbaʻah ... manẓūmah wa-maḥsūbah bi-ḥisāb al-jummal."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, lil-Imām al-Jazūlī."
On folio 1a: Two illegible ownership statements.

On folio 90b: A reader's note: "Khutimat hādhihi al-nuskhah qirāʼatan thalāthamiʼat marrah, muddat shahrayn, ḥāla kawnihā ʻāriyah ʻindī. Ḥarrarahu al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad al-Ṣādiq al-Taqawī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-raḥim. Wa-ʻalá Allāh al-qabūl."

On folios 91b-92b: A prayer attributed to Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Badawī and a reader's note about it: "... wa-ajāzanī bi-hā al-Sayyid al-Sharīf Sayyidī al-Ḥājj Mujāhid al-Nawasānī ʻan Sayyidī Aḥmad al-Badawī ..."

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-kitāb ʻalá yad kātibihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Qadīr, Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Khawājah al-Wafāʼī al-Shāfiʻī, wa-dhālika fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, tāsiʻ shahr Shawwāl al-munawwar, sanat 1103 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-akmal al-taḥīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "This book was completed by the hand of its copyist, the poor to his Mighty Lord, Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Khawājah al-Wafāʼī al-Shāfiʻī, on Wednesday, 9 Shawwāl al-munawwar, the year 1103 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [24 June, 1692], may the best prayer and most perfect peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-02 al-Durr al-manḍūd fī faḍl al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ṣāḥib al-maqām al-maḥmūd : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-rajāʼī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtaṣṣa Nabīyanā Muḥammadan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-mā imtāza bi-hi ʻalá sāʼir al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn wa-al-malāʼikah al-muqarrabīn, wa-awjaba ʻalá al-kāffah tawqīrahu wa-taʻẓīmah, wa-al-qiyām bi-ḥuqūqihi, sirran wa-ʻalanan, li-yakūnū min al-muhtadīn. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah, lā sharīka lah, shahādatan antaẓimu bi-hā fī silk al-aʼimmah al-wārithīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-taqsīm wa-min thamma adrajtu.
16 x 22.3 cm; written surface: 10.3 x 17.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 8.5 mostly numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Durr al-manḍūd fī faḍl al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ṣāḥib al-maqām al-maḥmūd, taʼlīf Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, Shihāb al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, nazīl Makkah, sharrafahā Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Wa-taghammadahu bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-riḍwān, wa-jamīʻ mashāyikhihi wa-talāmidhatihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: "Rattaba al-muṣannif kitābahu hādhā ʻalá muqaddimah wa-fuṣūl sittah wa-khātimah ..." (The author organized his book in an introduction, six chapters and a conclusion, with descriptions of each part)
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Durr al-manḍūd fī faḍl al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ṣāḥib al-maqām al-maḥmūd' ..."
Folios 82-83 are blank.

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu: Wa-kāna ibtadaʼtu fī hādhā al-kitāb awākhira Ṣafar al-khayr, sanat iḥdá wa-khamsīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, wa-faraghtu minhu thamān Rabīʻ al-Awwal min al-sanah al-madhkūrah. Ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-talāmidhatihi, wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author said: I started writing this book at the end of Ṣafar al-khayr, the year 951 [of the Hijrah = 1 June 1544], and finished it on 8 Rabīʻ al-Awwal of the same year [9 June, 1544]. May God forgive him, his parents, his teachers, his students, and all Muslims. Praise be to God. Lord of the Universe."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb 'al-Durr al-manḍūd', ʻalá yad aḥqar al-ʻibād wa-afqarihim ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn ʻĀmir ibn ʻĀmir al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Shinnāwī ṭarīqatan, al-Wajīh laqaban, yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, min shuhūr sanat miʼah wa-alf wa-sabʻah wa-thalāthūn baʻda al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This book 'al-Durr al-manḍūd' [the Arranged pearls] was completed by the hand of the most despised of servants and the poorest to God Most High, the poor Aḥmad ibn ʻĀmir ibn ʻĀmir al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Shinnāwī ṭarīqatan, al-Wajīh laqaban, on blessed Monday, 1137 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [7 May, 1725], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. May god forgive him, his parents, all Muslim men and women and the believers, men and woment the living among them and the dead. Amen."

record.title: Selections from the Shāhnāmah : manuscript / Firdawsī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
17 x 29 cm; written surface: 11.2 x 21; in four columsn; 21 lines per column.
Binding: No binding.

In anstaʻlīq script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; each leaf has an illustrated minature, heightened in gold, interlinear coloring also in gold, a few crease-lines and minor surface scratches to paint; outer margins chipped and repaired; catchwords.

record.title: Dīvān-i Fuzūlī : manuscript / Fuzulî.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
13 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14.5; in single and double columns; 13-15 lines per page.
Binding: In contemporary marbled boards, rebacked in later cloth, extremeties slightly faded.
In anstaʻlīq script, in black ink on white paper; some darkening to the lower edges of the leaves; some scattered spottings and smudges; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An ownership stamp in the name of al-Sayyid Ismāʻīl Ḥaqqī.

record.title: 880-03 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 8 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Kitāb al-Ṣayd wa-al-dhabāʼiḥ wa-al-ʻaqīqah wa-al-aṭʻimah. Hādhihi al-kutub taqaddamat fī ākhir al-ʻibādāt. Kitāb al-sabq wa-al-ramy, wa-huwa al-munāḍalah. al-Musābaqah wa-al-munāḍalah jāʼizatān, bal, sunnatān, idhā quṣida bihimā al-taʼahhub lil-jihād. Qultu yukrahu li-man ʻalim al-ramy tarkuhu karāhatan shadīdah; fa-fī Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim ʻan ʻUqbah, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, Anna Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qāl: 'Man ʻalima al-ramy thumma tarakahu fa-laysa minnā', aw, 'qad ʻaṣiya'. Wa-Allāh aʻlam ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ammā al-musābaqah ʻalá al-taraddud bi-al-suyūf.
17.5 x 26 cm; written surface: 14 x 20 cm; 20-24 lines per page.
Binding: In black leather binding with central medallion. Cover heavily damaged.
In large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Vendor's description identifies this manuscript as volume 8.
On folio 1a: In pencil: "Fiqh. Awwaluhu al-Ṣayd wa-al-dhabāʼiḥ."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqaf lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
On folio 250a: Ownership statement: "Min kutub aqall ʻabīd Allāh, al-rājī ʻafwahu, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAlīm."
On folio 250b: Endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá."

Author's colophon: "Ākhir al-kitāb. Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb. Qāla muṣannifuhu [fī] mukhtaṣarihi, al-Shaykh Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Nawāwī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi, wa-askanahu [fasīḥ jannatih] bi-mannihi wa-karamih: 'Faraghtu minhu yawm al-Aḥad, al-khāmis [ʻashar min] shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat tisʻ wa-sittīn wa-sittimiʼah, aḥsana [Allāh khitāmahā]."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of the book. God is He who facilitates what is correct. Its author, al-Shaykh Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Nawāwī, may God encompass him in His mercy, and make him dwell in [His spacious Paradise], said [in] its abridgement: 'I finished writing it on Sunday, the fifteenth of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, the year 669 [of the Hijrah = 8 November, 1270], may [God ends it] well."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-mann Allāh, ʻazza wa-jall, wa-ʻawnihi. Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Khamīs, al-tāsiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir, sanat arbaʻ ʻashrah wa-sabʻimiʼah lil-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah.
