The copy of this blessed book was completed on blessed Saturday, 10 Muḥarram, 969 [30 September, 1561] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of the poor and despised servant, who admits his shortcoming and inadequacy, and hopes for the forgiveness of His praiseworthy Lord, Maḥmūd ibn Mawlānā Khalīl ibn Mawlānā al-Ḥājj Muḥammad al-Aydīnī, may God forgive him, his parents, his brethren and Muslim men and Muslim women, and the believers, men and women. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. If you were to find a blemish close the gap // Mighty and Sublime is the One in whom no blemish exists."

record.title: 880-02 al-Asrār al-Rabbānīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Būnī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a and the colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī adāra bi-yad al-asrār laṭāʼif aflāk al-malakūtīyāt, wa-abraza min khidhr [khidr] al-ghayb shumūs al-maʻārif li-dhawī al-ḥaqāʼiq al-ilāhīyāt, wa-aṭlaʻa min baḥr al-nūr al-aʻlá nafāʼis jawāhir al-ʻuqūl al-nūrānīyāt, wa-aḥkama iḥkām aḥkām tadawwiru dawāʼir al-akwān bi-al-ḥurūf al-iḥāṭīyāt, al-badīʻ alladhī abdaʻa ibdāʻ ṣuwarihā fī alwāḥ arwāḥ al-ʻawālim al-ʻulwīyāt wa-al-suflīyāt, al-muṣawwir alladhī ṣawwara kunh maʻānīhā fī ʻarsh al-nafs al-wāḥidah, fa-ẓaharat fī dhawāt al-anfus al-mutaʻaddidāt ..."
Secundo folio: al-tajallīyāt, fa-ḥamdan ʻalá hādhihi al-niʻmah.
15.2 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover with dark brown leather on spine.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some headings and markings in red; many magic squres and circles; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folios 1a (in pencil): "al-Asrār al-Rabbānīyah lil-Būnī."

On folio 1a: A statement by a reader/owner: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu, dāʻiyan li-ḥāwīhi an yaftaḥa Allāh ʻalayhi futūḥ al-ʻārifīn bi-jāh al-Nabī al-amīn, ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Āmīn."
Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-Asrār al-Rabbānīyah. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Sanat 1127."
Translation of the colophon: "These Divine secrets are completed. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. The year 1127 [of the Hijrah = 1715]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Manhaj al-maslūk fī siyāsat al-mulūk : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Naṣr al-Shayzarī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The first leaf of the manuscript is missing; starts with: "... mimman ātāhu Allāh mulkahu al-ʻaqīm [al-ʻaẓīm], wa-ahdāhu ṣirāṭahu al-mustaqīm, wa-awrathahu mashāriq al-arḍ wa-maghāribahā, wa-awṭaʼahu min al-mulūk riqābahā wa-manākibahā, wa-kāna mimman yará al-adab wa-faḍlahu, wa-yūrithu [wa-yuʼthiru] al-ʻilm wa-ahlahu, jamaʻtu li-khizānat ʻulūmihi hādhā al-kitāb, [wa-huwa] yaḥtawī ʻalá ẓarāʼif al-ḥikmah wa-jawāhir min al-ādāb wa-uṣūl fī al-siyāsah wa-tadbīr al-raʻīyah wa-maʻrifat arkān al-mamlakah wa-qawāʻid al-tadbīr wa-mā yalzamu ahl al-jaysh min ḥuqūq al-jihād, wa-nabbahtu fīhi ʻalá al-shiyam al-karīmah wa-al-akhlāq al-dhamīmah, wa-ashartu fīhi ʻalá faḍl al-mashūrah, wa-al-ḥthth ʻalayhā, wa-kayfīyat muḍārabat al-aʻdāʼ wa-al-nadb ilayhā ..."
Secundo folio: ḍarūratan ilá malik yuqīmu awadahā.
19 x 29.2 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; light brown leather on spine and flap.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some explanations on the margins; text within double red frames; catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf: "Bi-hi kharm min awwalihi ilan qawlihi 'mimman', wa-hiya al-ṣaḥīfah al-ūlá minhu."
On folios 1a: "... wa-sammaytuhu al-Manhaj al-maslūk fī siyāsat al-mulūk ..."
On folios 1a-1b: An index of the titles of the twenty chapters of the treatise.
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Jumʻah, ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, min shuhūr ʻām 1260 min al-Hijrah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taḥīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Friday, twenty days having passed from the month of Muḥarram, of the year 1260 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [10 February, 1844], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Mukhtaṣar al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd al-Āmulī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khaṣṣaṣa nawʻ al-insān bi-aʻdal al-amzijah wa-afḍal al-bunyān, wa-sharrafahum bi-ʻilmay al-abdān wa-al-adyān, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr man khalaqahu, Muḥammad, al-dāʻī ilá al-ḥaqq wa-al-burhān, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-maʻṣūmīn min al-zalal wa-al-ṭughyān. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-Mawlá al-aʻẓam wa-al-ḥabr al-mufakhkham, afḍal al-ʻArab wa-al-ʻAjam, Shams al-Ḥaqq wa-al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, al-Āmulī, raḥimahu Allāh: Innī lammā raʼaytu anna ashadd al-ʻulūm ḥājatan wa-aktharahā manfaʻatan, bal asnāhā martabatan, wa-aʻlāhā darajatan, huwa ʻilm al-ṭibb, al-mutakaffil bi-ḥifẓ mazāj al-insān bi-qadr al-imkān, al-muḥtāj ilayhi fī kull ḥīn wa-awān, ṣaraftu ilayhi ʻinān al-himmah, wa-ʻaqadtu bi-hi aʻyān al-azimmah, baʻdamā rajaʻtu ʻammā kuntu aʻtaqiduhu fī ḥadāthat al-sinn, wa-tayaqqantu anna dhālika kāna min baʻḍ al-ẓann, wa-ṭafiqtu ataṣaffaḥu fī akthar al-awqāt mā ṣunnifa fīhi min al-mabsūṭāt wa-al-mukhtaṣarāt, fa-lam ara fīhā aḥsan min al-Mukhtaṣar al-mansūb ilá al-ḥakīm al-muḥaqqiq, wa-al-ḥabr al-mudaqqiq, ustādh al-aṭibbāʼ wa-qudwat al-ḥukamāʼ, mafkhar al-sādah wa-al-nuqabāʼ, Ashraf al-Millah wa-al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Īlāqī ..."
Secundo folio: al-muʻālajāt ka-al-siḥr fī kharq al-ʻādah.
19.5 x 29.2 cm; written surface: 18 x 22 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding; cover embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative frame.
In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf: The Christian "Basmalah": "Bismi al-Āb wa-al-Ibn wa-al-Rūḥ al-Qudus al-Ilāh al-Wāḥid. Āmīn."
On the preliminary leaf: "Kitāb al-Qāmūs fī al-ṭibb wa-al-ṭabīʻah."
On folios 1a-1b: Table of contents of the codex.
Folio 2 is blank.

On folio 3a: A statement by a reader/owner: "Iqrār bi-al-jamīl lil-Kaḥḥāl al-nabīl, al-Duktūr Maḥmūd Labīb Muḥarram, min ṣadīqihi al-ḥamīm, Muḥammad Khalīl, bi-Dār al-Āthār al-ʻArabīyah, bi-Miṣr al-maḥmīyah. 18 Rabīʻ Awwal, 1330 [7 March, 1912]."

Colophon: "... Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-ḥaqāʼiq al-umūr wa-bi-khafīyāt al-ṣudūr. Wa-qad ḥaṣala al-farāgh min kitāb hādhā al-kitāb fī ʻishrīn min shahr Jumād al-Thānī, sanat 1122. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "... God is more knowledgeable of the truth of matters and what is hidden in the hearts. This copy was completed on 20 Jumād al-Thāni of the year 1122 [of the Hijrah = 16 August, 1710]. Praise be to God alone. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 1 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi zidnī ʻilman. al-Ḥamdu lillāh dhī al-jalāl wa-al-ikrām, wa-al-faḍl wa-al-ṭawl wa-al-minan al-jisām, alladhī hadānā lil-Islām, wa-asbagha ʻalaynā jazīl niʻamih, wa-karrama al-Ādamīyīn wa-faḍḍalahum ʻalá ghayrihim min al-anām, wa-jaʻala fīhim qādah yadʻūn bi-amrihi ilá Dār al-Salām, wa-ijtabá man laṭufa bi-hi minhum, fa-jaʻalahum min al-amāthil wa-al-aʻlām, fa-ṭahharahum min anwāʻ al-kadar wa-waḍar al-āthām, wa-ṣayyarahum bi-faḍlihi min ulī al-nuhá wa-al-aḥlām, wa-waffaqahum lil-dawām ʻalá murāqabatihi wa-luzūm ṭāʻatihi ʻalá takarrur al-sinīn wa-al-ayyām ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-mukhtār al-mujtabá min barīyatihi.
17 x 25.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; light brown leather on spine and flap.
In large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "al-Juzw al-awwal min Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, zayn al-ʻulamāʼ, imām [al-fuqahāʼ?], Muḥyī al-Dīn, Abī Zakarīyā, Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf ibn Murrī al-Nawāwī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Malakahu min faḍl Allāh [taʻālá] Muhannā ibn Yāsīn al-Shaṭṭah fī [...]." 2. "Intaqala hādhā al-kitāb, wa-huwa thamāniyat ajzāʼ, bi-al-ibtiyāʻ [al-sharʻī], min mulk Sayyidinā al-Shaykh ʻAlam al-Dīn al-Aṣfūnī [?] ilá Sayydī al-Shaykh [... ... ...] ibn al-Ḥasan al-Qūṣī, bi-shahādat kātibihi [... ... ...] ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻUthmān al-Makkī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhum ajmaʻīn." 3. "Malaka hādhā [hādhihi] al-mujalladāt al-thamāniyah, min awwal al-Rawḍah ilá ākhirihā, faqīr raḥmatihi wa-gharīq niʻamihi wa-ʻatīq raḥmatihi, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥasanī, al-shahīr bi-Ibn [... ...]."

Colophon: "Tamma al-juzʼ al-mubārak bi-minnat Allāh [wa-ḥamdih]. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ḥamdan yuwāfī niʻamah wa-yukāfī mazīdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, wa-sallama kathīran. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Ithnayn, al-sādis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat thalāth ʻashrah wa-sabʻ miʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Yatlūhu fī al-juzʼ al-thānī, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, Kitāb al-Zakāh."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed volume is completed by the grace of God [and His praise]. Praise be to God, a praise parallel to His graces and in accord to His abundance. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions and grant them abundant peace. Copied on Monday 26 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 713 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [29 July, 1313], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. It will be followed in the second volume, God willing, by the Book on Zakāh [Almsgiving]."

record.title: 880-02 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 2 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Kitāb al-Zakāh. Hiya aḥad arkān al-Islām; fa-man jaḥadahā kafar, illā an yakūna ḥadīth ʻahd bi-al-Islām, lā yaʻrifu wujūbahā, fa-yuʻarraf. Wa-man manaʻahā wa-huwa yaʻtaqidu wujūbahā, ukhidhat minhu qahran, fa-in imtanaʻa bi-qawm, qātalahum al-Imām ʻalayhā. Faṣl. Fiman tajibu ʻalayhi al-zakāh. Huwa kull Muslim ḥurr, aw, baʻḍuhu ḥurr; fa-tajibu fī māl al-ṣabī wa-al-majnūn, wa-yajibu ʻalá al-walī ikhrājuhā min mālihimā ..."
Secundo folio: mā yamlikuhu bi-ḥurrīyatihi ʻalá al-ṣaḥīḥ.
18 x 25.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 17.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap; cover embossed with central medallion; cover and flap tooled with decorative frame.

In large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords. The first twelve folios are written in a different hand, on a different kind of paper, and in ruqʻah script.
On the label on the front cover: "al-Juzw al-thānī min al-Rawḍah."
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thānī min al-Rawḍah, lil-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah al-Nawawī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-innahu law nadhara ṣawm sanah muʻayyanah, thumma qāla: 'In shafá Allāh marīḍī, fa-lillāh ʻalayya ṣawm al-Athānīn min hādhihi al-sanah.' Qāl: 'Lā yanʻaqidu al-thānī, li-anna al-zamān mustaḥiqq li-ghayrihi.' Wa-qāla al-ʻAbbādī: 'Yuʻqad, wa-yalzamuhu al-qaḍāʼ.' Qīla la-hu: 'Law kāna la-hu ʻabd, fa-qāl: In shafá Allāh marīḍī, fa-lillāh ʻalayya ʻatquhu, thumma qāl: In qadima Zayd aʻtiquhu'. Qāl: Yanʻaqid, fa-in waqaʻā maʻan aqraʻa baynahumā.' Hādhā ākhir al-qawl al-manqūl ..."

record.title: 880-02 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 3 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Kitāb al-Bayʻ. Bāb mā yaṣiḥḥu bi-hi al-bayʻ. al-Bayʻ muqābalat māl bi-māl, aw, naḥwihi. Wa-yuʻtabaru fī ṣiḥḥatihi thalāthat umūr: al-Awwal, al-ṣīghah, wa-hiya al-ījāb min jihat al-bāyiʻ, ka-qawlihi 'Biʻtuka, aw, mallaktuka, wa-naḥwihimā'. Wa-fī 'Mallaktuka' wajh ḍaʻīf. Wa-al-qabūl min al-mushtarī, ka-qawlihi 'Qabiltu, aw, ibtaʻtu, aw, ishtaraytu, aw, tamallaktu'. Wa-yajīʼu fī 'tamallaktu' dhāka al-wajh. Wa-sawāʼun, taqddama qawl al-bāʼiʻ 'Biʻtu', aw, qawl al-mushtarī 'Ishtaraytu', fa-yaṣiḥḥu al-bayʻ fī al-ḥālayn, wa-lā yushtaraṭu ittifāq al-lafẓayn ..."
Secundo folio: fa-qāla biʻtuka in qāla baʻdahu.
18 x 26 cm; written surface: 12 x 18 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap; cover embossed with central medallion; cover and flap tooled with decorative frame.

In large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords. Folios 1 and 2 are written in a different hand, on different paper, in ruqʻah script.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thālith min al-Rawḍah, lil-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah al-Nawawī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
At the lower left margin of folio 236a: A collation note: "Balagha muqābalatan, ḥasba al-juhd wa-al-ṭāqah. Wa-lillāh al-ḥamd ʻalá dhālik."

Colophon: "Tamma al-Juzʼ al-thālith min al-Rawḍah, bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfiqih. Yatlūhu fī alladhī yalīhi 'Kitāb al-Iqrār', in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Sabt, al-rābiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam, sanat thalāth ʻashrah wa-sabʻimiʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "The Third part of al-Rawḍah is completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence. It will be followed, in the next volume, God willing, by 'Kitāb al-Iqrār' [Book on Confession, Admission]. Copied on Saturday, the 24th of the glorious month of Ramaḍān, the year 713 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [20 January, 1314], may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-02 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 4 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi zidnī ʻilman. Kitāb al-Iqrār. Wa-huwa ikhbār ʻan ḥaqq sābiq. Wa-fīhi arbaʻat abwāb. al-Awwal fī arkānihi, wa-hiya arbaʻah. al-Awwal, al-muqirr, wa-huwa muṭlaq al-maḥjūr ʻalayhi, fa-al-maḥjūr ʻalayhi yaṣiḥḥu iqrāruhu. Qāla al-Ghazzālī, raḥimahu Allāh: Yaṣiḥḥu iqrāruhu bi-kull mā yaqdiru ʻalá inshāʼihi. Wa-hādhā bi-al-ḍabṭ yustathná minhu ṣuwar, minhā law qāla al-wakīl taṣarraftu kamā udhintu, fa-qāla al-muwakkil lam tataṣarraf, lā yuqbalu iqrār al-wakīl, ʻalá aḥad al-qawlayn, maʻa qudratihi ʻalá al-inshāʼ. Wa-kadhā law qāla istawfaytu mā amartanī bi-istīfāʼih, wa-nāzaʻahu kamā sabaq. Wa-minhā istinkāḥ al-bint ilá walīyihā, wa-iqrāruhu ghayr maqbūl, wa-yumkinu an yuzāda fī al-ḍabṭ, fa-yuqālu yanfūdhu iqrāruhu fī al-taṣarrufāt al-mutaʻalliqah allatī yastaqillu bi-inshāʼihā ..."
Secundo folio: ḥullifa wa-akhadha al-sahm.
17.5 x 26 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the label on the front cover: "al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ min al-Rawḍah lil-Nawawī."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá. Awqafa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

On folio 233b: An ownership statement: "Intaqala jamīʻ hādhihi al-ajzāʼ al-thamāniyah min al-Rawḍah ilá faqīr raḥmatihi, wa-gharīq niʻmatihi, wa-ʻatīq qudratihi, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣawwān al-Ḥusaynī al-shahīr bi-Ibn Qamar, laṭufa Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tamma al-juzʼ al-rābiʻ bi-mann Allāh taʻālá wa-taʼyīdih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Yatlūhu fī al-juzʼ al-tālī la-hu 'Kitāb al-Waṣāyā'. Nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi ṣāḥibahu wa-muṭāliʻahu wa-kātibahu, wa-ajzala al-nafʻ bi-hi li-muʼallifihi wa-li-wālidīhim ajmaʻīn, innahu jawwādun karīm, raʼūfun raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ḥamdan yuwāfī niʻamah wa-yukāfī mazīdah. ʻAllaqahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá ʻafw Rabbihi al-ʻAlī al-Kabīr Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Lakhmī nasaban al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, fī sābiʻ Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat thalāth ʻashrah wa-sabʻimiʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "The fourth part is completed by the grace of God Almighty and His support. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. It will be followed in the part which follows it with 'Kitāb al-Waṣāyā' [Book on Wills]. May God benefit with it its owner, its reader and its copyist, may He also abundantly benefit with it its author and all their parents. Praise be to God, a praise parallel to His graces and in accord to His abundance. Copied by the poor to the forgiveness of his Almighty and Majestic Lord, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Lakhmī nasaban al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Dated, 7 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, of the year 713 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [3 March, 1314], may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-02 Rawḍat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muftīn. Volume 5 : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: No incipit; the title page of this codex is missing; starts with part of "al-Bāb al-khāmis: Fī bayān māniʻ al-mīrāth", as follows: "... wa-fī baṭṭ al-jurḥ wa-saqy al-dawāʼ awjuh, ḥakāhu Ibn al-Labbān wa-ghayruhu, annahu lā yamnaʻu. Wa-ʻan ṣāḥib al-Taqrīb wajh fī muṭlaq al-qatl bi-al-tasabbub, annahu lā yamnaʻu. Wa-al-ṣaḥīḥ alladhī ʻalayhi al-aṣḥāb al-awwal. Wa-sawāʼun ṣadara al-qatl min mukallaf aw ghayrih. Wa-yajīʼu fī al-ṣabī wajh yatakharraju min al-qawl alladhī ḥakāhu al-Ḥannāṭī fī al-mukhṭī, idhā qulnā ʻamd al-ṣabī khaṭaʼ, sawāʼun fīhi al-mukrah wa-al-mukhtār. Wa-fī al-mukrah khilāf, wa-al-madhhab al-manʻ ..."
Secundo folio: wa-mawḍiʻ al-qawlayn mā qabl dhālik.
19 x 27.5 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 20.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; brown leather on spine and flap.

In clear ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and marking in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords; in 32 quires (some numbered); the last two quires written in a different hand in naskh script.
On the preliminary leaf: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá. Waqafa wa-ḥabasa hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr ilá Mawlāh, Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī al-Muballiṭ."
On folio 1a: al-Khāmis min al-Rawḍah lil-Nawawī.
Kitāb al-Waṣāyā which was to follow volume four, as was mentioned in the colophon of the previous volume, starts in the present volume at the end of folio 22a.

Colophon. No colophon. The text ends abruptly with "Kitāb al-Rajʻah", as follows: "... al-Rakn al-thānī. al-Zawj al-murtajiʻ. Wa-yushtaraṭu fīhi ahlīyat al-nikāḥ, wa-al-istiḥlāl, wa-al-bulūgh, wa-al-ʻaql; fa-lā rajʻah li-murtadd. Wa-law ṭallaqa rajul fa-junn, fa-yanbaghī an yajūz li-walīyihi al-murājaʻah, ḥaythu yajūzu ibtidāʼ al-nikāḥ, hādhā idhā jawwaznā al-tawkīl fī al-rajʻah, wa-huwa ..."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-ʻibar. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Khaldūn.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Kitāb al-thānī. Fī akhbār al-ʻArab wa-ajyālihim wa-duwalihim mundhu mabdaʼ al-khalīqah ilá hādhā al-ʻahd. Wa-fīhi dhikr muʻāṣirīhim min al-umam al-mashāhīr, mithl al-Sharānīyīn, wa-al-Nabṭ, wa-al-Kaldānīyīn, wa-al-Furs, wa-al-Qibṭ, wa-Banī Isrāʼīl, wa-Banī Yūnān, wa-al-Rūm, wa-al-ilmām bi-akhbār duwalihim. Wa-yataqaddamu al-kalām fī dhālik muqaddimatān. Aḥaduhumā [Iḥdāhumā] fī umam al-ʻālam wa-ansābihim ʻalá al-jumlah. al-Thāniyah fī kayfīyat awḍāʻ al-ansāb fī hādhā al-kitāb ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-Ṭabarī wa-al-Bukhārī ilá jawāz al-rafʻ.
24 x 33.5 cm; written surface: 14.5 x 24.5 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In buckram binding with dark red leather on spine.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text within double red frame; catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf (in pencil): "al-Juzʼ al-thānī."

Colophon: "Intahá al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Tārīkh al-ʻAllāmah Ibn Khaldūn, raḥimahu Allāh raḥmatan wāsiʻah, bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb fī 25 Jumād al-Ākhir, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1269, tisʻah wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-taḥīyah, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Jamal al-Damshīhī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, bi-mannihi wa-karamihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Part two of the history of the learned scholar Ibn Khaldūn, may God have abundant mercy upon him, is completed, by the praise of God Almighty and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. This book was copied on 25 Jumād al-Ākhir, 1269 [5 April, 1853] of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and purest peace be upon him, by the hand of the poor to God Almighty, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Jamal al-Damshīhī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims, by His grace and benevolence. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-ʻibar. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Khaldūn.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-rajāʼī wa-ʻalayhi iʻtimādī. Kāna li-Banī ʻAbd Manāf fī Quraysh jall min al-ʻadad wa-al-sharaf, lā yunāhiḍuhum fīhi aḥad min sāʼir buṭūn Quraysh. Wa-kāna fakhdhāhum Banī Umayyah wa-Banī Hāshim, ḥayyan jamīʻan yantamūn li-ʻAbd Manāf wa-yunsabūn ilayhi, wa-Quraysh taʻrifu dhālik wa-tasʼalu la-hum al-riyāsah ʻalayhim, illā anna Banī Umayyah kānū akthar ʻadadan min Banī Hāshim wa-awfar rijālan. Wa-al-ʻizzah innamā hiya al-kathrah. Qāla al-shāʻir: Wa-innamā al-ʻizzatu lil-kāthirah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-istaʻmala Yazīd ibn Abī Sufyān ʻalá al-Shām.
23.5 x 33.5 cm; written surface: 14.5 x 24.5 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In buckram binding with dark red leather on spine.
In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; text within double red frame; catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf (in pencil): "al-Juzʼ al-thālith."

Colophon: "Intahá al-juzʼ al-thālith min Tārīkh Ibn Khaldūn, al-musammá bi-al-ʻIbar. Wa-yalīhi fī al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ Akhbār al-Dawlah al-ʻAlawīyah wa-al-muzāḥimah li-Dawlat li-Banī [Banī] al-ʻAbbās bi-Miṣr baʻda Baghdād. Intahá al-Juzʼ al-thālith ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr al-murtajī raḥmat al-Mawlá al-jalīl, Ismāʻīl ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Damshīhī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Taḥrīran fī 22 B, 1269, tisʻah wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man khalaqahu Allāh ʻalá akmal waṣf."

Translation of the colophon: "Part three of the History of Ibn Khaldūn, titled 'al-ʻIbar' is completed. It will be followed by Part four, on the history of al-Dawlah al-ʻAlawīyah [State of the Alawites], which rivaled Dawlat Banī al-ʻAbbās [the State of the Abbasids], in Egypt after Baghdad. The third part is completed by the hand of its copyist, the poor, who admits his inability and insufficiency, and hopes for the mercy of the Glorious Lord, Ismāʻīl ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Damshīhī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and on his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace, until Judgement Day. Written on 22 B [Ṣafar], 1269 of the Hijrah of Him whom God created in the most perfect stature [5 December, 1852]."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-ʻibar. Al-Juzʼ 4 : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Khaldūn.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Akhbār al-dawlah al-muzāḥimah li-Dawlat Banī al-ʻAbbās, wa-nabdaʼu minhum bi-Dawlat al-Abārisah [al-Adārisah] bi-al-Maghrib al-Aqṣá. Qad taqaddama lanā dhikr Shiʻat Ahl al-Bayt li-ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib wa-banīh, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum, wa-mā kāna min shaʼnihim bi-al-Kūfah wa-mawjadatihim ʻalá al-Ḥasan fī taslīm al-amr li-ghayrih, wa-iḍṭrāb al-amr ʻalá Ziyād bi-al-Kūfah min ajlihim, ḥattá qatala al-mutawallūn kibar dhālika, minhum Ḥujr ibn ʻAdī wa-aṣḥābuh. Thumma istadʻaw al-Ḥusayn baʻda wafāt Muʻāwiyah, fa-kān min qatlihi bi-Karbalāʼ mā huwa maʻrūf. Thumma nadima al-Shīʻah ʻalá quʻūdihim ʻan munāṣaratih, fa-kharajū baʻda wafāt Yazīd wa-bayʻat Marwān. Wa-kharaja ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Ziyād ʻan al-Kūfah wa-sammaw anfusahum al-Tawwābīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-sallam li-ʻAlī bi-al-imāmah.
22.3 x 34.2 cm; written surface: 14.5 x 24 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with dark red leather on spine.
In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; text within double red frame; catchwords.

Colophon: "Intahá al-Juzʼ al-rābiʻ min Tārīkh Qāḍī al-Quḍāh Ibn Khaldūn, al-musammá bi-al-ʻIbar. Wa-yatlūhu al-Juzʼ al-khāmis, fī Dawlat Ṭughrulbik wa-banīhi wa-ghayrihim min al-Saljūqīyah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-dawām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, arbaʻat ayyām khalat min shahr Ramaḍān, sanat 1270, sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, min Hijrat man khalaqahu Allāh ʻalá akmal waṣf, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Ismāʻīl ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jamal al-Damshīhī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, bi-mannihi wa-karamihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Part four of the History of Qāḍī al-Quḍāh [Chief Judge] Ibn Khaldūn, titled 'al-ʻIbar' is completed. It will be followed by Part five, on the State of Ṭughrulbik [Tuğrul, Sultan of the Seljuks, approximately 993-1063] and his sons and other Seljuks. Praise be to God continuously. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them abundant peace. Copied on blessed Tuesday, four days having passed from the month of Ramaḍān, the year 1270 of the Hijrah of him whom God created in the most perfect stature [31 May, 1854], by the hand of its copyist, the poor to God Almighty, Ismāʻīl ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jamal al-Damshīhī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims, by His grace and benevolence. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-ʻibar. Al-Juzʼ 5 : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Khaldūn.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 3b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Khabar ʻan Dawlat al-Saljūqīyah min al-Turk al-mustawlīn ʻalá mamālik al-Islām wa-al-dawlah bi-al-Mashriq kullihā ilá ḥudūd Miṣr, mustabiddīn ʻalá al-Khalīfah bi-Baghdād, min khilāfat al-Qāʼim ilá hādhā al-zamān, wa-mā kāna lahum min al-mulk wa-al-sulṭān fī aqṭār al-ʻālam, wa-kayfa faʻalū al-ʻulamāʼ [bi-al-ʻulamāʼ] wa-ḥajazūhum, wa-mā tafarraʻa min dawlatihim min al-duwal ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ankarūhum mujāwirūn lil-Rūm.
223.5 x 32.5 cm; written surface: 14 x 23.5 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with dark brown leather on spine.
In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.
On folios 1a-1b and folio 248b: Texts on the rule of Ṣalāḥ al-Dīn al-Ayyūbī (Saladin, Sultan of Egypt and Syria, 1137-1193) and his successors.

Colophon (folio 245b): "Wa-ilá hunā qad intahá al-juzw al-khāmis min Tārīkh al-ʻAllāmah Ibn Khaldūn, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Wa-yalīhi al-Juzw al-sādis, alladhī awwaluhu: 'Istaqallat Muḍar wa-fursānuhā wa-anṣāruhā min al-Yaman bi-al-Dawlah al-Islāmīyah, fīman tabiʻa dīnahum, ilá ākhirihi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-juzʼ al-mubārak yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, iḥdá ʻashar yawman khalat min shahr <Muḥarram> Ṣafar, aḥad shuhūr ʻām 1272, ithnayn wa-sabʻīn khalat baʻda al-miʼatayn wa-al-alf, min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jamal al-Azʹharī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Here ends Part five of the History of the Learned scholar Ibn Khaldūn, may God Almighty have abundant mercy upon him, by His grace and generosity. It will be followed by Part six, which begins with: 'Muḍar, by its cavalry and allies from Yemen, gained mastery over the Islamic state, with those who followed their [its] religion, etc.' Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. This blessed part was copied on blessed Monday, eleven days having passed from the month of <Muḥarram> Ṣafar, of the year 1272 [23 October, 1855] of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs nobleness and honor, may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor to God, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jamal al-Azʹharī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him. Amen."

record.title: Sigismondo Casanova lecture notes on a course in philosophy : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Ownership inscription on recto of front flyleaf: "Ex libris est Sigismondi Casanova de Valt dictatus a Joane Obach anno a nativitate domini 1700."
Poem in Catalan addressed to St. Thomas Aquinas on recto of front flyleaf.
Title page for "Secunda pars" on recto of 1l. Title page for "tertia pars" on recto of 70l. This title page includes the date "die 19 aprillis anno 1700."
Inscribed at end of text, verso of l196: " Sigismundus Casanova. V. OBACH."
An "index questionum" follows the text.
Title in contemporary lettering on spine: "2 et 3 pars Cvr Phae."
Binding: contemporary limp parchment; remains of ties.
